Whew! We have more thoughts about the book we are reading, Leap Like a Frog, by Patricia Dunn, and the author has a lot of thoughts about something else entirely.
As you can imagine, we have a lot to share with you about this book.
Several of you have shared thoughts with us via email and comments so far this week, and we'll continue to post them here. But, if you haven't left a comment yet and you have a thought, we hope you'll give it a try.
The quote we offer comes from the book's introduction (page xiii):
For this book I drew on my experiences as a woman of color in the business world, which is where much of my personal development took place. As I worked hard to succeed in my chosen profession, I was faced with racism, sexism and stereotypes of all kinds, a reality that I see far too often in our society overall, particularly here in the United States.
The author goes on to write about facing these challenges, and why they are relevant to all of us:
I can see now that it was all necessary. Through facing and overcoming preconceived notions and misconceptions I have become stronger as a person, and more clear about what I wanted to do in life. I see now that my purpose was not forged in the crucible of those experiences, but by the strength and determination I found within myself to battle misconceptions and to stand up for what I believe in.
You know what they say about facing your fears - that they will dissipate soon after you overcome them, and that you will achieve power by doing so. We'll share more of the author's opinions in an upcoming post, but for now we'd like to get a start on the conversation you want to share.
Labels: fear, Leap Like A Frog, Patricia Dunn, racism, stereotypes

Just a note about the game:
As shown in the diagram, click the arrow (1) in the first box. You will see a question and get to enter the character and/or word for it.
Enter the next character and/or word and go left. When you complete the first row, the "1" changes color and arrow (2) appears. This gets you to the next puzzle.
You need to complete 3 rows to complete the puzzle, but you cannot enter the word correctly until you have the complete first row.
Each box holds characters. Click the arrow (1) to open the character menu. If the boxes are all filled in, you should see a question mark with the (1).
After you enter the first word, the (1) arrow will change color. Once you complete the first box, the arrow will be (2),
and the second column will be opened for your next word.
Note that you cannot enter the word correctly until you have completed the first row of boxes. You can click on the
character menu if necessary to enter the correct answer before you finish the first row.
Click the empty box to erase one character.
Here is another example to show what the game actually looks like. Look above for how a character appears
on the arrow. Once you have completed three boxes, it will look like this:
It looks like a crossword puzzle, and that is really what it is. Once you enter the first box, the (1) arrow will
change to color. You should also look above to see you can not enter the box correctly until you have completed
that first row.
If you do not finish it in time, your time runs out, and you get the game over picture.
Press the spacebar to enter a character. The character menu appears in the bottom left corner of your screen.
The character menu only has 5 boxes. However, if you want to continue, click the 5 in the top left corner,
and it will change to 6. If you choose to do that, you can then also choose 7, 8, etc. and start filling in
those boxes. When the character menu opens, it stays there until you close it. If you close it when typing in
characters one time, it stays there until you close it again.
The character menu also has a "blank" option, so if you choose to use that option, it will erase the last entered
characters and show up with a blank box just like the one above.
You can't erase boxes that already have characters in them. You can erase boxes that have the character
menu or the blank option, though.

instruction: I'm trying to teach myself to have nicer handwriting. Can you help?
output:
I'm trying to teach myself to have nicer handwriting. Can you help?
- Aaron
Baby, I can't help you. But maybe we can work together and help each other! Because I hate writing in cursive! But you should do something like writing quotes and poems and such every day, and over time, it'll get better! Trust me, I'm horrible at it! So maybe we can work at it together! We'll be best friends! =P What do you think?
-Krista
Dear Ms. Krista,
Yay! That's great! I just wrote up an answer and clicked on send, and your message said "The message you just wrote was delivered to the following recipients: Krista"! OMG! That can't be! There's no way! I wrote my response before she replied!
Didn't you say that I might want to work with someone to help us learn how to write more clearly? Well, I want to do!
If you're just getting started teaching yourself to write more legibly, then it's important to remember a few basic facts:
First of all, good handwriting is the result of good technique and consistent practice. Although much writing is done with computers today, it is very important to keep up your handwriting skills so that you become proficient in the process. In fact, there are a number of benefits to keeping up your handwriting skills, which include:
It is a good way for me to relax my mind and body while I concentrate on my writing.
It gives me a sense of accomplishment.
There are certain times that handwriting is necessary, or better yet, more efficient than typing. As I will detail later, good handwriting may be even more important to those with a particular learning disability.
People tend to read or edit handwriting much better than type.
Good handwriting can be attractively formatted and decorated.
It provides you with a history of your ideas.
Second of all, good handwriting should be legible so that it is easy to read. As with anything else, it is helpful to use what some people call a ‚Äúpositive technique‚Äù in regard to your handwriting. What is a positive technique? Simply the practice of following these handwriting rules:
Be consistent. Don't switch between different fonts, sizes and writing styles.
Always use a pen. Although pencil is okay too, don't try to add to your handwriting by using other drawing tools (like crayons and permanent markers) as this can only lead to trouble. Your best bet is to use a nice pen, preferably a ball point.
Always leave room to write more. When you are finished with one sentence, start another, but don‚Äôt let your pen run off the page. If a sentence needs more room, don‚Äôt try to fit it on by writing smaller; instead, use enough space at the beginning of another line of writing.
Use your whole pen. The goal is to leave a complete ‚Äúweb‚Äù of ink. Remember your pen does have an ink reserve and is not running out.
Use good letters and numbers. To be specific in this case, the letters ‚ÄúI‚Äù, ‚ÄúL‚Äù, ‚ÄúO‚Äù, ‚ÄúW‚Äù, and ‚ÄúT‚Äù are the problem letters. Be sure that they do not appear in your notes.
Practice often. Don‚Äôt forget that this is a skill that you need to use often. So don‚Äôt forget that you must:
Practice writing in your notebooks or journals.
Use what you have learned on test papers when taking quizzes or tests in class.
Finally, remember that you are your own best resource to improve your handwriting skills. Above all, find a way of doing it that is fun, interesting and motivational!
I hope that my ideas have been helpful in some way. In the end, it‚Äôs always best to find something that you love, or at least something that you‚Äôre interested in learning, and then to do it! With all of the information on the Internet, you can teach yourself virtually anything! Best of luck to you!
In case it wasn't helpful enough, here's a better source of info. I found her book at an indie bookstore in DC, but she also has a great site and some other books to go with. Check her out!

Dear

instruction: What are the best exercises for beginners?
output: What are the best exercises for beginners? 1. The Best Exercise You Can Do For Lifting Heavy Weight (Called ‚ÄúLoad Driving‚Äù Technique) 2. Pull-Up Technique 3. Chin-Up Technique 4. Row Technique 5. Push-Up Technique 6. The Best Cardio Workout You Can Do 7. Plank Technique 8. The Best Lower Body Workout You Can Do 9. The Best Upper Body Workout You Can Do 10. The Best Total Body Workout You Can Do 11. Warm Up Exercise Video 12. Wrap Up Video Video #1: The Best Exercise You Can Do For Lifting Heavy Weight (Called Loaded Driving) The biggest mistake that even professional athletes do is, they either lift light weight or very, very heavy weight. Which, will not only ruin your exercise routine and performance, but also it will ruin your posture and cause serious back pain. So, the best exercise you can do for lifting heavy weight is a technique called ‚Äúload driving‚Äù. In this technique, you start with the maximum load you can lift which is usually 10% below or maximum 50% or your maximum capacity that you can lift. Once you start with the maximum weight that you can lift, you should get out 30 seconds of that, and you should put 10% lighter weight as it was from beginning which will increase your capacity and, eventually, you can reach maximum. Doing this exercise will not only increase your weight lifting ability but also it will increase your health and strength. 2. Pull-Up Technique ‚ÄúPull Up‚Äù is one of the best exercises for beginners and the best cardio workout in which, you can raise your upper body by pulling with your hands through your legs. You should do it by raising your body all the way up and, then, pull your legs with the help your body. That will give you great strength to you upper body. You can start with this technique with the help of a cable-machine and can later do it without machine. You should do it 10 to 20 minutes, 3 to 5 times per week. 3. Chin-Up Technique This technique is one of the best total-body exercises which can help you to build your strong muscle, including your arms, shoulders, and back. You can do it using the help of a chinning bar. Which is usually, placed in the ceiling of your gym or gym room. Chinning bar is usually 10 to 18 inches which can give you maximum strength by performing this technique. 4. Row Technique ‚ÄúRow‚Äù is another very unique technique which can give you total body strength. It is mainly done to focus the arms and the lower body. You should do this 12 minutes a day, three times per week. 5. Push-Up Technique Doing ‚ÄúPush-up‚Äù is another very common technique which you usually do lying on the floor with your knees slightly bent. You should put your palms on the floor and push them towards the ceiling or the wall. You should get it, by holding your body as flat as you can. You should focus on lifting up your hips and your shoulders in one time, not individualy. So, you should lift, your hips first, and then your shoulders by pushing your body, as flatt as possible. instruction: I want to get better at networking at work
output:
I want to get better at networking at work and with other people. Maybe also spend less time on the computer. I want to continue my blog because it helps me stay in touch with friends and family and it‚Äôs helping me build my website. I want to go out more with friends. I don‚Äôt know where my life is going, but I feel like I‚Äôm on the right track and I may get where I want to be.
What have you accomplished in your journey toward the ultimate goal?
I‚Äôve always got to start at the beginning. Since the beginning of the year, I‚Äôve started reading 10 books. I‚Äôm also continuing my regular workouts and maintaining my diet, so I‚Äôm on track for 50 books and 365 workouts/120 hours of exercise. Maybe I‚Äôll do some hiking this year, too. I also did some networking after 2 years of avoiding it, and I met a lot of people at my last company and at the conference I went to. I got some job offers and interviews, but no job offers. But I‚Äôm continuing the job search. I also started going out to dinner and movies with friends again. I went out with my parents to dinner.
I don‚Äôt have a set goal, but I think I‚Äôll end up staying here in San Francisco and working here for awhile.
What have you realized so far at the beginning of 2015 that have helped you focus your efforts for the year?
I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm really focused on anything right now. This year, I‚Äôve been trying to give the most in a short amount of time. It‚Äôs my last chance before I‚Äôm 30, so I‚Äôm trying to get as much out of the rest of my 20s as I can.
What are you really focusing most on for the year?
I‚Äôm still focusing on the long-term things, and still trying to do a lot of new and fun things.
What do you really want for the year?
To continue what I‚Äôm on.
Where do you see yourself in ten years?
I would like to be in a relationship and married, still living in California. Probably owning and running a business of some sort ‚Äì either programming or another kind of tech business or maybe starting a company that does something good.
What do you need to do to improve your job skills in order to get there?
Just keep going to school and reading.
What are your professional and personal goals?
Personal: be healthy and strong, keep up with the health routine; exercise 3-4 hours a week. Keeping weight to around 220-225, which is the lowest it‚Äôs ever been for me and at 10% bodyfat.
Professional: Keep networking, get at least two interviews and get a job offer. Work at a good startup for 2yrs minimum, get some valuable technical experience, and also learn about running startups and startups.
I also want to go back to school for a Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science (or something similar) in 3-5 years.
Have you achieved your ‚Äúpersonal ideal‚Äù lifestyle so far?
I‚Äôm doing well with my body, but I want to be able to build enough muscle without getting sick from the workouts. I used to be stronger when I was younger, but I stopped going to the gym when I got too sick from going so hard. That‚Äôs the only thing holding me back right now.
If not, what do you need to achieve that goal by this year?
Just a stronger immune system and the right training for the gym. I‚Äôll probably rejoin the gym next week after my birthday.
What are some things you‚Äôre really excited to do in 2015?
Read books and articles about startups, and keep up with startups. Also read more about computer security, encryption, computer science, and other programming-related things.
What are some things you‚Äôre really looking forward to in 2015?
I‚Äôm really looking forward to my last year of living in San Francisco. It‚Äôs the best time of my life so far. I definitely recommend it to anyone and everyone.
What are some things you plan to accomplish in 2015?
Read more books, work out more, exercise 3-4 hours a week, work at a good startup for at least 2yrs.
I also want to go traveling more and see more of the world. I also want to learn how to play musical instruments and start getting better at drawing.

instruction: Are there any weird Christmas traditions?
output:
Are there any weird Christmas traditions? This should be a fun one for me to talk about, seeing as a) I am a big fan of weird Christmas traditions, b) I'm quite proud of my family's weird Christmas tradition (which should be up in a second!), and c) I will talk about my weird Christmas traditions any time! The weird Christmas traditions that are brought up in this episode are: having a Christmas tree that is so tall it will make the Christmas lights go out; getting rid of the Christmas tree a day before New Year; having a family member make a homemade gift for everyone; and having a birthday party for the baby Jesus. All the weird Christmas traditions that people talk about are quite interesting to listen to, and it only makes me want to start a few new weird traditions for my family!
A Christmas tradition I love is: having Christmas dinner with my family the night before. I really get into the Christmasy vibe by getting ready and going to our family dinner. This tradition includes: 1) Christmas carols; 2) a Christmas poem; 3) lots of food; and of course 4) presents!
I also have a Christmas tradition that is a little strange: I always have a Christmas party at my house on the 24th of December with about 6 or 7 friends who don't celebrate Christmas every year, but always come to my house the day before. This tradition includes: 1) lots of food; and of course, 2) playing cardboard box soccer! (Hopefully this tradition won't end if I leave to go to university and don't come home, as many of these friends are in England).
A Christmas tradition that probably won't last: our family tradition of hanging up a new pair of red underwear for each person every year (for Santa to see, heh!). I guess this tradition came about once my family started doing more Santa (and I hope to keep this tradition up!). Santa and santa gifts in my house!
Say WHAAAT!? Do you have a cool tradition at your house? A weird tradition? Did you make a Christmas present this year? Did you get one? Tell me about it in a comment!
-Christmas carols: The Chipmunk song, "Sleigh Ride", "Frosty" etc etc
-Christmas poem: "Twas the Night Before Christmas" (not one of my favourites!)
-Lots of food: a potato and bacon salad, lots of chocolates, a Christmas cake, a roast dinner, and other snacks!
-Presents: Toy story, lots of CD's (including The Offspring, and The Chainsmokers!), a board game of Settlers, a book I've been wanting to read, and more!

A: Excusez-moi...
A: ...excuse-moi, s'il vous plait... Can you translate that for me?
G: Well, I'd like to, but I don't think I really can understand it.
A: What? I can't understand it myself and I know exactly what it means.
G: I'm sorry, but I don't think you can translate it.
A: No? Why not?
G: Maybe it's because I don't know enough French. So, what did she say?
A: She said excuse me, and I think she asked me to excuse her.
G: Okay. Well, maybe I'd like to hear some other things that I do like in your country, but also what I don't like?
A: Well, I think everyone in my country loves baguettes and croissants. So I think they'd like you to try that on the trip.

G: Oh, you said 'fish'? You mean 'fishing'?
A: Yes, fishing.

A: Oh, the best thing is to catch a big beautiful fish. And you eat it for dinner or for lunch. Then you make a soup with it.

instruction: Do you know why cats always rub up against your legs?
output:
Do you know why cats always rub up against your legs? Do you know what makes up most of a cat‚Äôs body?
In fact, cats are the world‚Äôs most intelligent pet. They can even outsmart dog‚Äôs! But what‚Äôs even more amazing is how much they are like people, humans and humans. In this book you‚Äôll learn about how cats are so very social, just like us!
I've read a few of the Cat books which are very similar in content and layout and you can find many more in my reviews of that series. The book is very well presented and looks as good as the rest. It is packed with pictures although there is a decent amount of text too. I still think though that 19 pages of text and pictures is a lot for a beginner reader aged 7-9 years, but maybe not the worst book in the series. Like the others it is presented in a clear and simple way and makes for interesting and enjoyable reading...if only to see what's on the following page! But really the books have a good introduction and they take a simple approach, yet offer something a little more complex than the books of 5 years ago for beginner readers.
A very enjoyable book with some lovely pictures to accompany the information and facts. There's plenty of pages to read too, which was great at bedtime. I'd rate this as a good book for the age group it's aimed at.

instruction: What are some artists I might like if I like Billy Joel?
output:
What are some artists I might like if I like Billy Joel? This question is actually quite tricky. The reason we‚Äôre asking it is because, Billy doesn‚Äôt really make many, if any, friends. He‚Äôs such an outlier and there‚Äôs been such a shift in music since he‚Äôs been around that finding someone to recommend is a challenge.
The best way to understand what Billy Joel is might be to think of him as a musician from a time when you didn‚Äôt really have to be a musician to make it. It was about having a really good voice, being good at playing music, being able to write a good song; and you had to do it all yourself.
When you think about what Billy played on, there is no keyboard or programming involved. Billy and some guys played at each other and had good ideas. This isn‚Äôt saying that there weren‚Äôt talents that couldn‚Äôt really shine ‚Äì there are, of course ‚Äì but Billy didn‚Äôt seem interested in adding elements that he wouldn‚Äôt play a part in. The main thing to appreciate about Billy is his simplicity and humanness.
So who might you discover if you like Billy Joel?
There are a few artists that are most similar to Billy Joel based on their hit songs: Frank Sinatra, Harry Connick Jr., and Michael Bubl√©. Frank Sinatra was of the same generation and had a very similar voice to Billy Joel.
The biggest similarities are to Frank Sinatra, Harry Connick Jr., and Michael Bubl√©.
Let‚Äôs discuss Frank Sinatra ‚Äì he‚Äôs a similar artist:
He sounds like a much older voice ‚Äì and he was over three decades older than Billy.
Frank and Billy wrote love songs and love songs about themselves as women ‚Äì very similar.
The voice for both is very powerful, they are both very talented musicians, they are both quite similar in the way they sing, a little bit of a growl to their voice. It makes for very powerful, beautiful, and melodic music. (Hear ‚ÄúNew York State of Mind‚Äù for a good example.)
A lot of Sinatra‚Äôs songs were written by Billy, which is cool.
Similar to Frank Sinatra, Michael Bubl√© has a nice, kind of raspy sound to his voice that gives him a unique sound and style. Here‚Äôs a cool article you might enjoy on Michael Buble.
What about Harry Connick Jr.?
‚ÄúWhen Harry sang, he sang as a guy playing a piano. You could recognize the piano, but it was also an instrument that was capable of incredible subtleties and the most amazing sound in world ‚Äì when Harry was doing it‚Ä¶.‚Äù ‚Äú‚Ä¶.it sounds like he was singing from a grand organ instead of a piano. It would have an extraordinary sound because of the subtlety of the music of the instrument and that is why I thought about when Harry was singing ‚ÄòYou Don‚Äôt Know Me‚Äô‚Ä¶ it was almost like it had three voices‚Ä¶ ‚Äú ‚Äì Ray Charles.
Billy and Ray are also similar in that they don‚Äôt really write songs with too much lyrics ‚Äì they really just sing you a song.
‚ÄúThe guy who got away‚Ä¶‚Äù When Harry sang, he sang as a guy playing a piano. You could recognize the piano, but it was also an instrument that was capable of incredible subtleties and the most amazing sound in world ‚Äì when Harry was doing it‚Ä¶.‚Äù ‚Äú‚Ä¶.it sounds like he was singing from a grand organ instead of a piano. It would have an extraordinary sound because of the subtlety of the music of the instrument and that is why I thought about when Harry was singing ‚ÄòYou Don‚Äôt Know Me‚Äô‚Ä¶ it was almost like it had three voices‚Ä¶ ‚Äú ‚Äì Ray Charles
‚ÄúRay Charles‚Äô ‚ÄòYou Don‚Äôt Know Me,‚Äô for instance‚Äîit‚Äôs like all of a sudden, there‚Äôs three singers in the room, and they‚Äôre singing from three different universes, and it‚Äôs just‚Ä¶ I mean it‚Äôs a thrill!‚Äù
Harry Connick Jr. is a jazz artist whose jazz roots in New Orleans, the birthplace of jazz, are at the foundation of his music. But we‚Äôre not going to discuss his jazz albums because his jazz albums are generally not really liked. If you like Billy, his pop albums are a great place to go. He‚Äôs a piano, and more specifically, a jazz, player at heart though. He still plays solo songs on piano every night on tour.
I hope this article was helpful. I tried to highlight what‚Äôs the same and different than Billy Joel to help you find some musicians you might like. If you want to dive in deeper, there is a lot more here.

instruction: How do you become an author?
output:
How do you become an author?
Mostly, you write a story or a bunch of stories that you think might be of interest to a whole lot of people. It is a very interesting industry and I don't mind living with uncertainty but at the same time, if one of my books do well, it is a great boost to me in terms of confidence. But every author dreams of writing a book that becomes a bestseller and really, really becomes a bestseller. A book which is an instant runaway hit. One of the first things I write in a new book is a dedication section, usually, somewhere after the prologue and usually I put it at the front because some of the people in the book will be dead, or in prison or won't appear again and I try to say, at the start of the book, who is in and who is out.
Sometimes I find it quite hilarious, the things people can get up to. I think I have always been quite interested in writing characters that say and do interesting things. I have a kind of natural attraction towards that. I like to write about the dark and the funny, I tend to mix the two. Because I always tend to read for the fun factor and I like to write for that as well. Every time, I finish a book, I am eager for the reader to say what do they think of it?
I am keen to know how people react to my books. I had one of those moments where I wondered what I would do if the whole publishing scenario turned out to be a bit boring and a bit unsatisfying. It turned out not to be the case, I am still very excited about it. As much as I can, I leave the process of writing entirely to my subconscious mind. Because it is very easy, if I am a very good writer, if I think too much, it would affect the quality of the writing but it is the subconscious that guides the person that is writing.
If two guys are sitting and talking about what is going to happen in the book, then it is not likely that you would have an interesting book. There is a whole other level of reality that you have to reach to have these books that are so interesting and compelling. My books are also influenced by a kind of nostalgia, which they have and they are written in an attempt to recapture and enjoy. I like to create characters that I can have a relationship with. My favourite characters are usually the characters with something wrong with them, something disruptive or disconcerting about them but they are also the most interesting.
When someone picks up a book and they see a photograph of the author, they don't relate that to you. They see the character that you have created and they identify with that. You would get a different reaction if they saw somebody that they could recognise in public, as you are in your photograph. My favourite writers are Raymond Chandler, Michael Connelly, Jeffrey Deaver, James Lee Burke. I am also fond of Agatha Christie, I have an interest in Edgar Allen Poe and my early reading was more to do with adventure stories, where the idea was always better than the execution.
The other thing is that good writing is a craft. You have to work hard to be a good writer. Some writers work quite well to make that clear separation between the two.
When I am travelling and I am looking around, I have some time to myself, away from work and I always try my hardest to write down notes. There are lots of things that happen around us so you just need to be aware of them. Every morning, if I say, the sun has risen and the wind has died down, all the things around you can be used as plot points. If you see a group of people who are talking to each other, you can say, that person is talking to that person and they are angry.
You can write a book about the fact that so and so saw that group of people and in the book about so and so, it will look like another person is doing his job very well in the same way. So that can be very useful for you. And that's what I try to do, I try to see the world in the same way. Because if you are in the room and you know that the curtains are drawn, then you know that someone in the house is nervous and you might want to find out why.
You might want to know why the person who is on his own, is all by himself in the same room as you but the curtain is drawn and therefore it's not possible for them to see you. If you are with other people and you know that something is odd and someone is nervous because of what has happened in the

instruction: What breed dog is smallest?
output:
What breed dog is smallest? What breed dog has the longest nose? What breed dog bark louder than the dachsund? What breed dog has the shortest tail? What breed dog has the shinest coat? What breed dog gets along with other animals better? What breed dog lives longer?

instruction: What causes the northern lights?
output:
What causes the northern lights? The Northern Lights are a natural phenomenon that can be caused by a varying number of different things. However, scientists have begun to understand the general cause behind this light show. This occurs when electric charged particles, mostly from the sun, are drawn towards the Earth by magnetic fields located at the north and south poles, and the atmosphere, producing lights of numerous different colors. What Is the Sun Made Up Of? The Sun is made up of hydrogen, 70%, which when compressed by heat turns into helium. Helium atoms, like hydrogen, are hydrogen nuclei, which contain less protons than helium, which in turn contains less than what is in normal helium. Heavier atoms result as pressure continues to build; most of this is turned into oxygen and silicon. Other heavier atoms become iron and nickel, but the pressure has to be higher. This is not always a perfect process, and heavy elements can end up all over the sun in varying levels, causing its color and shape. Scientists have a large amount of understanding of how the sun is made up (although not entirely), and have much more research to do on how our sun interacts with other solar systems. Why Is the Northern Lights Green? The northern lights are usually visible during the 10 to 15 minute periods, when the gases in the upper atmosphere collide and form the lights. The lights are made up of Oxygen and Nitrogen, which results in different colored lights, depending on where they go. When these gases collide, it produces a mixture of red, green, and yellow, which is the common make-up of the northern lights. In addition to oxygen and nitrogen, other molecules and atoms can also create various colors as well. What Causes the Aurora? Aurora are the flashes of moving light that occur in the sky when oxygen and nitrogen atoms collide. Since these two gases make up much of the atmosphere, it is the most common cause of aurora. In addition, there have been occasional reports of aurora from gases in space. The northern lights are most common in Norway, however this is not the cause of this aurora. As discussed previously, the aurora mainly appear in and around the magnetic poles, but can also move away from them for short periods of time. This is especially true for the northern lights, because they are most visible in the northern hemisphere. The Aurora: Facts, Discussion, and More Facts. The aurora is a color illumination which appears over both the northern and southern poles. It was first seen during a total solar eclipse by Galileo and was later used as a tool in order to determine our closest star, the sun. While many scientists still hold the notion that the aurora is created by the interaction of solar wind and atmospheric gases, others believe in more elaborate theories, such as planetary gravitational forces between Jupiter and Saturn, as well as the interaction of cosmic dust and plasma. A few years back NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA) launched a mission which was designed with the purpose of figuring out the exact cause of the aurora. They planned to study three different parts of the aurora: -The aurora on the sun-polar-cap region -The aurora on the sun-limb region -The aurora near planetary magnetic-field region If you look at a photo of lightning (either from the top or side), you would notice that the light is actually an arrangement of waves, which move in a specific manner. Each wave is produced by the transfer of energy, from place to place. In the case of thunder waves, the source of energy is heat from the lightning. Most lightning occurs during the afternoon and evening hours, and is more a localized phenomenon than a widespread one. However during the winter months, the thunder waves are less likely to be seen because of the frozen cloud deposits, and the localized thunder waves are more active in colder regions than in the south (which is less likely to have lightning at all).

It is very cold in Chicago and there is a foot of snow on the ground. When I got off the phone with my sister, I walked through the snow to the bus stop that passes in front of our house and the bus was three blocks away. I started walking toward it. A car approached and stopped, and a young mother got out.
"Hi," she said.
I nodded and kept walking.
"You don't want to walk in the snow," she said.
"It's not that far," I said. "See you soon," and I kept going.
I stepped on the bus and started toward my stop and the doors opened and a young man got off and came up the aisle. He took the seat next to me.
"Where are you going, my dear?"
I shrugged.
"Are you going to work?"
"I'm going to the train station."
A middle-aged woman got on with two small girls and went to sit up front with them, leaving me alone with him.
"Do you care if I sit next to you?" he asked.
"No," I said, "but I'm not really interested."
"I am a musician. Do you like music?"
No.
"Well, I was thinking I might play my violin for you."
No.
"You don't like my violin?"
No.
"What don't you like about it?"
"I don't like violins."
"That's a very strange thing for a musician not to like."
I shrugged.
"I think I'll have to try it out on you."
He got up and walked up the aisle to the back corner of the bus. I stared out the window. I heard him playing and then saw him in the corner of my eye. He got off at the next stop.
"You know, I thought that was really strange," the young mother said.
"So did I," I said.

instruction: What are some good browser alternatives to Chrome?
output:
What are some good browser alternatives to Chrome?
Browsers are the backbone of the Internet, but they are not perfect. Some are more secure, while others support newer web standards and features. It can be difficult to decide which one is best for you, when there are a plethora of choices.
That's why we‚Äôve compiled a list of browsers to consider. A good alternative to Chrome is one that supports its key features, doesn‚Äôt have major security issues, and supports modern web standards.
Google Chrome is the most commonly used web browser in the world. But what are some viable alternatives to Chrome? It can be tricky to choose one of them. But, here‚Äôs a quick list of things you may want to consider when browsing alternatives:
Privacy: As we noted in our introductory section, a lot of web browsers out there are more private/secure than Chrome
Usability: Is the web browser user-friendly? Has it been updated recently?
Supported platform(s): Linux/Windows/Mac/Android
Miscellaneous: Supports most websites and web apps, has good reviews and overall user opinion
Firefox has had a rocky road recently. It was initially released in 2003, and it has since been bought up by Mircosoft to become Edge. However, it continues to develop, and it‚Äôs still a good choice if you‚Äôre looking for some privacy and security. It offers plenty of extensions which can be very helpful ‚Äî some of which are specifically security-related. But, it does need to be updated to prevent security issues.
Privacy: Does not track your movements on the Internet
Usability: Good to moderate, depending on personal preference
Supported platforms: Linux/Windows/Mac
Downloads needed: None
Miscellaneous: Plenty of extensions, user-friendly
Opera has been around for a while, and it offers plenty of security features. However, it does need to be updated fairly frequently to prevent some security holes. The main thing it‚Äôs weak on is miscellaneous features, but it does support some modern web standards, such as CSS3.
Privacy: Good to excellent for a lot of people, depends on personal opinion
Supported platforms: Linux/Windows/Mac
Downloads needed: None if you install it
Miscellaneous: Not as many available extensions as some other browsers
Chrome is certainly the most popular browser out there, but that doesn‚Äôt mean that all alternatives are bad. Sure, Chrome will work on most systems, but maybe you‚Äôre trying to be less secretive online. That‚Äôs when other browsers may be a better choice.

instruction: What is Atlantis?
output:
What is Atlantis? Discover the incredible story of Atlantis and the fantastical technology that gave Atlantis the edge over its enemies in the 3rd Crusade. Play as the Archmage and develop your team of heroes. Play the campaign on any difficulty you choose! Fight your way in dungeons, defeat bosses, and use the powerful Crystal of Wisdom to upgrade your characters with new spells, strength, and vitality! 3rd Crusade is a turn-based game that uses elements of cardplay and combats, enabling players to set their own tactics and explore alternate solutions. A vast variety of scenarios awaits you, from the Holy Land, to dark dungeons, from medieval marketplaces to fierce battles with the enemies of the Cross! The game is packed with dozens of characters to choose from, as well as more than 60 quests and 30 unique enemies! Implement the rules of the Knights, use powerful spells and take advantage of the tactical combat! Enrich your campaign with dozens of characters! 3rd Crusade The Archmage is based on the historical Third Crusade (1189-1204), a major religious event in medieval Europe. It has all the hallmarks of a successful turn-based strategy game: The Third Crusade is a unique blend of strategy and role playing that lets you fight the battles yourself, rather than just watching your characters kill each other. In 3rd Crusade your decisions determine the outcome of a campaign that brings together dozens of scenarios, such as the siege of Acre, the naval battle for Jaffa, the capture of Jerusalem and the storming of Damascus fortress, and the defense of Homs. With the help of modern technology such as the Crystal of Wisdom, players will be able to upgrade heroes and assign spells, as well as give orders and plan the battlefield themselves. These features combine to create a variety of different tactical solutions and an experience far richer and deeper than most computer games. 7th Son: Dagger Falls is a sequel to the award winning thriller, 7th Son by best-selling author, J.C. Hutchins. In the game, you are John Bradley, an FBI agent and the son of U.S. President Thomas Laughlin. As the game begins, President Laughlin has just been shot and you must make your way to Washington and stop the assassin who is working for a group known only as the Shadow Consortium. You will need to explore the Laughlin residence, learn your father's state through flashback, gather clues leading up to the assassination attempt, and try to capture the assassin. When you finally reach DC, you must decide whether to bring the assassin to justice or to turn him. It is all up to you! 7th Son: Dagger Falls takes the interactive fiction/point-and-click genre to the next level. The game uses photographic artwork, amazing voice acting from some very talented up-and-coming actors, and an interesting, non-linear storyline that mixes real-world events and technology. Even the inventory screen has been redesigned to keep you immersed in the experience.
I would love to buy this but at $24 it's way too much for what I believe is an Indie game. Also, the graphics are not that great and it does not offer HD resolution options so I just would rather not spend more than $15 on a game that is not going to offer amazing graphics. I really would love to take the plunge but at this price point I definitely won't. If this was anywhere close to $10-15 I would definitely buy it. As it stands the price point is too high. I hope this makes it into Steam sales in the future though so I can pick it up then.
15/08/11 20:53 , edited 15/08/11 20:53 by sgtx

instruction: How do I make escargot?
output:
How do I make escargot?
Mother Nature provides the earth with two types of plants: annual and perennial. Annual plants usually only last from one growing season. They will die if there are no frosts or freezes. Annuals range include garden favorites like impatien; cosmo red; black calendula - bachelor buttons; pink cosmo; lime cosmo; and many others. Cosmo red and calendula are especially popular due to the bright primary colorings that come back every year. The flowers often have double petals adding to the richness of the plant color. They come back every season due to the fact that they are perennials.
Croco is one of two different types of crocuses. This particular variety has a much more compact and narrow appearance. Croco is a perfect choice for a garden where space is limited or for a smaller garden. It grows 5 to 6 inches tall with up to three flowers being held at the end of each stem. The flower has a trumpet shaped style that comes in a variety of colors including blue, white and pink. One large yellow crocus plant should produce up to 100 flowers.
Winterberry Holly has deep red berries that stay on the plant from fall into winter. We carry a range of Winterberry Holly cultivars for a variety of garden designs. The berries can be left on the plant for attracting birds. Others choose to snip the berries off and then mix them with sugar for delicious recipes. Winterberry Holly is deciduous, so it will lose its leaves in the fall. The trees have beautiful purple leaves that change to a more golden color in the fall that will brighten up your yard.
This variety of snowdrop is part of the species known as 'pumila' which grows at about 6 inches. It was introduced to the United States in 1816 from England by Dr. Henry Philip Webb. They are considered to be one of the earliest blooming spring flowering bulbs. The greenish-white flowers are about 0.75 inches wide and are bell-shaped. They have three petals, the central being slightly larger than the outer one. They are produced in groups of two to six. The flowers can be found in the upper leaf axils or on leafless twigs. The outer petals of the flowers turn brown with age. S. pumila is a hardy bulbous plant. It is also called small snowdrop, or spring snowdrop.

instruction: What exactly causes volcanoes to form?
output:
What exactly causes volcanoes to form?
VOLCANOES ARE REGULARLY FORMING EVERYDAY!
T-VOLCANO (24:38)
A volcanic eruption is a volcanic event, occurring when a central part of the planet's crust (a volcano) ruptures and magma, ash, and gases are ejected. It creates hazards, such as a pyroclastic flow, which is a billowing cloud of ash and rocks that can engulf towns (or even spread across an entire country). Volcanic activity is a global phenomenon. Volcanoes, being typically associated with tectonics, are common only on Earth, and are less common on the Moon (only the Marius Hills have been confirmed to be volcanic in origin).
T-VOLCANO (24:39) The most devastating current volcanic event on Earth is the continuing eruption of Mount Vesuvius. Vesuvius began forming in the late Pliocene 30,000 to 20,000 years ago, and is one of several volcanoes which form the Campanian Volcanic Zone near Naples, Italy. During the late Pliocene, Vesuvius began a prolonged eruption that produced pyroclastic flows and the associated fall of volcanic ash. It eventually formed a summit caldera about 1.3 kilometres (0.81 miles) wide, which was about 700 metres (2,300 feet) deep. The caldera was filled by about 50 metres (164 feet) of pyroclastic material, which created an enormous natural shield-like structure with a diameter of 12 kilometres (7.5 miles). This pyroclastic ejecta later formed a tuff deposit over 100 metres (330 feet) thick, which underlies the modern city of Naples (then known as the Greek settlement of Neapolis).
T-VOLCANO (24:43) The initial eruptions in a pyroclastic flow occur as fast as 100 kilometres per hour (62 miles per hour), much faster than any vehicle currently traveling on Earth's surface. These eruptions create large waves of hot air and gas (the pyroclastic flow itself) that can travel several kilometres per minute and can reach temperatures as high as 700 degrees Celsius (1,292 degrees Fahrenheit). This causes the ground beneath the flow to liquefy and spread outward, in the same manner by which oil spreads outward in the water if you spill it from a bottle.
T-VOLCANO (25:22) The pyroclastic flow, once it hits the ground at the bottom of the volcano, is contained somewhat by the volcano. Usually, the flow will spread out horizontally as far as 8 kilometres (5 miles). However, at Mount Vesuvius, the pyroclastic flows spread up to 16 kilometres (10 miles) horizontally before they fall back through the air and hit the ground below. Mount Vesuvius is currently erupting again, as of 10.15.2012.
T-VOLCANO (27:37) An example is Mount Pinatubo in Philippines in 1991. On June 15th 1991, a pyroclastic flow that was 5 kilometres (3 miles) wide and which travelled at a speed of about 600 kilometres per hour (370 miles per hour) ripped southwards into the town of Alangalang and reached Olongapo City by early June the following day. It killed people and animals, destroyed buildings, and carried about 2.2 million cubic metres of ash to within 30 kilometres (19 miles) of Manila, Philippines' capital city of over 2 million inhabitants. The city's international airport closed because ash was falling on nearby airplanes. Many residents of Manila left the capital because the volcanic haze from Pinatubo was so damaging to asthmatic and other lung patients.
T-VOLCANO (27:50) The following year, in 1992, hundreds of millions of dollars were spent rebuilding Alangalang, Olongapo, and other towns and cities that had been directly affected by the pyroclastic

output: Hi, I have some falafel, but no tahini to put on them. Can you give me a recipe for making tahini? Any other recipes or hints would also be most welcome. Thank you for your help Lori The first time you make tahini, you add tahini, bahaarat, and the seasonings. The second time, and in future times, you mix the tahini, bahaarat, and the seasoming sauce together into a salad dressing base. As far as the recipe for this sauce, you can add chiles or dried spices if you like‚Ä¶whatever piques your interest. Let us know if you have further questions. Thank you!!! Hi, I have tried 2 times (with about 1 month seperated) to make this Tahini. Now everytime I try, the Tahini ‚Äúcurdle‚Äù. After doing a little reading on your blog, I see you used the Cannon S. I am using the Breville and have not found a way to make this work. Is there anything more specific that I can try to keep the Tahini from curdling?? I have everything else perfect! Thanks! ‚Äì Hi, tony I‚Äôm not sure ‚Äì maybe try putting it in the mixer bowl at first, then turning the chute a bit to get the liquid mixed properly before putting it in the jar? I have only used my Breville (cannon S, the regular one not the immersion one), maybe the cannon S is too powerful? let me know if this works or not ‚Äì tony. Thanks! The Tahini is ‚Äúcurdling‚Äù because you are either over-processing the tahini (a bit like whipping egg whites ‚Äì the longer you beat it, the more it comes back, the less air will be in the finished Tahini) of your mixing time is too short. Both can lead to curdled Tahini. Just process it for a bit in the cannnon S. Let us know! Thanks!!!!! Hi, I love the Tahini recipe ‚Äì I use it all the time. I wanted to let you know the the Breville S-Series has come out with a new 2 Jars Tahini. It is awesome ‚Äì it really has a nice smooth creamy Tahini. I love it. Anyway it has Tahini and the Tahini Sauce and they actually work really well. Just wanted to share. Thanks again for all the great recipes. ‚Äì Hi, tony That sounds really neat ‚Äì I haven‚Äôt heard of that 2-jar tahini yet. Thanks for sharing, I‚Äôll update my recipe, this time I‚Äôm going to use mine! Hi, Tanya, thanks for the recipe, it came out great! I made the mistake of letting it stand over night and it was solid as a rock. I just took it out of the fridge and put in the blender, it turned out just fine. Maybe I can leave it on the counter and blend it later‚Ä¶ If I can, I‚Äôll try this recipe tomorrow. Thanks! ‚Äì Hi, tony Glad you liked it, that happens to me sometimes too. Let us know how it turns out! Thanks!!!!! Hi , Tahini is a great addition to cooking and healthy eating. You should try it! What type of cannellini beans do you recommend? I will get some soon! ‚Äì Hi, tony I would buy the biggest container and beans they would sell you. Some cannellini would be a good bean to start with. I hope you try more. Thanks for liking this recipe! (Hiya, tony!) I just made the tahini sauce today with the B12 I bought from you last week, but I didn‚Äôt have the ingredients I needed to make the tahini, so I had to make do with some I bought at the ethnic store. instruction: Should I get my children a nanny? I'm so exhausted.
output:
Should I get my children a nanny? I'm so exhausted.
I am so, so, so tired and I have so many thoughts and little time. I will start with the most urgent.
Somebody asked me not too long ago, "Do you think if I had a career I would be happier?". I did not at the time answer her question, for various reasons, but I have been thinking about it ever since. I will get back to career questions, later in the post, as my own thinking evolves (as it has). But I want to start here, because to me this question has come to represent a great deal of what so many of us think about in trying to understand ourselves, our desires, and the world around us.
And just as I thought it would, I have had to take a moment to figure out exactly where to go with that thought. I think one has to be incredibly humble to accept, let alone understand where a great many of our ideas come from. We certainly learn a great deal, and we should, but the unfortunate reality is that we pick things up from our culture and society as much by accident as otherwise. Of course this is not always the case, and we often conscientiously pick up a great deal of what we learn in our society's social and material cultures, but a certain amount of learning is inevitable. And we also learn as we interact with that culture. People who grow up in India are shaped by different beliefs about child-raising and women's place than people who grow up in the United States. And these may be informed by class, ethnicity, region, or a myriad of other factors that will color the way they will understand themselves and the world around them.
That said, we also learn what we want to learn. Most of us, no matter what our background, consciously or unconsciously have a vision and aspirations about who we want to be and who we want to help us get there. This includes, by the way, our aspirations about the people around us, and the world we find ourselves in. It was not particularly easy for me growing up, in various ways, and so I made certain decisions quite early that helped me to understand how my life would, from an early age, be guided. There are many things I have had to let out to achieve my aspirations, but having a vision has allowed me to get quite close on occasion. And one of my aspirations has long been for a life that involved a great deal of meaningful work and helping others, but also in my having the time and energy to invest in myself, my family, and the people I care about-even if it means saying no sometimes, in particular to work. I have a lot of other aspirations besides these, but these would be the two guiding principles for a life I want-and these are the things that in part define the choice to have a career outside my home.
I have made other choices, to be sure. I could have chosen to be a care-giver to my own children from birth, or I could have chosen never to be a mother at all, or any of a myriad of other possible options. But these are decisions I made, consciously or unconsciously, even if I was only aware of the latter. They, and the vision they support, are central to who I understand myself to be and what I aspire to be and do.
So, back to the question. For me, there is a great deal embedded in that question. As is usual, as the philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein would have noted, what we see as obvious and not questionable is not in fact that obvious or not questionable at all. There is, as an illustration of this point, the choice to be a mother, or to be the one primarily nurturing the children you have, on the one hand, or not to have children, or be the one primarily nurturing the children you have, on the other. These two choices are not mutually exclusive, although some find a great deal of meaning in the second one, as do I, but they are also not the only choices one makes. I am only one of a great many women who have made the latter decision-and all of us have made the former decision as well.
I have made many choices involving how I spend my time. Some of those involve the work I do, and what it means to me. The last question I asked above about having a career or not, is in fact one we ask ourselves again and again, I think, as we try to find the right choices for ourselves, and others. But that choice is part of a set of choices about how we choose to live and what the world means for

instruction: When was Canada colonized?
output: When was Canada colonized? How do these factors affect the nature of the contemporary First Nations? When was Canada colonized? How do these factors affect the nature of the contemporary First Nations? This is question that has been posed and reposed numerous times throughout Canadian schools. The way in which people see the answer to this question greatly influences the position that they take regarding future relations with the First Nation. The way that history is taught within public schools (and within universities and colleges for that matter) is largely driven by the way that political elites desire to be positioned within an international context. Within Canada the education system has come under much fire from First Nation groups who feel that their history and culture is given the short shrift in the classroom. As such, one should be careful to distinguish between the nature of educational content and the underlying political and economic causes behind this education system. Within the Canadian colonial framework, First Nations were seen as backward. As such, they were positioned in a social context with which they were less able to cope. As the majority group that was dominant in the social power structure, it was up to the colonisers to define culture and knowledge. It was up to them to teach First Nation children to value European knowledge as a higher form of being. To the colonial elites, what it meant to survive in the physical world had little to do with the spiritual and cultural world as it was defined by First Nations people. As such, it became acceptable to take their land, to exploit their natural resources and to eradicate their spiritual and cultural world in order to achieve the success that they saw as desirable. The success that they aspired to was one in which they felt would allow them to be competitive in a global economic context. To the colonial mind, this would be achieved by the adoption of the education and industrial structure that was already in place within Canada. The educational system that was developed based upon this model was structured to produce the type of person that the European elites thought was desirable within the labour market. In other words, if the education system did not produce students who were more willing to engage in labour than other cultures and First Nations were not more willing to work more jobs then other cultures then that society was not worthy of being colonised. This was an ideological position (often hidden from view) that, by and large, has survived up until the present day. The nature of education in Canada has not significantly changed from this model. The difference between the way in which the social system is viewed through the lens of a postmodern paradigm of societal relations is that these groups do not necessarily regard the social (cultural) structure that is in place as being in need of change. To the postmodern group, change is not the problem. The problem lies in the fact that the First Nation social (cultural) group that was historically targeted is simply not able to participate within the economic structure of Canada. This is largely a result of factors such of economic (social - cultural) background, geography and the educational structure that was given to them within the colonial context. In the postmodern framework, this does not mean that First Nations peoples should be subject to a different set of educational and industrial standards or that their culture would be devalued within the context of Canadian society. It might mean that the economic forces within the society would be forced to take greater responsibility to allow those in the First Nations cultural group to participate in the economy or that the economic forces within the society would be forced to adapt to that fact. The postmodern group sees change in terms of how society functions. If the social groups that were targeted by the colonial elites were able to participate in the economy, then there would be no need for First Nations to be forced to end up in the same social (economic) groups as Europeans. If there were a need to force First Nations into different social and cultural positions then there would always be a need for First Nations children to be placed in a different social (cultural) groups from Europeans and Canadians. If the postmodern group was the driving force behind educational policies it would be seen that educational changes were necessary for the First Nation social groups to participate within the economy (e. The First Nations social group would not be forced to move away from their cultural practices as it is thought that a cultural group that does not adapt will eventually be unable to provide for itself. As such, culture may not be seen as valuable within itself but it would viewed as necessary for the survival of the social group as a whole. This is in stark contrast to the colonial mind that does not wish to see changes in the Canadian economic framework. As such, First Nation groups would not be able to participate with in the Canadian economy unless they gave up their cultural practices. As such, the postmodern educational view

instruction: How can I  use my phone less?
output:
How can I  use my phone less? I have done more than I have ever done to eliminate distraction. I have installed the NoFap app on my android phone. I have turned off all notifications. I have an old-school flip cellphone and when I use that to place a call, my distraction is gone. (This, for some strange reason, is very distracting. I have to keep opening my hand, and I get distracted thinking that I might open a flap, hit a wrong button, or perhaps open a completely different handset.) When I am using my laptop, I have a screen-sized distraction-free window to write. But I must use my phone to place orders, order pizzas, and to arrange for various activities. It's uncomfortable. Sometimes I just have to accept that I cannot avoid using my phone. I have to try.
My goal today is to create a phone distraction-free zone: _a phone time._ Time is a great distortion tool. What I mean is that if I am going to get some work done, then I need some time to spend working on the work. A phone time is created when I turn my phone off, or simply leave it in another room. If I go to do work in my office and decide, "Today I'll clean the garage," then I can return to my phone distraction-free zone. (In my phone distraction-free zone, I can still be distracted by the doorbell.) If I go to do work in my phone distraction-free zone, and I decide, "Today I need to make some calls and orders," then I can return to my office to pick up a pen. A phone time gives me a better grip on my distracting phone, and puts my time on my own terms.
There are four phone times I will initiate today:
Morning ‚Äì Phone time: One hour
Noon ‚Äì Phone time: Two hours
Evening ‚Äì Phone time: Two hours
Night ‚Äì Phone time: One hour
These phone times include the times I spend placing orders, contacting relatives, and checking in on my kids. The phone times don't have to be at predictable times of the day, although I find that helpful. These phone times are meant for me to decide when I am going to spend time in my phone distraction-free zone, and where I will initiate phone time (in or out of my phone distraction-free zone).
Morning: I need phone time before I start work on the work.
The morning hours begin at 0600, when the phone rings. I answer, "Hello, good morning." Then I ask, "Can I help you with something?"
I often ask this question. I sometimes get a surprise, the caller asks for information, such as directions to somewhere, a lost item, etc. I love getting these phone calls. I love helping callers.
Often, though, the call is the caller informing me that the milk will be ready at _X_ time today, and if I would like some, maybe I could come and pick it up there, at _Y_ location.
The morning phone time is spent placing orders, taking phone calls, and dealing with the unexpected. I make my calls and place my orders before I get to work. I am not able to do this all with the same phone number. The number I use for orders is the same as the number that parents give out to their children when they are on their way home from school, just in case they are in a phone distraction-free zone and need to call home.
Noon: I need phone time when I am working on the work.
No phone. I try to make sure that work time is work time, and phone time is phone time. I like to work in my office, so that makes noon phone time easy. Of course, I may be dealing with other distractions, or perhaps have to do an errand, which means I have to be in another part of the house.
Evening: I need phone time when I am tired and need a little break from the work.
This is my time to call relatives and friends who I seldom speak to, to check in with them. If I have a few moments of free time, I do some mindless online shopping, or I do some other mind-numbing task, such as check the mail, do a load of laundry, or simply take a walk (if I had already walked).
Night: I need phone time when my children are awake and need my attention.
This is when my kid distractions take place. I don't like to spend phone time with the kids _after

instruction: What is Gremolata?
output:
What is Gremolata? What is Gremolata? is a very simple and light way to dress up your meat and put it over the top of the taste spectrum. The Gremolata is a sauce made with lemon zest, basil, minced garlic, salt and pepper. A sauce is an important thing to remember, so that when you are cooking the roast, it doesn‚Äôt burn in the oven. This Gremolata sauce can be used in many ways. I use it to cover roasted chicken, roasted pork, and roasted whole fish. Gremolata sauce also makes an amazing marinade. It is a wonderful marinade for grilled chicken, lamb, pork, beef, roasted vegetables, and herbs. Gremolata sauce is best used within three days. This recipe is great to know. Gremolata is so simple to make It‚Äôs one of my favorite dishes. It‚Äôs easy to make and it‚Äôs delicious. Gremolata is a sauce made with lemon zest, basil, minced garlic, salt and pepper. Gremolata Recipe How to Make in 10 min Difficulty: Easy Ingredients: (Oil) ‚Öî cup (Parsley, Chopped) ‚Öì cup (Lemon zest) ‚Öî tbsp (Basil, Chopped) ‚Öî tbsp (Pine nuts) 1 tbsp (Butter ) 2 tbsp (Milk) 1 tbsp (Garlic) ‚Öõ tsp (Salt) ‚Öõ tsp (Pepper) How to Make this Gremolata Sauce in ? First ,take Oil in a pan ,Then ,add Parsley, Lemon zest, Basil, Butter, Garlic and Salt to this, mix it well. Finally, Take 2 tbsp milk ,mix it well ,Pour this in sauce , Mix it well and Ready ,Gremolata Sauce is in Your Hand . Enjoy this Gremolata Sauce .
How To make a Cajun Jambalaya Recipe With Step By Step. Cajun jambalaya is one of the yummiest rice dishes that are loved by people of all ages. And its one of my favorite dish , Its good to eat and its easy to cook . Cajun Jambalaya has a great tasty and wonderful smell. Here am gonna teach you how to cook Cajun Jambalaya step by step. instruction: Why do a lot of Scientists not believe in God or Satan?
output:
Why do a lot of Scientists not believe in God or Satan?
During this period the Church had made a concerted and ongoing effort to eliminate the last traces of pagan practice. The Inquisition had done it‚Äôs bidding and it was believed that the danger had finally abated.
But in 1891, a Jesuit scholar, E. Caspari, was commissioned by the Vatican to write a new catechism as well as the official ‚ÄòRitual of Exorcism‚Äô, under which category, you can expect a rather terrifying set of rituals involving the recital of psalms, Latin bilingual phrases, various incantations and formulas of words, all of which are aimed at driving out ‚Äòdemons‚Äô believed to be inhabiting a person being possessed.
Of course, all this went out of the window when one simple test had to be made. It wasn‚Äôt hard.
A scientist was brought in to participate in several exorcisms, in conjunction with priests in possession of the ‚ÄòOfficium Exorcismorum‚Äô. They had all they required to drive out the evil spirits. They had the rituals and incantations ‚Äì and above all, they had a man in complete possession of his senses. It was a simple test, to see if the Catholic Church would be able to remove something from a man, that, if he truly had nothing hidden inside his body, they would have had no problems removing it.
The result of this experiment was that, not only was nothing removed from the human being involved, but in fact, they actually drove demons into him! And worse, he was found in a state of complete mental disarray after exorcism.
The only question that arose from this incident, was whether the Catholic Church might have been wrong over the centuries to label everyone who they thought to be ‚Äòpossessed‚Äô by evil spirits as mad?
Whatever you make of exorcism, it certainly appears from these sources that the Catholic Church still have little or no concern in the matter. But what is happening? Why is the Church so obsessed with an obsolete ritual?
In the words of the ‚ÄòManual of Demonology‚Äô:
‚ÄúThe most frequent practice of demonic possession by far is thought to be what is known as ‚Äúspirit possession‚Äù, a practice wherein some people believe that they are possessed by spirits which take over their bodies, allowing them to speak in languages of which they are unaware, uttering prophesies, and acting in wild and violent ways. This phenomenon is more common in certain cultures and nations than others.‚Äù
If the Vatican had taken the time to examine what was going on in the world, they might have realized what the Church was trying to fight against ‚Äì with an obsolete ritual, which was not designed to combat the problems of today.
Demon Possession is the process whereby the spirit of Satan, or it‚Äôs henchmen, take physical possession of a person, and cause them to act in an irrational, or ‚Äòmad‚Äô fashion (such as the poor man who was brought in for exorcism!). The most common type of demonic possession, thought to be what is known as ‚Äúspirit possession‚Äù, is more prevalent in certain cultures than other ‚Äì such as within tribal areas in Africa, or India and South East Asia. It‚Äôs also more common in other countries such as Brazil or Peru, as are similar phenomena within certain religions such as Santeria which originated in Cuba, or Vodun which originated within African cultures.
Because there has been so much information in the media, about demonic possession, the Vatican realized that there had to be something about this practice which had led us to this situation, so they investigated and discovered that this ritual is most commonly employed by two types of people. The first is the local people, who believe that they are doing the right thing (and no doubt get a lot of reward for their service to God or Satan).
As an example we will examine one of the more obvious examples of local belief in spirit possess, and the case of a boy, called ‚ÄòPeter‚Äô. He was brought to a priest by both his parents and nurses, on the suspicion that he was ‚Äòpossessed‚Äô by evil spirits, or demons, which had caused him to become inattentive, incoherent and apparently disorientated.
The parents complained that their child was making odd noises, talking wildly and banging his head against the walls. His mother also told the priest that their son had been sleeping outdoors, without any clothing, at the back of their house.
At the exorc

instruction: How do I take care of a wooden table?
output:
How do I take care of a wooden table?
1. Glass vases, candles, and sculptures can easily break on wooden tables, especially if they are placed directly on the wood. These are fragile and the pieces are very hard to replace.
2. Don‚Äôt keep your table in direct sunlight. Direct sunlight can make your table warp, splitting your wood. This will be irreversible.
3. Don‚Äôt store heavy objects such as books or magazines on your table. They can cause the table‚Äôs legs or frame to warp, splitting the wood.
4. Don‚Äôt use bleaches, cleaners, or other strong chemicals on your table.
5. Vacuum to remove dust from your table.
6. Don‚Äôt let paint or nail polish get on your wooden surfaces. The substances can stain your table and ruin the finish if not professionally removed.
7. Wash your tablecloth periodically with soap and water. This is to prevent the growth of bacteria or fungal.
8. Don‚Äôt place any sharp object directly against the surface of your wooden table, even if it is covered by a glass. This is to prevent the table from getting scratched.
9. Wipe tables with a clean, soft duster occasionally, so the accumulated surface particles do not damage or soil the finish.
10. Put all other things away on a designated day. This allows a good cleaning of the table. Make sure that there is no dirt or dust left on the table.
