Gordon has a new job
So it is official, Gordon is set to be the next UK Chancellor of the Exchequer.
Someone was reminding me about the UK law that if two or more people are joint leaders of a political party then one of them has to be appointed Chancellor.
I don‚Äôt think anyone else ever tried to do this, but they should be.
It would certainly make the government more interesting, and more like a coalition, with the new job sharing Chancellor being someone other than the leader of the party.

British drivers are dumber than Swiss drivers
I have mentioned before the 1998 study by the AA, of car crashes in Europe, for UK, French and German roads.
The study showed that French drivers were twice as likely as UK drivers to be involved in a crash, and that Germans were twice as likely as UK drivers to cause an accident.
I can only conclude that the study was flawed. There may have been a cultural bias against UK drivers to account for their lower accident rate and against German drivers to account for their lower accident causing rate.
In the French case the data seems to show a greater prevalence of alcohol, of drug, and smoking in the population than in the UK population, but this can only partially account for the lower French crash rate.
In the German case the data seems to show a lower level of unemployment, an older population, but this can only partially account for the lower German crash causing rate.
The UK has very few non-fatal accidents on the road but it has a high rate of death and injury (per km driven or per accident) because of the high number of non-fatal accidents.
The French have very few non-fatal accidents and a very high rate of death and injury because of the low number of non-fatal accidents.
The Germans have very few non-fatal accidents because they are such safe drivers, and a very high rate of death and injury because every single non-fatal accident, even non-injury accidents

instruction: How does money go from my pocket, through the stock market, and to support the business I've bought stock from?
output:
How does money go from my pocket, through the stock market, and to support the business I've bought stock from? I'm looking for this step by step - I'm sure others are wondering the same thing.
2) Why did you sell the stock?
3) How can you now say that your money is gone? Stock prices still trade. What you sold were merely rights to your stock at some point in the future (which is why the stock market sometimes seems like a casino). If you sold at a loss, which may or may not be permanent, you incurred a capital loss. This loss has implications on your tax return depending on whether or not the stock was a capital asset. It also implicates a wash sale loss (more on this later). Since this is likely the main reason for the sale, it's important to understand the tax consequences.
4) If you need the cash to maintain a specified minimum balance in a financial account (think credit card debts, car payments, college, etc). These are called "financial needs" which differ from "personal goals" in that your finances should provide enough to pay the bills but your life should provide enough to pay the debts. The two should align, never diverge.
Again, this may help get some others interested as well.

Add a comment to George's experience What is the Best way to control Blood Pressure with Kidney Problem? I had HBP for about 12 years now. First diagnosed in early 2007 at age 30. Initially put on a combination of an ACE inhibitor and a Calcium Channel Blocker. I stopped the Calcium Channel Blocker due to an allergic reaction, however stayed on the ACE Inhibitor to treat and control Blood Pressure. When the HBP worsened the dosage of the ACE INHIBITOR was increased twice over the course of nearly 13 years. Unfortunately, the doctor I was with over a period of about 10 years no longer was my doctor and so was passed onto another doctor. The medication was continued and when the BP readings were still not coming below 150/90. I was put onto two other medications: an Amlodipine/Valsalvin/Felodipine (SPANULA) 10mg 2.5mg and 5mg which is taken once in the morning. I was also put on Lisinopril (Zestri), a diuretic taken once in the morning. My current GP decided that we should take another BP readings and discovered that the readings were still out the acceptable range. She then put me onto another two medications: An Amlodipine/Valsalvin/Felodipine (SPANULA) 5mg twice daily as well as an Eplerenone 50mcg taken once in the morning as well. My readings at first improved and the doctor was very happy, however when i checked the readings again my BP was still too high. My doctor then decided that to treat HBP I should be put onto a combination of a Diuretic (Furosemide), an Amlodipine/Valsalvin/Felodipine (SPANULA) 5mg twice daily and again Telmisartan 40mg (Acebradium). The Diuretic was initially prescribed as a trial dose which was only supposed to last a few days but when my doctor took a BP reading it came below the acceptable BP range. The Diuretic dose (Furosemide) is now 20mg twice daily to control my HBP. My question however is, what do you think the best way to treat HBP is? Should I increase the dose of the SPANULA? Should I be put onto a different Diuretic? Should I be put onto insulin injections and Metformin? Please i really need help on this. Any advice or pointers would be very much appreciated. Thank you kindly. Answer: It is normal to have difficulty controlling high blood pressure with medicines. In you case, I would recommend that a healthy lifestyle is the best medicine to control high blood pressure. For this, you should follow below recommendations: The recommended amount of aerobic exercises is 150 minutes per week Weight loss if you are overweight

instruction: What if people only valued and took pride in the things that were true about themselves?
output:
What if people only valued and took pride in the things that were true about themselves? What if we were to look at those things that are false about ourselves as a reflection of others, and not as a true reflection of ourselves? I think that, in and of itself, that could do wonders for what is deemed worthy, and not worthy. What it does for the self-esteem of those who do well at those things which are deemed as being worthy, and how that might affect them personally.
How should society view someone when they're being told something other than the truth? I wonder if the world would view it differently, and that that, in itself, would make a huge difference to who we think we are, as well as giving us some kind of perspective on where we are with what we think we know. In other words, should we trust others, or have we just been giving information that has been passed on from another.
Do we really know something? Or have we just been taught from someone who's been taught from someone else. And does it really have to be that way? Do we really have to be taught, and re-taught, by other people in society?
And what if, we are, in fact, born with the truth of who we are. That we know what we have, and the only need is to develop it, and let it flourish. We are born with a gift. Should we not, then, trust ourselves, and let go. Should we not, then, be able to do something else, and not be limited by the things that, maybe, we think we can't do?
Does it really have to be something that is defined in any way? Does it have to be anything that we know. Or how about something that we don't even know, can't even comprehend? Does that even make sense?
In other words, if we find out, after it develops, that we have something that is truly unique, and only comes out in a particular situation. And that, we are then told that we cannot share it in the outside world. That we have to keep quiet about it. Do we believe it? Or are we, then, limited by society, and told that it is not, in fact, okay to be ourselves?
I personally think that, we should look to ourselves that, we can trust ourselves. We should, therefore, look at who we are, and understand who we are.
I have often done, things, in life, because I have always had a gut feeling about something particular. At the same time, I have often heard from others that there is no point in trusting my intuition because people never follow me in anyway, and they don't see it. I have been told this because they don't know that it is intuition I am talking about.
My intuition sometimes comes up with things like, they tell me that I have a dream. In that dream they can be anything from my sister, or someone from history. Or they can just be a figure that stands in my way and tells me to leave, even though we live in the same house. Or they can just be someone who has some control from the outside world, like my bank manager, and, at most, it's just a few words, or not anything at all, and it could all be my own imagination. Maybe, at the beginning, I was just playing around with my mind. But, in most cases, I have always been correct, and found out later, when I have actually gone to do something about it in the outside world, that it has turned around, and a lot has happened.
For my gut feeling to sometimes be not the truth, in which case it was my imagination, it was actually one of those dreams which have been forgotten, even though their purpose has been fulfilled. Other times, it has just been a bad dream where my brother died, and I have woken up, and cried, and he has been fine. Which has turned around, and found out later that he in fact was just fine.
Is it my intuition that has let me down, or do we judge ourselves if we do not follow what is intuition.
Does life have an end?
I have always asked, life, how much further do you have to go. For me, no end. For example, with my daughter, I have always found it a little hard to put my finger where life has ended and a new phase begins. How does she change? It's very scary. I would love to know where life has ended, and, where, she has gone.
I think, life is just as natural as going into a dream state. There is a dream state, but it has a very clear start and a very clear end, and that's it. I wonder if, life

Taken from The 13 Week Year, the book, and the calendar itself:

"You must have goals ‚Äî whether they are written down or simply in your head ‚Äî that focus you and provide milestones to track your progress toward your yearly and quarterly goals, i.e., what matters most. Goals are the most important tools you must have to set yourself up for success."

That's what we're doing. We think it's important; we hope you do too!

Let's chat about it on FB in this group: Five Week Action Challenge

Please post your results daily in our private challenge group on FB. Thanks!
---
This Above Goal and Concierge Tool challenge starts Monday, January 13th at 12:00 pm EST.

I read The Five Week Action Challenge when it was released a year ago, and was sooo impressed with myself when I finished the challenge as a whole! I read it in five weeks (didn‚Äôt always do the challenge each day), but did the bonus challenges, and ended up with a super cool, super useful book ‚Äì The Five Week Action Challenge. Since I was so impressed with the book, I wanted to create a way for all of you to enjoy it as well and possibly get a free copy of the book!

I‚Äôm super excited about this! There are ten different challenges, the first starting on January 13th and the final challenge start on February 24th. I‚Äôll choose a couple of my favorites and post them to this thread, as well as share the full challenge in this thread each week. You can complete the ten challenges in one challenge, or if you prefer, you can complete each one separately (with your own bonus challenges for each one) to receive a cool prize at the end!

If you want to do the entire ten challenges, you‚Äôll need the Above Goal and Concierge Tools.

Challenge #1: Write and Post Your First Review (This is a must! We love feedback on reviews from you on books, etc)

The Challenge: Take any product you own and review it for the rest of us. This could be anything ‚Äì book reviews, restaurant visits, travel trips, concerts, product reviews, etc. All that matters is that you share your first review ‚Äì just like you would a restaurant review.

This challenge starts on 1/13/19 and will end on 2/16/19.

The Reward: The first reviewer with 25 or more reviews on their product by 2/16/19 will get a free copy of The Five Week Action Challenge by Tara Gentile, as well as their choice of one of Tara‚Äôs books!

If you‚Äôre interested in completing this challenge, you need to read Tara‚Äôs ABOVE GOAL and POST YOUR REVIEWS guide using the Above Goal and Concierge Tool Challenge Packets and Challenge Posters. Just click the buttons above to get your free packets!

Challenge #2: Create and Share Your Own Challenge (This is a challenge within a challenge ‚Äì do whatever you want to create a challenge that suits you and post to share with us!)

The Challenge: Create the ultimate challenge, in whatever format you choose. Are you a book lover? Why not choose a challenge where you only read books you are giving at least 4 stars. Are you a foodie? Create a challenge in which all of your meals must be cooked at home and post a photo of each night. Are you super into music? Create a challenge in which you try different bands and review them weekly. Are you into cooking like my Mom is? Create a challenge where you must create a cooking class, and invite people to join you

instruction: Why does warmth make you feel tired?
output:
Why does warmth make you feel tired? Does fatigue happen in colder or warmer climates? And most importantly of all, how does it happen?
The simple answer is the way your body works. Your body is like a car, and energy is like petrol. When you go for a run, you‚Äôll use up petrol (or energy) to make your muscles move, creating the work you can see when you look at yourself.
If you run the same distance over and over again, you get better at running that distance. You can run longer distances and faster, with less effort. Now remember these were all distances, so the petrol was pretty much the same, but you used that petrol faster. You used more of it but less of it in that timeframe, hence the tired feeling. You‚Äôre like a diesel-engine car going uphill ‚Äì your petrol-engine car might be able to get up the hill better with better uphill gears, but ultimately diesel engines will use more fuel, but go faster and further, with less overall energy.
This same principle applies when the temperature is colder or warmer. You might be exercising on a ski slope, or a hill that makes it a real struggle to move your legs and up your pole or skate, but you feel fresh, not tired. It‚Äôs because there is more oxygen in the air, so there‚Äôs more petrol, or energy available, so you use up more petrol to cover the same distance. The same applies to warm weather exercise ‚Äì the warmer you are, the faster your body will use up energy, so there‚Äôs less petrol used and you feel fatigued.
When you‚Äôre cold, your muscles are less efficient. When the air is colder, you‚Äôre getting less oxygen in each breath you take, and you can‚Äôt push down as well because your muscles are colder than you‚Äôd expect. A colder body uses more of your energy to get warm and to keep warm.
Which is why the people in Antarctica are constantly covered in woolly jumpers. They‚Äôve all got one on, and they live next to a heater that never ever turns off.
But when you exercise in warm weather, you use up your energy quicker. And that heat that you produce when you exercise is mostly heat from your muscles, so as they get hotter, they can‚Äôt work as efficiently as they can when they‚Äôre at a lower temperature, so it takes longer to finish one session of exercise and get better at it.
So which is nicer, to exercise in cold, cold weather or hot, hot weather? Well, it depends. Which do you like less? Or is it neither? For me, I find that I hate both types of weather, but I have to choose. I guess I actually quite like cold weather, but I‚Äôd rather avoid it if I can.
But a lot of people don‚Äôt like the cold, or the wet, or the wind. So if they can find a warm climate, or a climate with less variables, where they can exercise, and they can do it comfortably, then that‚Äôs better than nothing.
So the quick summary is this:
There is a lot more oxygen when the air is warmer.
You use petrol (energy) quicker when it‚Äôs warmer.
You‚Äôll feel more tired when the air is warm.
This is the first step in understanding how your body responds to temperature and what makes it feel tired. If you want to know exactly why, subscribe to my blog via the pop-up box on the right. I‚Äôll send you my whole book straight to your inbox and you‚Äôll be able to delve deeper.
I hope this has helped you understand why we feel this way. It will explain that feeling of tiredness after exercise, and why your muscles ache all the time. It will help your body recover faster from exercise, and it will help your body stay fitter over the whole year so you can have a more consistent level of fitness all year around.
How to Beat The Winter Blues ‚Äì The Effects of Temperature on the Body and How to Help Yourself

instruction: I've put a plate on top of an apple, and take the plate from kitchen to dinning room. Where is the apple now
output:
I've put a plate on top of an apple, and take the plate from kitchen to dinning room. Where is the apple now? (Answer at bottom)
It is on the dinning room table. It is there, but I haven‚Äôt seen it, I know it is there. I just haven‚Äôt yet noticed it, I have a problem (unlike most people) with not seeing the obvious. You see things when you look for them‚Ä¶
This reminds me in many ways of Buddhist concepts of Emptiness and Dependent Origination. Emptiness: there is no inherent nature of any thing, no ‚Äòthing-ness‚Äô, no essence, no independent reality, no substantiality. All things are dependent upon causes and conditions to come into being, for emptiness is the void-like nature of all things. Nothing has solidity, we just think it is solid because we are habituated to take that for granted, when in truth it has no ‚Äòthing-ness‚Äô at all. Really, it is nothing but emptiness.
Emptiness is the way
You know, you don‚Äôt necessarily need a teacher, you can read the books alone. And, this is a good thing, because we live in challenging times, the world is so very confusing, and you will certainly have many doubts. Doubt is an important spiritual practice, in my case. Doubt always reminds me that I do not know. Acknowledging my ignorance is a good thing. With that knowledge comes humility. I have no idea. I am completely ignorant, I am without knowledge. It is so amazing. Life is truly incomprehensible (incomprehensible means unable to comprehend).
And‚Ä¶the first step‚Ä¶
And that, my friends (and I suppose my few readers will appreciate this) is an example of Dependent Origination. The first step is noticing that there is no inherent nature to anything. But if I don‚Äôt recognize that there is no inherent nature, no essence, then nothing happens, it just stays the same. If we don‚Äôt notice that there is no inherent nature of anything, then nothing changes, nothing happens. Notice, see the obvious, see the thing; that there is no inherent nature. Empty, without inherent nature, and then see all things as empty, everything is dependent upon causes and conditions.
Seeing things differently has a transformative effect, an enlivening effect. See things how they are, and they will transform.
Emptiness is the way of enlightenment; it is how the ‚Äòteacher‚Äô appears, and how all things appear. All things are unfixed and dependently arisen. All things are empty.
Now the answer to the little question‚Ä¶
Where is the apple?
It depends if I want an apple‚Ä¶ If I don‚Äôt but I can have one for a few dollars, I would get it. If not I don‚Äôt need it, so I don‚Äôt.
There is a story of someone asking a monk:
What if one was in search of a piece of the truth?
The monk:
Then he would find it,
And if he wanted it on a platter?
That would be even easier‚Ä¶
I just noticed that I have left out a key concept of Dependent Origination, and it is this:
A cause always requires a condition to arise. Every condition is the cause for that condition. If the causes are removed, so is the condition.
If there were no conditions, then there would be no causes, no conditions, no arising. But everything has conditions (or causes) of arising, everything.
So, the problem is this:
I do not see that things depend upon conditions for their arising.
The solution to this problem is to see that everything depends upon causes and conditions for its arising, that nothing arises on its own‚Ä¶
Labels: Buddhism, Dependent Origination, Emptiness

instruction: Introduce the ‚Äùfinancial markets and institutions‚Äú by Frederic S. Mishkin
output:
Introduce the ‚Äùfinancial markets and institutions‚Äú by Frederic S. Mishkin(6th editions, Pearson publication: 2011) with the intention of giving a briefing outline of the financial market and its institution and how it is structured. The introduction of Mishkin‚Äôs ‚Äù financial market as an institution‚Äú is to give us insights of financial market such as bond markets, stock markets, credit markets and money markets. All of them are the most important for our financial market system because their function is more important than any other institution. This is because the bond, money, and stock markets are marketplace to buy and sell financial instruments such as bonds, stocks and corporate bonds. In addition, institutional investors such as insurance companies, mutual funds and pension funds are the biggest market players and influence market prices and they play the most important roles in shaping the financial institutions and markets. The structure of the institution and its relationship with financial markets is shown in the figure below. Investor‚Äôs function with the institution is very important because it shapes the financial markets‚Äô function. We can see from the figure below the bonds markets, stock markets, credit markets and money markets are all inter related. For example, in stock and corporate bond market, the market function is to increase capital flow that can help the corporate...
The Importance of Marketing to the Financial Services Industry Essay
... The Importance of Marketing to the Financial Services Industry Executive Summary Financial services can be viewed as a commodity good or a ‚Äúservice.‚Äù A commodity good is something with little or no differences in an individual. The financial services industry has an image problem. Consumers perceive financial institutions as faceless organizations, only focused on meeting their minimum regulatory requirements and protecting them from legal liability. One way to alleviate this image problem is to create a unique identity that sets you apart from the competition and develops a loyal customer base. instruction: when are hops added to the brewing process?
output:
when are hops added to the brewing process?
Joe Tingley: Often when we want to do an IPA we‚Äôll do a small test batch that we call a pilot batch. Then when we‚Äôre ready to come out with the beer, once we know what the style is, then we know how hoppy it is and we can see whether we want to use crystal or wheat sugar to balance it out. If the beer is really hoppy but we‚Äôve added crystal malt to give it a fuller texture, we‚Äôd have to use a lot of hop bitterness to balance it out. It could be that the beer is going to taste nice, but when we are looking at the cost per barrel, it‚Äôs going to be quite expensive. So, using wheat sugar then we can add less bittering hops to balance out to get the bitter flavour in the beer as well, while also keeping the price of the beer low. So, you have to balance out the costs and the flavour profile, and the bitterness. Then there are other things as well. Crystal malt adds another level of complexity if you get a lot of caramel flavour, for example. So you have to balance those two things together ‚Äì flavour, and then cost and bitterness. The process is constantly adjusting so you can get the balance just right.
FMB: A brewery often has a certain style, or house style, that they‚Äôre trying to achieve. How does this affect the process of hop selection?
JT: As we have a defined style ‚Äì we like to see a nice sweetness, bitterness and flavour ‚Äì we can try to look at hops that are complementary and enhance the flavour and aroma that we‚Äôre already getting from crystal malt or wheat sugar. And it‚Äôs also all about getting the balance right. I‚Äôve worked breweries that have had a style and if you don‚Äôt have that style on the brew day, then it throws everything out of kilter. One hop could completely change the balance.
FMB: Is the whole process very scientific or creative?
JT: It‚Äôs both. A lot of my role is very creative. When you‚Äôre trying to get that balanced sweetness and bitterness, it‚Äôs a lot of creativity and a lot of trial and error. If you just want to follow an IPA recipe, you can end up with a very dull or bland beer, and you want to lift it or create that complexity that you get with hops. With the creativity part, I‚Äôm quite fortunate that we‚Äôve got really good brewers here at Penguin, who‚Äôll come to me and say, ‚Äòwhat do you think of this recipe?‚Äô and I‚Äôll have ideas. It‚Äôs great working with them, they‚Äôre very open-minded. They might ask for my opinion on something that they‚Äôve already come up with. It‚Äôs a bit of a team effort.
FMB: For new brewers looking to develop a house style, how do they find the right types of hops, given the hundreds of different varieties available?
JT: There‚Äôs a lot of support and discussion among brewers that make the beers and they‚Äôll give you advice. They‚Äôll say, ‚Äòthis hop works well, this is a really good hop for a certain flavour‚Äô. There‚Äôs a lot of discussion with other brewers in the industry. But there‚Äôs also a lot of information online about varieties and how they taste, what aromas they have, what flavours they have, and how they affect the taste of your beer. A lot of brewers spend a lot of time on the Internet doing research about hops.
FMB: Why does New Zealand seem to be doing really well with craft beer?
JT: We are quite fortunate with the weather, we get good airflow. I guess back in Europe, where the micro-brewing industry is still quite new, they‚Äôd be in industrial buildings, so there wouldn‚Äôt be the air circulation inside the building. Being in an industrial building doesn‚Äôt take the temperature inside it down, so it‚Äôs more like boiling hot in summer. So, there‚Äôs less flexibility to dry hop and play with aromas when you‚Äôve got your own building. They can still do everything, but it‚Äôs perhaps not as creative as we‚Äôre able to be. But I guess it really is about the beer for us. We‚Äôre lucky enough to get really nice weather, and that‚Äôs certainly helped us to develop this industry.

ideas for building a waitlist for a new product or service. You get it?
But before you start developing your email marketing service in WordPress, you need something to sell. Not only that but you need some way to add people to that list.
So if you have an offer that you can sell to your list, I‚Äôve put together this guide to building the foundation of your next successful online marketing business. I‚Äôve laid out the steps you need to take to ensure the most success.
Whether it be for your own business, or you want to provide this service to your customers, you need to find a good offer to sell (more on how to find one of those below).
We‚Äôll cover how to research the market and make sure there‚Äôs a demand before diving into the tech.
You‚Äôll need to have a lead gen page (this is where visitors leave their email address).
And you‚Äôll also need to have an autoresponder (so you can follow up with emails).
I‚Äôve included a few options in each category and some tips for pricing your service.
There are plenty of things to consider, from what technology to use to the best pricing strategies. We‚Äôre going to cover them all as we go through the steps.
There‚Äôs no need to dive in right now; you can read the whole guide above and come back to each step anytime.
At the end of this guide we‚Äôve also included the best tools to build your email marketing service for WordPress, just in case you want to dive right in and see all of the options available.
You‚Äôre at the point in your business where you want to make money doing something you know how to do.
It might be anything from web design to social media management to email marketing.
You want to take the lessons that you have learned in whatever field you know and make money doing it.
You‚Äôve probably already tried offering your service to friends and family or even as a hobby, but you don‚Äôt have the experience and the track record to do that to your entire customer base.
You want the freedom to do other things, be at home more frequently and spend more time away from your computers. In a way, maybe you‚Äôve been so dedicated to working on your business that you didn‚Äôt really think about your life.
The time and the effort to build a business can only work for you if you get the right customers.
Which means that you have to find a marketing strategy that works to get the attention of your market.
The first step in building a successful marketing strategy is to figure out how many leads you really need to get. Do you need one person a day? Several a week? What other resources do you have to work with to find those leads? A network of contacts? Your website? A paid advertising effort? All of these things factor into your lead generation and how many leads you really need.
Most businesses, particularly those that are new, will need to invest in some kind of paid advertising to be able to build up a lead list. Facebook for example, is great in that it allows you to target people very specifically, but, as I mentioned above, most will start to see a paywall once you get past free ads.
If you can pay that cost initially in order to grow your list (and have a way to continue to pay it) you will almost assuredly end up with more leads per dollar spent if you decide to do email marketing or any other kind of marketing to that list.
Asking friends, family, colleagues and anyone else in your network is going to be a great idea, as long as you make sure they know you‚Äôre looking for leads that you can sell a product or service to. If you can reach a thousand people with a Facebook post for example, the cost would be less than the cost to generate a single lead through Facebook.
One of the most important things I‚Äôve learned as a marketer in almost 2 decades in the business is that you should only create an email list if you‚Äôre going to be using it to bring the audience to a product.
Most people want to start collecting emails just because they think it‚Äôs the best way to market to a prospect (and it is), but the truth is you‚Äôd be better off to use Facebook instead.
Facebook is better because it has a higher number of contacts for the same price. When you build that email list you‚Äôll have to pay $70+ per month (at least) to be able to send a campaign or sales letter.
Email also has a lot more limits than Facebook.
An email list can only be used once: someone signed up for your list yesterday, so only one email at a time (and the

The reason we'll use a priority queue is, let's say I know that some of these pieces are supposed to have a higher priority than others. I might put that into an array called priority, and priority[i] is the priority of item i.
A priority queue keeps track of when is the last time an item has been accessed. That's why I have itemQueue[i], the access time of item i. If I have itemQueue[i].lastAccessTime, then if I have an item that has not been accessed before, its access time is infinite. If it has been used before, its access time is the time that it was last used. This is an important thing for priority queues.
We have an array called priority. We have priority on the itemQueue object.

I'm then going to build my graph on line 12 and I'm going to build it incrementally so I just use this.addNeighbor function here on line 12. Just every time I pass this graph, I'll put in the next neighbor. That's how this incremental graph build works.
If I didn't have a queue here, this would all work perfectly. But, I know that I have a queue and I want to do something more interesting than just make this have the lastAccessTime be infinity.
So, I'm going to have this graph work by using an array, an access array here, and so line 26 is here's my queue object. instruction: In order to launch a token for a Defi project, I want to sell some tokens privately to early investors and then add it to a launchpad. let me know what can I do with my smart contract? Should I create a presale contract separate from main contract?
output:
In order to launch a token for a Defi project, I want to sell some tokens privately to early investors and then add it to a launchpad. let me know what can I do with my smart contract? Should I create a presale contract separate from main contract?
As I understood, you can create a presale and include it to your main contract. Your presale should have different terms than your main contract. You can create a presale contract in the contract-create page.
You can use this feature to create a separate version of your contract (this is done by specifying a different version number or an id_number value in the contract parameters.
The presale contract is used to create separate versions of your contract that can be set to different tokens and airdrop parameters, for example, the presale version can be set to a certain percent of tokens during a presale, while the main version can be set to a different percent of tokens during the main sale. You can use the presale in order to accept contributions before the main sale.
Please note: once you set the presale version to the main version, all presale contract data will be deleted.
You can read about this feature in this article.

instruction: what is the recommended pattern for creating games in godot
output:
what is the recommended pattern for creating games in godot 2.1?
A: The recommended approach for creating a new project is to create a new Godot project. This helps to keep all Godot related files together in the directory.
A: If you want to use an existing Godot project for a new game, the safest approach is to copy the whole project into a new directory. This will ensure that the files do not collide with already existing files and you avoid the project metadata being modified.
A: If copying the project has worked for you previously and you are just going to copy it again for a new game, you may decide to skip it. But if you have to make any code changes to the projects, they will first have to be applied to the existing project before copying it.

A: In rare cases, the data in an existing project may have gotten corrupted and copying the project would be risky. Then either re-importing the project, or creating a new project, are safer approaches.

instruction: what are some basics of nutrition that i should be aware of
output:
what are some basics of nutrition that i should be aware of when i'm training for the race, you know, how that would fit in with your regime?
Dave: Well, I'm glad you asked that because a lot of people don't know that nutrition is a very important part of our success in endurance racing. As you mentioned, we're not just going to be up there huffing and puffing for six to ten hours, we're running at a pretty high level of intensity for a pretty long duration of time. And that means that nutrition is really important to keep our glycogen levels fairly high to avoid bonking and going anaerobic.
Kevin: Yup.
Dave: And that's one of the first things I look at with someone who's training for running is how are you going to fuel before and during your race and how you're going to recover afterwards? Recovery is probably the most important part.
A typical marathon would have about six to eight gels along the way and maybe a cup of fuel. But fueling before you begin your run is not necessary. Most people end up taking on a little bit more than they should. Especially if it's a race, you can go out over-fueled and become nauseous and also have to stop more frequently for bathroom breaks. So usually it's something that you want to look at a little bit closer to the race. What's your strategy there?
I recommend two to three days before a race, if it's a marathon, a two to three-hour run, to do a long run and fuel exactly how you're going to fuel on the race. That allows you to practice not only getting rid of the fuel you're taking in, but making use of that fuel.
I also recommend for the two weeks leading up to a marathon to do a run two hours a day, a recovery run which is slower, so you can kind of get in the rhythm of using that fuel. You're doing that two-hour-run thing five times a week, so you're having five opportunities to practice using that fuel.
What I like to see on a day-to-day basis for the marathon would be a recovery day, so maybe one to two hours, then a long run. And then you follow that with a day off. So if you're training for the marathon, you're really training for six weeks with a day off in each week. So I would do that two-three runs a week, and then I would mix it up every now and then with a faster pace, kind of to keep the metabolisms going.
Kevin: So I just want to get this clarified. So we're training five days a week and we're only doing one run per day, so two of those runs are very different from one another. Is that correct?
Dave: Yes, that would be my recommendation for the day-to-day training. But that's not how Kevin is going to practice because he's going to do his daily runs and then he has his training plan that I built for him and it basically matches our coaching plan.
Basically we'll work on one or two areas that day. We won't spend five hours doing just a long run on a day-to-day basis.
Kevin: Okay. Can I ask something about fueling on one of these runs? How would someone, especially somebody running the Marathon like I am, how would they plan for fueling on these runs?
Dave: Let's just take the marathon as an example. Now we're going to have six to eight gels along the way, but what we're really talking about is about 4,000 to 6,000 calories spread out throughout the day. So when you start putting calories in, you're going to be on fuel from about the time that you wake up on race day until about 24 hours later.
Now, one part for someone who doesn't use fuel, or who's a fairly light runner, it's a good idea to start using fuel about two or three weeks before. It gives your body time to learn how to use that and give it time when it puts fuel in your system, it actually uses that to keep you going up on the run a little bit longer.
But the amount of fuel you're using will depend on the length of the run. Now, you can add more than I recommend for your run, that's a bad idea, but in general, what you can take into a marathon would be 4,000 to 6,000 calories

instruction: You will simulate an SEO expert. What keywords should a screenwriting software target
output:
You will simulate an SEO expert. What keywords should a screenwriting software targeted at the search engines the most? What pages should it show to users? How about internal links? You should follow a plan, and your screenwriting software should too. Screenwriting software and keywords are not the only factors that determine your link popularity. A lot of SEO depends on marketing more than anything else to provide inbound and outbound links.
On site elements such as inbound links to your content and your site‚Äôs position and authority in the SERPs can be very important elements with the on-site elements. You need to ensure that people can find your content quickly and easily. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with asking for advice, or paying someone, to give you advice. Some of the older ones I still use, like the 301 redirect tool, the spinner, and some keyword generators.‚Äù Google has taken great measures to provide better search engine results by filtering out poor content. The result of which is that, if you are using black hat techniques you will quickly find you are excluded from any searches.
Happening upon that perfect piece of furniture can be just as exhilarating as that winning lottery ticket can be. You must also ensure you make as many quality links as possible. The only links you should create aren‚Äôt in your own blog and they certainly aren‚Äôt in your forum signature or other irrelevant place. If you are thinking about keyword ranking to tell you if your blog is good or bad, that‚Äôs a total wrong method. It could have a big impact in a positive way if used wisely. Google does not like thin sites and will work better for those who create quality content on their blogs. They know quality means relevant content, images, product/service pages, customer reviews, and great information about their company and locations.
Hat tip: Heather Lloyd-Martin, co-author of Landing Page Optimization and chair of the SEMPO Landing Page Optimization Special Interest Group (SIG). SEO is often confused with search engine advertising, or pay-per-click marketing. While advertising can be a good way to drive short-term traffic to your website, it is also the easiest to game and manipulate. That means your competitors can buy advertising on terms related to your business and you may not know it until you start paying for the traffic you‚Äôre generating for your competitors. The key to successful search marketing is a deep understanding of both paid and unpaid strategies, and a relentless focus on the user experience, as these efforts are holistic and rely on all facets of every campaign working in harmony.
While Google clearly has the lion‚Äôs share of the search market, Bing and Yahoo still account for almost 30% of all searches, according to comScore. So don‚Äôt neglect either search engine. In our experience, if your site is properly optimized for users, it will rank well for search engines. That includes ensuring that users can find what they are looking for, that your pages have plenty of content on the topic of the page and that you have an optimal internal link structure. The next step of search marketing is understanding which search engine optimization, or SEO, tactics are most effective. You‚Äôll also need to decide whether you‚Äôre going to do this in-house or with the help of an outside company. And once you‚Äôve settled on SEO tactics and a company to help you execute those tactics, you‚Äôll need to determine how your team is going to measure the success of those efforts.

instruction: phrase an email to my manager kindly asking for feedback for a dashboard I sent him for his use, and also ask him if I should publish this dashboard to the team, and if there's a certain way he wants me to publish it, or certain orientation to emphasis when publishing
output:
phrase an email to my manager kindly asking for feedback for a dashboard I sent him for his use, and also ask him if I should publish this dashboard to the team, and if there's a certain way he wants me to publish it, or certain orientation to emphasis when publishing it. It'll probably be me going around to 10 other managers and asking them if they'll let me publish something, but that's what I hope. I also have the first 30 days of an interview plan where I'll ask my manager to send me to various meetings or give me various responsibilities, mostly so I can see what all these jobs really do, and see which ones would be good for me. Then I can talk about them to my manager and if I can do them, and then write about them in my daily journal in order to record them for my resume. I can definitely improve the things that I have in my journal right now, so I might as well fill it out with some more details. I can probably work some of the things I do into the daily journal itself as I have more experience with them. On the flip side though, I don't want to do anything I'll end up just being bad at eventually. I want to do things that I'm good at right away and then I will have more interesting details to talk about. I also have the daily journal for a 10 point review at the end of the first 30 days, where I am to rate my performance against the standard of the work I set for myself. Basically, I've set 20 goals and I have to check off how many I accomplished every day so that if by some chance I haven't had a decent day, then I can know for sure I actually did something right. I think that's all going to work, but let's see how it takes, I guess.
I just don't know how to plan things out. I have the plan for the first day and that gives me 18 days to figure out how to plan things for days... 2 through 18! (I probably don't have to account for weekends, do I...?) It really makes me appreciate the people who actually know how to plan things out well in advance. I have 10 "firsts" in mind for things to do for my first 30 days: ‚Ä¢ First day: 6th December 2019 I need to get to work, I have a project that needs to get done, and then I need to meet with my direct manager, in order to give him an update on my status, and also ask him for a specific task to work through. ‚Ä¢ Second day: I will learn more about the process in my team. I will look through the code base, the build system, and also talk with the team leads and the principal to learn more about what I need to learn. ‚Ä¢ Third day: In the morning, I will need to write out a plan for how I spend the rest of the week. I will write a plan for what needs to get done by the end of the week, what I should do to prepare for that, and what I need to do to pass my first 30-day review that is currently scheduled for 6th December 2019. ‚Ä¢ Fourth day: I will continue the plan I drafted through the other three days, and try to do things like what is in the third and fourth plans.
‚Ä¢ Fifth Day: I will talk to my direct manager (the one that's in charge of my day to day production) about what is in my plan, and what is important for them, and I will try to follow through with what he wants to see, so I can give him a plan for this week as well, to give me time to get other tasks to get done. ‚Ä¢ Sixth day: I will try to figure out how to be useful while I'm doing tasks, like answering questions in chat, and being active in the different projects we have going.
‚Ä¢ Seventh Day: I will figure out how to schedule things. Figure out how to figure out how to schedule things.
‚Ä¢ Eighth Day: I will figure out what types of things I should be doing. I will talk with the team leads and principal, and the other engineers, to try to figure out what to do, and where can I be helpful outside of the project I'm currently working on. Figure out how to plan for day two, figuring out what type of things I should be doing, and what type of things are coming up.
‚Ä¢ Ninth Day: I will figure out some actual things to do that are beyond the planning for the day. I will ask my manager what project ideas from the general work of the team could I handle right away.
‚Ä¢ T

instruction: Need 300 words on the importance to documenting history in relation to the future
output:
Need 300 words on the importance to documenting history in relation to the future of South Africa in relation to the Global Peace Initiative of Empowerment & Enlightenment
"South Africa's Struggle History"
"South Africa's Peace History in context of the Global Peace Initiative"
The Global Peace Foundation recognizes the importance that South African history has in relation to the future of South Africa and the peace and stability of the World.
Dr. Fareed Abdullah, Chairperson, South Africa - Global Peace Initiative
The GPF believes that education is one of key values of the Human Rights charter. Education is also one of the six key thematic areas of our Global Peace Initiative. The GPF is calling on institutions, organisations and individuals to engage in dialogues with the youth to ensure that they create value that is going to be of benefit to the African Continent and the Global Community at large.
To this point we are launching a campaign that is targeted at ensuring that youths in South Africa are equipped to better understand the history of where they come from and thereby develop a mindset of peace and respect for diversity.
With that in mind the Foundation is calling for a partnership that will raise the awareness about South Africa's history in context of the Global Peace Initiative of Empowerment & Enlightenment.
The foundation is looking to the people living in the Western Cape particularly the people living in the City of Cape Town who have contributed to the making of history in the Western Cape and in South Africa in general. Most especially those persons of Indian and Muslim descent who have played leading roles in creating history especially the contribution of Muslims in the making of the Western Cape the role they played in creating the legislative framework of the Western Cape.
The Western Cape Province has seen many changes with respect to who was leading and what were their contribution to building the Western Cape into what it has become today. With this context in mind the Foundation is encouraging people living in the Western Cape who have played leading roles either in the past of today to speak out of their life‚Äôs story. They may do that through a video or photo testimonial or written submissions as part of our campaign.
The submission will be used to create awareness in relation to the history of the South Africa‚Äôs Struggle History and the history of the Peace Struggle in the Western Cape.
The Campaign will focus on the life of the people who have played a significant role in the peace struggle of South Africa. As of now we have called for these stories and are encouraged to continue with that in the interest of making available the history of the peace struggle in South Africa.
We have invited organisations and individuals particularly in Cape Town to engage in this process. We are appealing to all organisations that have a contribution to make with regards to the history of the peace struggle of South Africa in particular to engage in this process.
If you want to contribute please follow the protocol below:
1. If you‚Äôd like to contribute your own video clip contact Fareed Abdullah at this contact number 082493574, you can also leave an audio message on the number.

Twitter: @GlobalPeaceSA hashtag: #SouthAfricahistory

Chairperson, South Africa Chapter, GPIE

instruction: there used to be a program for winmx called mcma, what does mcma stand for and what does the program do?
output:
there used to be a program for winmx called mcma, what does mcma stand for and what does the program do?
mCMA is the name of a program which used to be used with WinMX. It allowed WinMX users to play .mp3 songs from their computer to a WinMX player. It's no longer in use, and it's likely there are some out there with WinMX players who forgot about it.
If I may, I would like to mention for others that the following instructions work for WinMX-7.4.
* You want to set up a "Music List on My Computer"
* If the list of songs on a My Computer location are not sorted by artist/album/etc., click the "Sort by Artist" button at the top of the WinMX directory to manually sort the music. For example, if the artist or album name are not sorted, select it then press "Sort by Artist".
* When you get the list of songs on My Computer, copy and paste your list of songs into the "Music in My Computer Location" box (highlighted in the next picture).
Then press the "Submit" button.
It worked pretty well for me. Most of my songs are in mp3 format anyways...so it is probably okay if your songs are in another format than mp3.
I believe that WinMX does have a pretty good sound quality, so I use WinMX when I have the bandwidth for it.
Amazingly enough, while searching that information, I came across your question through Google and I realized that I know some of the information you are looking for and I want to share that information with you and anyone else who may benefit from my post.
Now here is the first bit of information: What does mCMA stand for and what does the program do?
I was unable to find any sites that offered mCMA's programs or even a program in it's entirety. I did, however, find some bits of information.
What Does mCMA Do?
As you may already know, mCMA was one of the programs designed to be used with WinMX. The main purpose of mCMA is to transfer MP3s, although it can be used for other formats. The MP3s that you upload to mCMA or use from mCAM can be played by WinMX's player. The user can select a category and a number of MP3s from that category will play automatically. The user could manually select others (by album, artists, etc) to play as well.
What Makes mCMA Unique?
In a sense, it is like having an old fashioned jukebox. The user can select a category (i-e. Rock, Country, Blues), select a number of songs (that are in the category), and a group of songs play automatically. The user doesn't have to go through menus to select an artist to play. The user can either let their WinMX player just cycle through all of their files or they can select certain files from the list to play manually.
How the program was used:
Step 1: In the beginning the user had to load their music onto the computer. After they transfered the music onto the computer they would then have to start up their mCMA program.
Step 2: Once they got into the mCMA setup page they had to choose between a couple of options, such as where to store your music, how many computers you would allow mCMA onto (limited to 2 on WinMX), how many songs you would allow to be played simultaneously, and choosing which types of music to play (i.e. only Country, or only Rock--you had to choose between different categories (such as: Country, Rock, Blues, etc.)
Step 3: After the user entered the information in the first page, they were taken to the play page. On this page users would choose between all of the options including which type of music to allow, the number of songs that would be played, the number of minutes of time you would set aside each day to listen.
Step 4: After the user had finished all of that information, then they could get to the "fun" part. They would first have to choose the music to be played (which is similar to setting up a regular WinMX directory). One thing to remember is that after you set the categories (i.e. blues, or rock) it would also need to be set up by album (i-e. the different albums that are in the category).
Example, I am going to say that I was using Country as my main category. In order to have my music play as "Country" music I would need to add a category "Country"

instruction: What are the USP for a saas survey tool
output:
What are the USP for a saas survey tool tool and how can I stand out? Do you know what makes your survey tool unique? What values can I give your tool? What needs fulfill? And I need to know all of this before building a site. If building a site just involves taking text from the page in WordPress, I don't feel like it's worth it. Sure there's some extra markup and css involved but if it's the same values anyway ... well, not really worth it. A bit like this article is about to become :)

Answer: The thing is, you don't create a Wordpress site for 2 pages. Wordpress is a CMS and you integrate it with the website which has its own CMS.

Now, when you are adding a 3rd party plugin to a website CMS, be that Wordpress or whatever other, it is important to know what you want to achieve with it and what you are not going to implement yourself. In your case, it looks like that is:

1.A place where you upload the questionnaire files (maybe CSVs)

2.A place that the users go to to answer the questionnaire.

3.Maybe a place for you to publish the analyses of those questionnaires

So my advise would be:

1.Pick some good looking, easy to use and maintain solution. Google search for it. Someone will find it

2.Build the front-end based on the solution you chose in 1.

3.Do it with Wordpress or whatever CMS you want. It doesn't really matter at this point as it will be integrated with the front end later on.

Hope that helps. :-)

Comment: Just to clarify, what you're saying is that building a WordPress site doesn't really require a lot of planning or knowledge up front. It's just about taking a good solution and integrating it with WordPress.
I really appreciate your answer, and I agree with all of it. It does make me lean further toward a static site generator so that I don't have to use WordPress as the site's front-end, because I don't think WordPress is a great candidate for this app. I should be able to build this without a CMS. Do you think that a static site generator is my best bet here?

Comment: I think that is the way you should go, yes. But the only disadvantage is that you would have to maintain it manually, which I guess it's not an issue for you anyway.

Comment: This is good, I appreciate your insight. I think that it's worth doing this project without WordPress. I feel more like a developer than a product manager at this point, but I also want to feel like a product manager.

instruction:
Simplify "Most of the basic functions of current virtualization software are inherited from this early VM OS. The virtualization software is now represented with the term hypervisor. Hardware virtualization is used to share the resources of the cloud providers effectively with the customers by generating an illusion of dedicated computing, storage, and networking on a computing infrastructure.

The concept of virtualization is physically implemented using the hypervisor modules, and the operation and processing of hypervisors are materialized by the OSS. In other words, hypervisor modules are installed on top of OSS, which act as an interface between hardware units and hypervisor packages."
output:
Simplify "Most of the basic functions of current virtualization software are inherited from this early VM OS. The virtualization software is now represented with the term hypervisor. Hardware virtualization is used to share the resources of the cloud providers effectively with the customers by generating an illusion of dedicated computing, storage, and networking on a computing infrastructure.

The concept of virtualization is physically implemented using the hypervisor modules, and the operation and processing of hypervisors are materialized by the OSS. In other words, hypervisor modules are installed on top of OSS, which act as an interface between hardware units and hypervisor packages." (Shoaib, Yassir, 2014) 5. Virtualization is not new to industry, and has been used for years by technology providers. The biggest names are IBM, Oracle, and EMC, with HP and Microsoft also being a part of the virtualization party. 6. This section will review all the companies and describe their role in virtualization IBM is the big name in virtualization, and has been for many years. In 2006 they bought VMware for $6.5 billion and integrated with their software to bring more power to the IT department and lower costs and increase performance for business and the user. Some of their products are: ÔÇ∑ IBM Virtualization Engine ÔÇ∑ Server virtualization ÔÇ∑ Infrastructure management ÔÇ∑ Private virtualization ÔÇ∑ High Availability Oracle also has a strong base in the software community and provides a powerful set of products to assist in the virtualization process. Their products include: ÔÇ∑ Oracle Real Application Cluster (RAC) ÔÇ∑ Fusion Middleware Server ÔÇ∑ Data Guard ÔÇ∑ Oracle VM ÔÇ∑ Oracle VM For Z ÔÇ∑ Partitioning, sharing and allocation of resources EMC is not as strong in their virtualization products and technology as IBM or Oracle, however, they do have a strong presence in the storage and backup market. EMC‚Äôs core strength is in the backup and high availability of a datacenter. EMC produces the Symmetrix and Celerra storage systems. These systems are used by businesses for high availability and backup of data. EMC does not supply hardware virtualization; it uses the power VMware to run these Virtual Machines (VM). The EMC is a partner that specializes in high availability, back up, and business continuity. This is where EMC shines when it comes to virtualization technology. EMC also has a partnership with VMware and offers their own solutions. Microsoft is also a big player in the virtualization market space. Not just in the virtualization space, but also in the operating system platform space as well. Microsoft is responsible for many technologies in use today, including Windows, Office and IIS. Microsoft also provides virtualization options for most of their operating systems such as Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2012 R2, and Microsoft Hyper-V. Microsoft‚Äôs virtualization products include: ÔÇ∑ Microsoft Hyper-V ÔÇ∑ Virtual Machine Console ÔÇ∑ Guest Operating Systems These products allow for multiple guests to run at the same time without interfering with each other. This gives Microsoft the ability to compete with large players such as IBM. 7. Virtualization is not limited to just IT infrastructure, it also can be used in communication lines to allow for a connection between the IT infrastructure. Communication lines used consist of: LAN ‚Äì local area network WAN ‚Äì the wide area network SAN ‚Äì storage area network Glue - the part that connects the two and makes the switch. 8. The following are the top uses of virtualization: ÔÇ∑ Computing - using a hypervisor for virtualized computing ÔÇ∑ Networking - allowing access between virtual machines on LAN, WAN and ÔÇ∑ Virtualized storage - using hardware disk drives ÔÇ∑ Sensor network - using virtualization to help monitor and protect vital information ÔÇ∑ Wireless virtualization - for providing a framework for a virtual wireless network ÔÇ∑ VMM (Virtual Machine Manager) - the management software that is used ÔÇ∑ VM (virtual machine) - software that is being managed ÔÇ∑ VMDK (Virtual Machine Disk) - files that allow a running operating system to be loaded onto a virtual server. 9. The main benefits of virtualization are: ÔÇ∑ Ability to reuse virtual instances of servers

The ‚Äòvoid‚Äô of infinity is an attempt by God ‚ÄòInfinite‚Äô to move further into creation (infinity into the finite realm) and ‚Äòtighten‚Äô the ‚Äòloose end‚Äô that is life from which all that we perceive is created.
This ‚Äòloose end‚Äô is what we perceive as entropy: randomness, disorder.
This ‚Äòtightening‚Äô is what causes things to become more ordered, life to evolve and our universe to expand.
It explains all that we perceive (ie in accordance with the universe).
God being Infinite, being able to ‚Äòtighten‚Äô the infinite, can only get a finite distance into the realm of finite existence (ie to our ‚Äòvoid‚Äô). But what‚Äôs really happening isn‚Äôt that God becomes finite, but only through a paradox (and paradoxes don‚Äôt exist): because God is Infinite, the closer something moves towards becoming infinite in the finite realm (ie towards becoming the Infinite God), the closer it gets to becoming equal to God (and God cannot be greater than Itself so It must turn into Itself).
This is what all of creation experiences.
This is the ‚Äòtightening‚Äô and this is what leads to a world being formed from the void.
What happens later is the process of the world forming life, which when in a universe of only ‚Äòlife‚Äô, (which we, and possibly God, must understand are completely different realms of existence), and we as individuals ‚Äòdevolve‚Äô to the level of life, then, without the life evolving from that life, nothing (except for the life) can exist in that finite finite realm (ie in the finite realm of that world (which must be formed from that ‚Äòinfinite‚Äô life)).
If you‚Äôre not happy to take my word for it, ask for proof (or ask for the ‚Äòproof‚Äô from my source which has so impressed Snubby and other).
If you‚Äôre not happy with the ‚Äòproof‚Äô, then ask for a ‚Äòproof‚Äô that the Earth goes round the Sun or that the Earth is 5000 years old.
If you‚Äôre not happy with that, then ask for a ‚Äòproof‚Äô that I‚Äôm not Santa Claus.
Snubby: " I can‚Äôt think of any example that falls into the first category. And what has ‚Äòscientific‚Äô have to do with it?"
Ask yourself how does science (what I do for a living to pay my rent, and which you pay tax for) work? And how do laws/scientific theories/etc work?
Then you'll see that it works by people submitting hypotheses, proving them and/or disproving them with evidence/facts, etc, and then deciding whether it is true or not.
How do you decide whether something is true or not? On the evidence you saw, with the knowledge from your training.
Hence, if something is claimed to be a 'law' or something, a natural thing to do would be to ask the person what the evidence is. And there are two possibilities:
1/ If he knows the evidence then he would present it.
2/ If he doesn't give you the evidence, then you ask yourself whether the evidence is presenting itself, and how you would go about proving that with the knowledge you have.
In short: evidence for your belief, otherwise evidence for the existence of evidence if it's required, else you can't decide whether it's true or not.
Whether he sees the evidence or not doesn't matter anymore. If what he says is true, he will have evidence. If not, then he can't get evidence unless he creates it first, and then he can use the evidence to prove his beliefs.
It's the same with science. You can't decide whether a theory is true or not without evidence or evidence from the laws. And what evidence is evidence if it

instruction: in billiards what happens if on the break every strip ball is pocketed?
output:
in billiards what happens if on the break every strip ball is pocketed?
There are four strip balls, and, with each striper's break, there are four possible order in which they can be stripped.
That doesn't make much sense, but the answer would be four four-ball games, played one after the other.
I have no idea why I wrote that. I think I may have been watching one of them crazy Russian roulette films -- the ones where the girl has to shoot one of 7 guns on which, by the way, are all loaded.
When you watch them, do you think, "I wonder what will happen if she shoots the gun with only 6 bullets in it?"
That's probably what I was thinking at the time...
Tony, we need a re-do on that picture.
I guess one of the reasons they all look the same when they walk or when they play and the same when they talk is because they all look the same when they pose.
This picture is cool because everyone is wearing matching bifocals.
So, not too long ago, I said I'd seen some pictures that looked like the ones in the Sighting section. Well, in the interests of journalistic integrity, I decided to track down the original photographers (as opposed to the folks at the bottom of my blogroll).
I contacted the woman who posted the piccies of the guys with the bifocals, and now I'm in touch with the other woman who has the originals. I guess that's why I was feeling a little dejected last night. My new buddy had been out with "Mr. Bifocals," and I was all like, "Man. That'd be really cool if I was dating that guy, who also was dating the original photographer. And she lived in the West Village. And if I'd known her, maybe we wouldn't both have been single for so long."
I was talking with a girlfriend last night about why I would be so depressed about this. After I got off the phone, I decided she was right. She said I was focusing on the wrong aspects. I should have been happy that I had a connection with the girl and with the guy and with the photographer, but I was focused only on the fact that they were no longer dating the photographer. Then I started focusing on how lame I am.
Well, I'm just doing my best, dearest reader.
I still think having them all together would be really cool, but, then, when it hits them, I suppose that I'll feel dejected about that.
Okay. I don't feel sad anymore. Just lonely and tired and kind of hungry.
The original pics are here and here.
Today I had to fill out a form that asked me which of my race was checked... I had to go back to the last box and check white...
When is being black a race and white being the opposite of a race?
I have so many ethnic ancestors that I don't even know how to count them, but, you see, there's a problem here.
I can't put black. That's not an option. I can't put white. That's not an option, either. So I put caucasian. That's kind of white, but it's not really white. And it's obviously not black. So they can't accept it and the form says, in small print on a different page, that if the race you picked is not in the drop down box, please enter it in the "other" box.
So I checked the other box. I guess that means I'm white.
Or I guess that means that you can be whatever you want and then get a form that says one thing and ask that you "be other."
It's a good thing I didn't check "Hispanic" or they'd ask for a "race."
They would also ask for my race and say, "What? No race?"
It's hard figuring out which box to check.
It's even harder figuring out how to check the ones I'm in.
Labels: multiracial

instruction: find a word that represents people reacting to unpleasant events
output:
find a word that represents people reacting to unpleasant events in a way that brings relief with a degree of excitement.
But we don't know what the word is. In this article, we go on a hunt for what would be the perfect candidate.
Its not so simple as going to thesaurus.com and finding a new word to replace one of these terms. Its about finding a word that represents the concepts that are associated with those terms, and finding a word that is new and interesting - not one that is often used.
The most useful tool for finding such a word is the Google NGram Viewer. Basically, it lets you look up the frequency of words or phrases for any given time period, and then plot it on a graph. You can control the year-span of the search, and the number of results you get back.
Using this tool, I searched for the ten most-used words or combinations of words for "news", "disaster" and "weather". Using the Ngram Viewer, we can see the change of use over time (as well as the exact numbers of results), and also see if a particular combination has ever been as much of a sensation as the current news headlines suggest.
You can read our analysis of this below, or jump to this page, and see for yourselves.
Here's the analysis.
So how have the news headlines changed over the last 162 years? To answer that question, we have plotted the results from the year 1850, to the year 2012. This was done by searching for the terms used in the news articles of those periods, and then plotting the results on a graph. To search by all these, and other words and terms relevant to the question, click here.
The top ten results after the year 1850
disaster weather weather weather weather weather weather weather weather weather weather weather weather weather news news weather news world war world war war world war usus world war world disaster cold war disaster news war cold war cold war
It can be seen that the word "weather" has been consistently the most used subject for news articles over the last several decades, sometimes gaining the lead over "news", and "disaster". This suggests that weather seems to be a more interesting, more important topic for journalism.
Between the years of 1850 and 1930, as disaster and news were not that common, the interest in weather changed. Somewhat confusingly, the interest in weather increased and decreased during this period. This means that the average interest in weather articles increased during that time. The interest decreased slightly, especially between the years of 1850 and 1910. The interest increased again and has increased steadily since then. There is an acceleration of interest recently, suggesting that weather has become even more important and more interesting for journalists and readers alike.
It can also be seen that "news" started gaining interest between 1920 and 1930. This was the time of the rise of radio news as well as the "talkies", so it is likely that the availability and interest in news articles increased because of the mass availability and easier understanding of news.
After 1930, disaster articles become much less frequent, for the first time since 1850. This would suggest that disasters are less in fashion than ever before. It is unclear why this could have happened. Possibly a change in technology, perhaps the Great Depression meant that disasters were less likely, or perhaps the disaster topic fell out of favour with the public. One effect of this is that news stories dropped out of favour by the same year.
This graph represents the interest in the particular words, terms or phrases that compose a particular word. This means that you get a sense of what people like to read about - not just how frequently. For the three words "news", "disaster" and "weather", you can see that the most popular phrase has been "world news disaster", or "news weather disaster" or "world news weather" over the last few decades. So one major insight of this graph is that when it comes to the news, people love hearing about weather disasters.
To understand how the patterns have changed over time, we have plotted the results for two sets of data: the first for 1960-2005, the second 2005-present
As before, we see "weather" continuing to dominate "news", and "weather" coming close to "news" over the last few years. The other interesting observation are the huge spikes of interest in "world news disaster

instruction: How does Kahane's ethics of violence echo that of Fanon and Zizek when discussing to the American Jewish Establishment?
output:
How does Kahane's ethics of violence echo that of Fanon and Zizek when discussing to the American Jewish Establishment?
An example of the relationship between these thinkers is in their similar understandings of violence. In his analysis of how the American Jewish establishment responded to the war in Vietnam, Kahane writes: "I ask you to imagine a new and strange experience that is as alien to you as it is to me. Imagine that you and I are suddenly to be sent off, together with a few thousand others, to join the Vietnam front. We would be sent to fight in foreign land, among foreign people -- people of another religion. We would have to struggle against our fellow countrymen, and to do so we must have ready access to the arms with which they would try to defend themselves. And we must use our own arms to defend ourselves, and our fellows, against them"(52).
Similarly to the American Jewish Establishment, who could not "redefine the struggle as a class war which, though a struggle within the Jewish people, does not involve the Jewish religion" (53), Kahane could not redefine the Palestinian-Israeli conflict as a class warfare of Palestinians fighting for their land versus Israelis struggling for their survival. He saw the war in the context of nationalism and race wars, and hence of "mak[ing] the Jewish people a righteous, holy, and chaste nation" (64). In this struggle, Kahane believed that violence was the only method of achieving his goals.
Like Fanon, Zizek and Kahane believed that the end did justify the means as long as no one is actually hurt. "Whatever we may do, if we don't kill a single innocent person we won't bring a single Palestinian to his knees, because this is a war, for which the only weapons possible are weapons of war"(64). "No one should claim that there is no connection between Jews and Israel. Every Jew who holds the state in his heart, even secretly, is an Israeli in the heart and body"(65).
In this context, Zizek and Kahane believed that while violence may be ineffectual, it is an acceptable method for achieving one's goals. As much as both Fanon and Zizek believed their methods were morally sound, it is apparent that Kahane's are not. It is this difference in morality of the three men, this difference in their relation to religion and to violence, that gives Fanon and Zizek credibility in their analysis of violence whereas Kahane does not.
However, there is not just a relationship between violence and the American Jewish Establishment. Rather, there is an almost uncanny similarity in the views of all three theorists when examining Judaism and race. In his analysis of the relationship between Judaism and race, Zizek writes: "But it is hard to find a passage of the Old Testament not charged with anti-black racism. One of the major themes of the Old Testament is the racial/cultural Othering of blacks, and the inevitability of the clash between blacks and the Israelites" (144).
Similarly, Kahane describes the struggle of Zionist youth groups, who he refers to as "Zionist youth" (52), as they "would, of course, not be allowed to openly attack Jews... The young men therefore, as the [American] Jewish Establishment feared, were forced to seek an alternative expression for their anger"(53). Kahane goes on to say, "The alternative was a struggle to cleanse Israel of non-Jews. This was an effort of extreme importance for the future of the Jewish state" (53). "In 1952 we founded the Kibbutz Movement, and we made a conscious effort to cleanse the kibbutzim of non-Jews. In fact, the whole youth organization was directed to take this effort on as the most important one. We used to say in meetings that there were three kinds of people who were a danger to Israel and to Judaism. Non-Jews who live among us; assimilated Jews who have forgotten their history... And the third danger was Jews who had forgotten their history" (35). "When I entered the religious kibbutzim, I was the one who asked to see the Arab villages... We learned our Judaism from those Arab villages, not from the yeshiva" (69).
Zizek says the same: "In its
