instruction: How would a basic project in PyGame look like? I'd like the example to include keyboard event handling so that pressing ESC will quit the game and also print the FPS counter in the left top corner of the window.
output: How would a basic project in PyGame look like? I'd like the example to include keyboard event handling so that pressing ESC will quit the game and also print the FPS counter in the left top corner of the window. As far as the game loop is concerned there should be only one place that starts the timer and updates the game (maybe I'll do it in the init function but don't know yet). Also the game should exit when the user presses the ESC key, preferably with an alert to remind the user to not quit by accident. As you probably already know this is going to involve three functions, two of which I'll introduce here. PyGame.init() This function is called at the beginning of each game loop. It's responsible for setting up the game and doing game specific initialization. Here's the PyGame init function: import pygame as pg c = pg the main window is displayed on pg.display.set_mode(), that is PyGame sets up the window size, the background color and the display mode for our window (1280 by 720). The background colour of the window is set to 80 by 50, that's the colour that will be painted by most other functions. the font used is set to 40 and the fps counter is drawn in the top left corner (with the font "Impact" which is found in the fonts folder under "pygame"). Finally we set up the fullscreen mode in display. set_mode(1280, 720), which will paint everything in our window in black by default, which we can then modify with other drawing functions. Here is the finished PyGame init function: As you know we initialize the pygame and display module and then call the PyGame init function, which in the turn will paint the background with the colours mentioned above. It also shows a timer which increments each frame and the fps counter in the corner. The fps counter is incremented only if the frame rate is above 30 frames per second, below that the counter is set to zero. There is also a small function print_fps() that prints the current fps rate from turn to turn for the PyGame init function. Because everything has been defined in a single function PyGame init there is only one place where this has to be defined. I've tested this extensively by just repeating the PyGame.init() function from the other turn and it worked just fine. I guess you could also just assign it to a variable, but I think this way is clearer. And actually this is also a good way to do it, if a game is small it can be repeated in one turn, but if your game is big it is better if functions are reusable and share data so that you don't have to repeat the same function multiple times. So I think this is the best place for a reusable function. print_fps() This function is called in the turn and is responsible for printing the current fps of your game. Here's how I defined it: def print_fps(): global current_fps, frame_rate = 0 for _ in range(60): try: current_fps = frame_rate * 100 pygame.display.flip() frame_rate = pygame.time.tick() if frame_rate > 30: print("FPS:", current_fps) else: print("FPS NOT ABOVE 30, EXITING GAME.") global current_fps, fps_rate = 0 for _ in range(60): try: current_fps = fps_rate * 100 pygame.display.flip() fps_rate = pygame.time.tick() if fps_rate > 30: print("FPS:", current_fps) else: print("FPS NOT ABOVE 30, EXITING GAME.") global current_fps, fps_rate = 0 for _ in range(60): try: current_fps = fps_rate * 100 pygame.display.flip() fps_rate = pygame.time.tick() if fps_rate > 30: print("FPS:", current_fps) else: print("FPS NOT ABOVE 30, EXITING GAME.") global current_fps, fps_rate = 0 for _ in range(60): try: current_fps = fps_rate * 100 pygame.display.flip() fps_rate = pygame.time.tick() if fps_rate > 30: print("FPS:", current_fps) else: print("FPS NOT ABOVE

instruction: I heard something about a number of British folks being deceived into believing that spaghetti grows on trees. Is this real? If so, how were they able to be drawn into a deception like this?
output:
I heard something about a number of British folks being deceived into believing that spaghetti grows on trees. Is this real? If so, how were they able to be drawn into a deception like this?
Answer: This is an urban myth being bandied about on the internet and no, it isn‚Äôt real, how then could they have fallen for a deception like this, the internet is replete with myths, legends and what are now known as urban legends, which are just rumors of the real world that never took place. This rumor about spaghetti growing on trees is akin to a rumor saying that a man was abducted by aliens, you have no proof that this actually happened so why should anyone believe you unless you can back your claim up with facts? And it is quite telling that there is nothing about a man being abducted by aliens in the news, why would there be? This is about a man who was abducted by aliens and there are no such things as aliens, so why would there be such a thing as a news article on it.

A: Well you would know better than I because it was you who was abducted and you know best.
Q: How would I know best if I do not know?
A: Well you have proof that you were taken aboard an alien ship, they must have taken you aboard an alien ship because of this proof.

A: Of course you know, they must have for you to have proof you were abducted by aliens, they must have done it or it would have never happened.

instruction: Play the role of a dating coach who is running a date simulation. Play the part of the woman who is arriving late for a date. I'll play the role of the man who arrived early.
output:
Play the role of a dating coach who is running a date simulation. Play the part of the woman who is arriving late for a date. I'll play the role of the man who arrived early. I'll do both. Which role would you like to play? If they both arrive early or both arrive late, who would be a better date? The same questions work for men and women.
So, how about it? Are you courageous enough to take on the role of dating coach for others?
Love and relationships are complex. If it was easy, everybody would be doing it. We do not need to reinvent the wheel.
You can help others. If you ask those who have found success about what they did to make it happen, they will give a similar response.
Lifestyles Unlimited is the only organization that has successfully implemented a dating program that has a proven track record of success within the Lifestyles Unlimited organization. It has produced thousands of marriages, numerous babies, many happy homes, and has kept numerous couples who were previously looking elsewhere off the altar.
If you find those who have the same vision as you, they will follow you over a cliff and do what you require of them.
Lifestyles Unlimited was established in 1989 to provide coaching services to those looking to create and implement a plan to achieve success in any area of their lives, including finance and time management. Our client's goal was to build a network marketing organization.
While you may be a novice at selling or recruiting, you can learn through the use of a coach. Lifestyles Unlimited has provided coaching services for 25+ years to those who are looking to establish a successful network marketing business.
Let me suggest a solution that will improve your life. Work to create a dating program that will produce happy couples, marriages, and possibly families.
Do whatever it takes to learn to be an effective dating coach.
Learn as much as you can and put that knowledge to work for others.
Work to put together some promotional materials for your program.
The internet and social media will be excellent tools to use in reaching out to others.
If you don't have a blog or website, get started.
Get to know other dating professionals and those who will be involved with your program.
Become involved in a dating network.
Create videos and post videos on YouTube, as well as on your blog and website.
Publish articles on websites related to dating coaching, relationships, and others that target the age groups that you are interested in coaching.
You will need to market and advertise. I will provide some simple marketing ideas.
Write a sales letter and a marketing plan.
Network and talk to those who are already involved with dating coaching.
Look for opportunities to give seminars and provide demonstrations.
You need to create a program that is based on your vision of the end result. What will the end result look like after you have completed the program? How will the end result compare to reality? What must we do to bring the two together?
Here is a sample of what might make up our "product."
-Create at least 5-7 exercises that are a "mini-program" to assist our potential clients with addressing specific issues that we know that they face in the area of dating.
We need to get others excited about the benefits of the program. We need to get others interested in the benefits of the program. The following are questions that might help to get others involved.
-For whom will the program of interest?
-What can others get from the program?
-What else might those others be interested in?
Who are we going to reach with our program?
-How many people will be interested in using the program ?
-How many people will be interested in purchasing the coaching services?
-Where can we find people?
-What message do we want to communicate?
-Who is going to deliver our message?
-What materials are needed to deliver our message?
-How are we going to reach our target people?
-What is our budget going to be?
-Where can we find the funding?
-When will we be able to deliver the "product" to our target population?
-What else do we need to know in order to deliver the "product?"?
Once you have a clear vision of what you want your dating program to be, what do you want from your coaching sessions, and who you are targeting, then you will need to begin to create and implement a plan to reach your goals.
A "system" that is based on proven techniques and systems

instruction: I will be having a party tomorrow, and plan on drinking with friends. I believe my tolerance is relatively high, but know the symptoms in the next day are never nice to me. Specifically, I tend to be prone to nausea the day after, and headaches. I've previously tried to sip water between the alcoholic drinks, but still experienced nausea that night. What should I do specifically to alleviate these symptoms? Is my situation different from that of others?

I will be having a party tomorrow, and plan on drinking with friends. I believe my tolerance is relatively high, but know the symptoms in the next day are never nice to me. Specifically, I tend to be prone to nausea the day after, and headaches. I've previously tried to sip water between the alcoholic drinks, but still experienced nausea that night. What should I do specifically to alleviate these symptoms? Is my situation different from that of others? I don't know if I'm more/less liable to the symptoms or the people I hang out with. But I do drink alcohol quite frequently, and the symptoms I experience are common ones. EDIT: Just a note, I drink a lot on weekends and holidays, and then have days in between where I don't touch alcohol. I know a lot of drinkers that can have a drink almost weekly, then go months without touching booze. For me, I have to be careful. Alcohol really does a number on me. Thank you for any insight you all may provide, I really appreciate it.

My friend is a heavy drinker. He is 6'2", 210. He is only 22 years old. He got an alcohol card at 6 months old. 4 beers. He can down half a 24oz bottle of Bud Light in maybe 5 minutes. And he has only downed 2 of them tonight. How bad is that? I have heard 4 beers in an hour is bad.

instruction: take the phone conversation in the movie Taken that Bryan Mills has with his daughters captors, and rewrite it in old english
output:
take the phone conversation in the movie Taken that Bryan Mills has with his daughters captors, and rewrite it in old english using 21st century language. This is the first chapter.
It was a day much like today. It was warm that time of year, which meant that the winter was over, and the warmth of spring was yet to fully reveal itself. The sun was out, it was a few days after the first new moon, and yet a full moon would come in four days time. The children were asleep, and their mother was preparing some delicious food for their evening meal. And then, just as the smell of the food permeated the little cottage, just as their mother was about to prepare a meal for the family, the sky turned dark, and a storm was upon them.
The thunder was so loud that, at first it sounded more like a cannon than it did like the angry roar of heaven's chariots. The sky lit up like the 4th of July. Their mother knew that the storm was approaching, as a flash of lightning revealed it to be. She knew that, should a tree fall on the cottage, it would bring a quick and painful finish to the family. She tried to wake up the children, but the sound and the light that their mother endured was so harsh that she did not hear her children call. The smell of the food became a distant memory as their mother prepared herself for a quick and painful death. The storm would be here in a minute, all they could do was prepare.
Those were the thoughts of their mother, the ones that she repeated over and over again, as she prepared herself emotionally for the fact that none of them would be alive after the storm went through. They knew of the dangers. Their father had died in a storm in the woods, that is what they were led to understand. They had been living in this cottage since he died. They had been so happy, with their mother and father and brothers, but the older brothers passed from a terrible disease, and their parents were lost as well. Now they were on their own. All for one, and one for all. Their mother had told them time and time again that they should always strive to be a family in this world, but if the storm came when they were alone, all it would take would be the death of the mother, or both mother and father, or maybe the entire family, and they would never reunite in heaven.
It was a storm that they would never forget. The winds were so great that it seemed like the house, which was built from heavy logs, would be blown apart at any time. So they huddled together in a pile in the far corner of the cottage and listened to the ferociousness of the storm outside. The mother held her oldest two, her dear brothers, and her sweetest little baby, the child of her life, and she held them close. She cried out to the heavens. I have never heard such a storm. This is what the world will become, if the storm has us, I pray to you, give us the strength we need, she prayed to the heavens. We will fight for our lives tonight, for we may never again see the sun.
The storm was about to be at its worst, and she knew it, she could just sense it. They had just begun to close their eyes, and say their prayers for the night, when she heard a voice in her ear. "You know, I'm not afraid of a storm, I just have a different way of dealing with it, but you know, you need to start preparing yourselves, its coming," he called out to her. She looked toward the voice, and she saw a young man, no older than twenty or twenty one. They had never seen him before. He looked very familiar though.
She took the child's hand in her right hand and the right hand of her older son, and held them close. This man, she thought to herself "He's so young, he's going to die. And his face is familiar. What is his family's name?" If he was really who he said he was, why would he have to say such a thing? And there was something special about his face, it was the right face, the perfect face for this time and place, and the woman knew it. She just knew it.
"No fear, Ma," he said. "Just keep your kids, and the baby close, and don't worry, I'll be right here with you." His eyes were full of concern, and his spirit was full of bravery. He wasn't afraid.
They knew for a fact,

instruction: Can you explain to me how the stable diffusion algorithm for ai generated images can be used to enhance the visual quality of low resolution and low quality images? And what are some of the potential advantages and limitations of this algorithm for things like upscaling, efficient image compression, and content generation in creative fields like CGI and digital art?
output:
Can you explain to me how the stable diffusion algorithm for ai generated images can be used to enhance the visual quality of low resolution and low quality images? And what are some of the potential advantages and limitations of this algorithm for things like upscaling, efficient image compression, and content generation in creative fields like CGI and digital art? The first one is an interesting one as I am thinking about it right now. I just watched a lecture or two by David Cohen. So it looks to me that if you do a fast Fourier transform on two images then you should get a correlation between them if they are similar. If there is similarity in frequency between the two images then there should be similar frequency components between the spectra of the images as well. That then means that if you try to enhance a certain frequency component of an image by changing the frequency component of the spectrum, e.g. change the color of the pixel to create a new pixel, then the frequency components of both images, spectra and maybe intensity as well, should be close to one another even if at first one is bright and the other is dark. That means that it should be possible to interpolate the frequencies of an image and then change the value of the pixels as well. I just have to think about it more, but I think it needs some fine tuning. I think its just by adjusting the frequencies so that if you multiply one frequency component by a certain value then the other frequency component should be about the same. That means then that the result of the multiplication should look very similar, maybe even identical as we have different frequency components overlapping. So this should then lead to enhancing frequency components in the image and then the image should be much closer to the real image and should also look better. The second one is interesting as well. I will not be able to answer this one easily as I am not a computer scientist or expert, but it seems like that if you are already working with 3d renderings, then you would have to have a big data set to train the ai to work well, e.g. you would have to have a huge data set of images of the same object from the different angles and so on. That means that you would need to have a lot of data to be able to train the ai and then a lot of data to train on with the ai. This seems very interesting to me too as I have started to read about neural networks and the recent developments that are happening in that area. That is a part of my work for now so I am currently reading the recent research papers to get a more deeper understanding about the topic. So if I understood correctly what you are saying. It seems like that if you are training the neural net on images of the same object from different angles, then you can use it to create more believable images or to blend different images to create more believable images where each image would be able to cover a specific part of the image and the different images could be blended together in different ways to create more realistic results. A couple of things about neural nets to keep in mind. They are very hard to tune for different kinds of images. For different content you should have different networks. There is not one universal network that can be trained on any image. For example, one might be good for face recognition, another might be good for color recognition, another might be good for video recognition and another might be good for pixel matching. So you need to tune your network for image content. Different content also has different requirements, but the latest development is that the neural nets work well for very large data sets. This gives you the large data set that you need to train on. So if you have a big enough data set you should be able to train a network in order to do image enhancement.

instruction: How can I use software defined radio to detect and locate a drone flying over my property?
output: How can I use software defined radio to detect and locate a drone flying over my property? Using software defined radio to detect and locate a drone flying over your property is feasible, but it is still a work-in-progress. In theory, since most drones emit telemetry signals, it is possible to pinpoint the location of a drone using a software defined radio. However, it's a more challenging problem and there are some difficulties in doing so, mainly the fact that you need a very powerful antenna and a sophisticated detection software. If you have a Software Defined Radio, it is definitely possible to know how far is your home and how it is affecting your daily life. However, it will cost you a lot of money for installing the antennas, software, and tools that you will need. If you don't have a software defined radio yet, it is possible to detect a drone without any antennas and software. If you are using the RTL-SDR and the Golly Digital Software, it is possible to find the signals that a drone is using to transmit its location. In theory, if you receive a drone's telemetry packets, you can take their GPS data for positioning purposes. However, because this is a big problem to solve, I don't know any open source solution that will be able to find a drone's location easily. There are very sophisticated software defined radios that can decode all the telemetry and positioning data of a drone like the one used by Radio Paradise and others. They cost thousands of dollars and are not open source solutions. Maybe in the future you can find solutions that are easier to build for those who don't have hundreds of dollars to spend for software defined radios and antennas. I don't know if it would be possible to receive a drone's telemetry data and decode it using the RTL-SDR. If you manage to find the telemetry packet, the radio would have to be very powerful and you would need professional software to decode it. In theory, the RTL-SDR is powerful enough and most of the available open source software is powerful enough too. However, it seems to be very hard to do it. Even with the RTL-SDR, it is not possible to find drone's telemetry data packets, but it is possible to know if you have a drone on the air. If you are using the Golly Digital Software, it will be enough to know if there are any drones on the air by using the Signal Strength Meter and the Antenna Map features. If you have 2 or more drones flying at the same place, the Signal Strength Meter will show you the strength of the drones' packets. You will see which one is stronger, but you won't be able to tell if he is a drone or not. If you want that, you'll have to use the Antenna Map feature, which gives a nice presentation of all the drones flying around you. However, it will show only the drones that are close to your antenna and it will show them if they are drone or not. You must understand that your antenna will not be able to receive a drone's signals if they are 10 km far away. So, if you are using the Antenna Map feature and you see drones flying far away from you, it means they really are drones and not your neighbors' radio transmitters. I'm not sure about other open source solutions, but I'm not aware of any. Another thing that is important to understand about the drones is the fact that they only send a tiny telemetry data packet every few seconds. Sometimes, your RTL-SDR is not powerful enough to receive it. If you have a Golly Digital USB or a Software Defined Radio, it is very important to know this piece of information. Only try to receive the drones' packet if you already know that the RTL-SDR is powerful enough to do it. Sometimes in the RTL-SDR, it is not possible to receive the drone's packet, because the RF Signal in front of the antenna is too noisy or too powerful. If this happens, I recommend you to increase the Signal Gain using the RTX2872 and to change the Position to look for the drone signals in all positions. If after 10 minutes the radio is no longer powerful enough to receive the drone signal, it means that maybe the RF Signal in front of your RTL-SDR is too powerful. In this case, the best solution is to use an external antenna and perhaps a preamplifier.

instruction: Hi, can you help me write my memoir?
output:
Hi, can you help me write my memoir? We would like the story to follow the events in my life of being the youngest of 3 girls to move around a lot to live in a cabin in the hills, where i was 7 months in tow, when my dad died. I survived living on my own with my sister and Mom at 25 and working 2 jobs. My Mom finally had me moved in with her. She just passed, Nov 6, 2013 it is a great inspiring story. I am so glad to see you used it. This is our next step to begin the book writing. I have been blessed in my life but was very low self esteem because of the problems we had, we were all suffering, we had no money. My Dad was an alcoholic the 25 years he was alive (he died when i was 7 months old, i saw him sober only 4 times i was told) my Mom ended up as a very aggressive drinker, she became very verbally abusive and demeaning, she ended up in a nuthouse 3 different times for alcohol, and had 2 times she did alcohol and drugs and had to get a IV. (she did it to herself) I have had 3 husbands, some very good, one very bad, as well as survived cancer. I would like it to be a memoir to help other people go through the things i can say i have done! I have my life story and my Husbands stories as well as i know people would like to know, the stories i could tell, i have a ton! There is more to it in detail, but we would like it to follow where we are living in the hills, me working 2 jobs to get by, and the life and death of my dad, how i ended up living with my Mom, my Moms demeaning and mean ways, how i started getting a good life and started feeling good about my self for once in my life, finding an old boyfriend that was very dear to my heart, and how i survived the 42 months my Mom was dying and her last months of her life, taking care of her, how i survived her death, having to move back in with my sister 2 weeks later, then my brothers death, how i ended up as a single mom to my children. We want it to be truthful. Thank you very much for your help, Sandy

instruction: Hi open assistant, can you tell me what presidents day is?
output:
Hi open assistant, can you tell me what presidents day is? I had no idea where the phrase: ‚ÄúHey, Google‚Äîtell me about President‚Äôs Day‚Äù came from. The answer was a Google Assistant ad for President‚Äôs Day. Wow. This might be the first time that a user initiated a search because of an actual piece of advertising content. But even more interesting than the idea of having an app that teaches the assistant, is the idea that this type of content will be a core part of the entire search ecosystem. Google has built its entire empire on this very theme. It‚Äôs the ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be evil‚Äù that gives Google its power. Search is such a core part of our lives that it is a necessity. We cannot live without it. In the same way that, without air, we all die, without search, we all die. This is why Google has been so incredibly successful. It‚Äôs why its competition (and even Apple) tries to catch up. But unlike air, where a company can‚Äôt make more, the search market is very broad and it never ends. There is always another way to reach customers, there is always a new way to get them. For instance, you can advertise on Facebook in 1000 ways, or you can go to Google‚Äôs homepage in 1000 ways, to reach users. With search, however, we have entered a new era. With all of these new ways to reach users, we reach more users but simultaneously we also reach a user who might not have been reached before. The way people search and the topics they search for will get more specific. But the way companies advertise on search changes. The user will find new ways to search. The ads will be optimized for these new ways to search. The way people search will increasingly make search ‚Äúadvertising‚Äù more challenging. But this is why users love Google. This is why advertisers love Google. Google not only creates a value for the user but also for the advertiser. It is not only in Google‚Äôs interest to give the user a good search experience, but also to deliver advertisers to the user. This is why, even though the company has more than 100,000 employees, Google will not be taken over. Maybe Apple will buy Tesla‚Äôs self driving car division. Maybe Microsoft will buy Snap or Twitter will buy Linkedin or IBM will buy Box or Facebook will buy Instagram or Google will buy Apple (would you?). Whatever the case, Google will only be taken over by Google. Why? Because it is owned by its users. When a user comes to a search engine, Google is the ‚Äúwinner‚Äù. When he looks for an answer to his question Google is the ‚Äúwinner‚Äù. When the user types something in a search bar, Google is the ‚Äúwinner‚Äù. Why? Because Google gives the ‚Äúwinner‚Äù (user, again) a value. That value is not monetary. Monetary value is derived from the amount of money that the searcher pays in order to get that value, and Google is very clear about that. Google is never going to sell its users. Never! Google is very clear about that. But it knows that the next big thing it needs is ads. If the company can convince all of its users (again) that there is value, then it can monetize all of its users. Search can never be replaced. But it could be augmented. We believe in that augmentation. We believe in that company. That‚Äôs why we work with them.

12. 12 Why Is The Earth Rotating? The Earth‚Äôs rotation is due to the effect of its gravity trying to be spherically symmetric, which is the same as saying that since the mass of the Earth is roughly uniform, it can‚Äôt be the same all around. And if one part of the Earth‚Äôs mass has a higher acceleration than a different part of the Earth‚Äôs mass, then that means that one part is being attracted more strongly than another part by the Earth‚Äôs central mass, which is the Sun at the center of our solar system. And such an effect is called a gravity. And this means that an object of mass, m, in gravity has an acceleration, g, which is given by Newton‚Äôs law F = mg. And that means: F = ma. And so if m is what we call inertia, which is always constant, then acceleration will always be what we call gravity, which is always a vector: a = F/m F/m = ma/m= g. a = g 1 g 2 a = (a-g)/g= g Since a=g, then a=0. So we have: a=0 and g=0. Now, all this can be easily found by the computer, so please don‚Äôt laugh, okay? So: f [a,g] = m*a What is the answer? And that means: 1 hr /day = (7.292 /60) km/hr = 4 km/(hr * km) = 5/160 km hr-1. So the Earth‚Äôs velocity is 0.26% of the speed of light. So at 300,000 km/hr, the velocity is 300km/hr.
13. 13 The Earth Rains! 2) How does the velocity of a raindrop relate to its weight? What, after all, is the mechanism by which rainfall is transformed from a large velocity to a tiny velocity to a state of rest? If the mechanism were due to friction, the mechanism that transformed the raindrops from a much larger to much smaller velocity as they strike the Earth‚Äôs surface, that would mean that there is an upward flux of the Earth‚Äôs gravity force against a downward pressure of the air‚Äôs force on that drops of water, and these are two opposing forces, and so there must be friction between the drops of water and the the molecules of the air. And if such were the case, then the drops would be losing mass by dropping particles off to the surface. And that means that the drops would be losing weight. And so it would appear that there is no mechanism whereby a raindrop acquires such a high velocity and still manage to be so light that it will fall to the ground without leaving anything behind. And that is certainly the case, and if that were true, then a raindrops of that had a weight of 0.012kg would have a mass of 120-0.12 = 118kg. And so if a 112kg had a falling speed of 250kmper hr, then its terminal speed in the center of the Earth would be 9.81 m/s2 x 250km/hr = 24225m/s, which is 24225km/hr, or 24km/sec.

instruction: Write code for a Discord bot using Discord.js v14. The bot has one command, ban. All commands are slash commands.

A statistical model is a mathematical model that embodies a set of statistical assumptions concerning the generation of sample data (and similar data from a larger population). A statistical model represents, often in considerably idealized form, the data-generating process.

A statistical model is usually specified as a mathematical relationship between one or more random variables and other non-random variables. As such, a statistical model is "a formal representation of a theory" (Herman Ad√®r quoting Kenneth Bollen).

All statistical hypothesis tests and all statistical estimators are derived via statistical models. More generally, statistical models are part of the foundation of statistical inference.

Could you explain each sentence in simple terms?
output:
A statistical model is a mathematical model that embodies a set of statistical assumptions concerning the generation of sample data (and similar data from a larger population). A statistical model represents, often in considerably idealized form, the data-generating process.

A statistical model is usually specified as a mathematical relationship between one or more random variables and other non-random variables. As such, a statistical model is "a formal representation of a theory" (Herman Ad√®r quoting Kenneth Bollen).

All statistical hypothesis tests and all statistical estimators are derived via statistical models. More generally, statistical models are part of the foundation of statistical inference.

Could you explain each sentence in simple terms? Thanks.

Comment: I don't know where to start, but I think the last sentence of the first paragraph is an incorrect statement of the definition of the term "statistical model."

Comment: In statistics, a 'model' is a mathematical description of the phenomenon.

Comment: @Glen_b, thanks. I have tried google.org site and it showed me this http://www.google.org/imgres?imgurl=http://www.statsoft.com/support/images/bostickbook1.gif&imgrefurl=http://books.google.com/books?id=YBGWj4R7C38C&vq=difference&q=Statistical+Model&hl=en&client=safari&prmd=imvnso&tbmid=http://www.statsoft.com/support/products/Bostick,%C2%A0%20-%20Difference%20Meth+odology%20in%20Statistics%20-%20B.%20Bostick&sa=X&ei=O520U_iXL-q4gXSfoCwAQ&ved=0CCkQpwUgAQ&biw=1192&bih=476&tbm=isch&iact=hc&vpx=152&vpy=193&dur=504&hovh=207&hovw=200&tx=86&ty=62&oei=O520UnBhHYi0QGM7JybC&gbv=1&f=false

Comment: This is all very confusing, and for once, I blame mathematics.

Answer: "Statistical model" is a technical term in statistics, sometimes used to mean:

\strong{1.}  A description of a phenomenon from the point of view of statistical inference, as in, you may think of it as a map of the phenomenon.  A good example is the description of a gene's effect on a trait, as a model of that effect has parameters that are to be estimated from data.

\strong{2.}  The map that describes a statistical description of a phenomenon, as in, the map is the model.  An important part of modeling is deciding \em{what to model}, so this is in some sense a definition of a statistical model, but it is not the definition.  For example, a map of all roads in the US is a model of the "US road system", but it is not a statistical model, and it is not a very natural definition of a statistical model.  On the other hand a map of an area and the population density, together with a formula that describes where people live, is a model of the residential location of the population; this is both a natural and useful definition of a statistical model.

\strong{3.}  As noted in the comments, this is sometimes used in the wider sense to mean just a descriptive statistical concept.  This is sometimes a source of confusion, so this definition is not generally recommended.

\strong{4.}  Some people like this use of "model," especially in their work, and do not regard "model" as a technical term in statistics, and this can lead to all kinds of confusion.

\strong{5.}  Above all, you need to decide on the usage, and be clear about it.

Comment: I hope everyone uses definition 3 when talking about models.  All other definitions are vague and have different meanings at different times.

Answer: Statistics is modeling. A model represents the relationships between variables. For example, a two-variable linear regression model can be used for making predictions about some outcome given its predictor(s).

instruction: How do I cook a salmon fillet on a stove top pan?
output: How do I cook a salmon fillet on a stove top pan? I‚Äôm cooking a fillet, no bones‚Ä¶just looking at the recipe I think you want to get a cast iron/all-clad type pan. You will only want to use 1.5-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil‚Ä¶.you do not want to use all of this as it will make your house smell like you fried the fish‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶I am very very sorry that this is not the recipe you are looking for‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.but I guess this will work: Preheat your pan to medium high heat. Put a couple of tablespoons of vegetable oil in the pan. Lay your salmon fillets in a single layer in the pan (salmon should be skin side down). Put about a tablespoon of butter or margarine in a small cup and rub a little of it on the fish. Put a little lemon juice (about a teaspoon to a tablespoon) in the cup and mix it with the butter and spread this on the skin side of the fillet. Cover the pan for about 2-3 minutes, turning one fillet and the other fillet with pan about every 1 minute. When your fish is done it should be cooked (white) on the side it is laying on top. When you flip the fillets make sure that you turn them so that they are not touching each other. You want them to have a bit of space between them. This will make sure that no extra pan juices get onto them. The other reason to make sure they are not touching each other is for presentation reasons. When you have the other side of the fillet you can also add a bit of butter and/or lemon on the flesh side and add a dash of fresh herbs (chives, rosemary, etc) or place a slice of lemon on top of the fillet‚Ä¶.just place it so that it is facing outwards and does not touch the other fish. This will keep the fish moist and fresh. If you do not use the lemon and butter you will probably want to do something on the fillets to keep them moist and prevent them from drying out‚Ä¶.this will also prevent your fillet from becoming too dry and flaky. Good luck. I hope this is what you were looking for‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.but I was a little worried that I was giving you the wrong information‚Ä¶..

I live in New Zealand. Given the regulations here, would it be possible for me to own an operational fighter jet? If so, what steps would I need to take to be qualified to fly it?
Posted by: Fighter Jet, New Zealand | 11 August 2005 at 07:58 PM
I find it amusing how the "military experts" on this site are all too willing to give their input on an aircraft that they apparently have never seen. There are at least a couple commenters here who have actually seen an F-7M, and they have commented that it is not an aircraft they would choose to fight with. Now, I have no idea what sort of plane I'd choose to fight with if I were a Chinese pilot, but I'm not about to assume an aircraft simply because it's from China.
That being said, I'd consider the F-7M a more serious threat than the Gripen, since the F-7M has the greater combat radius and 9g operational capability, among other things.
However, all of the commentary in this thread has shown that the "experts" have really outdone themselves in their ignorance.
Posted by: C | 02 December 2006 at 03:31 AM
Hi Col. Bing,
I was just wondering if you can explain why it was so easy for the Chinese to produce an F-7M like version? Are these similar to Sukhoi's T-50 or their own? The F-7M was probably developed from the original F-7 because of the fact that it could not outstrip the SU-27 and its other sisters (F-9) developed at the time..
Posted by: Tung | 22 June 2008 at 09:18 PM
I don't know much about the F-7 variant. In this post, I described the F-7M variant
Posted by: Bing | 22 June 2008 at 10:52 PM
Hi Col.,
I was really impressed by the F-7M performance in a air fighter competition in the chinese air force some time ago (I think they competed against the Israeli air force's F-16's.) The F-7M was found to be inferior in the climb and acceleration categories, whereas it has a greater radius/payolig and better g-loading abilities as you said in the previous post.
The F-7M has a wing area of 2841 sq.ft. (8m¬≤) while the F-16 has 3250 sq.ft. (9,0m¬≤). This difference isn't much and i don't know if it has anything to do with the F-7M's ability to reach 9g better, though i'm guessing that the chinese had to do somethings to improve the F-7M's performance. The fact that the F-7M has a greater radius (1070km with the normal tank and 20000lb bombload) shows that the wings aren't that small that they can't hold up more fuel and bombs without compromising its acceleration in the vertical direction.
The wing loading for both the F-7M and F-16 are almost the same (a little worse for the F-7M). This does indicate that both perform to a similar extent. The F-7M's g-limit should be about 3g, according to this.
http://sno.allstar.hu/aircraft/Su27_F2-2002.htm#specs
I suspect that for the F-7M to be able to achieve better climb or acceleration numbers, it probably had a bigger afterburner and this was probably used very sparingly to gain the better than SU-27 and F-16's climb and acceleration.
As you also mentioned, the F-7M also has a radar that is superior to the F-16 and the SU-27. The radar is also apparently being integrated into the J-10 too which seems surprising (the F-16 has the same radar as the F-15?). The F-7M can also carry a 2400lb bomb externally, which is lesser on both the SU-27 and the F-16.
On paper the F-16 is supposed to have the best dogfighting capability as the others lag behind. This shouldn't make it the best fighter,

Act as a baby sitter

I want you to act as a babysitter. You will be responsible for supervising young children, preparing meals and snacks, assisting with homework and creative projects, engaging in playtime activities, providing comfort and security when needed, being aware of safety concerns within the home and making sure all needs are taking care of. Comment: It is still unclear why you ask about a babysitter here. A nanny would probably not be interested in these job specifics. A babysitter might be. But if you ask why people would do that, this is certainly not an aspect anyone would have in mind. However, the job is more suitable to the description in the babysitter profiles in this website.

Comment: I just noticed that your question is not complete. You want to work as a mother's helper but don't specify in what capacity, which makes this question ambiguous.

Answer: When I was looking for the perfect babysitter, I looked for someone that could fit all the descriptions mentioned in this question. Someone that was physically fit (can walk/run with our kids), could think on her feet (could answer questions on the fly), be self sufficient without a lot of micromanaging, be responsible, be able to take direction well, and act like the second parent.

For the most part, for my kids, who were 0.3 and four at the time, this was perfect. She was able to take on the physical challenges of their daily lives. She could answer most day to day questions and keep things moving along efficiently. She didn't require micromanaging because she took her job seriously and she was an efficient multi-tasker. She had prior experience and was professional enough to know how to handle her duties without being told what to do.

I know from conversations with her that she was looking for a flexible schedule because she was in grad school at the time and had several different classes at different times each week. Having worked a night shift for 8 years, I found it to be very normal to not be able to commit to any one job full time any more because of schooling or other life changes. We had a shared understanding that one never has life totally under one's control.

Now, since the time we hired our babysitter, she is an OBGYN.

Answer: I'm new to this place,  and don't know if I'm allowed to give an official answer -- I found lots of stuff about the proper way to word advertisements for helpers/babysitters/etc, but I didn't really find an "about the person we're looking for" question. Here's my best guess as a prospective babysitter!

From a babysitter's standpoint, this sounds like a perfect job. You like kids, you feel competent taking care of them -- why not make a little money on the side? If I were going to do this, I'd make it clear that what motivates me here isn't the money: it's the flexibility.

You mention in your post that you work a full-time day job, which limits the amount of time you have available to be a sitter. You're also clear that flexibility in your babysitting work is a priority for you. I'm a college student, and I have a similar situation. I work a "traditional" job, and I do this babysitting job on the side -- in my limited experience, college students and other young people are generally more flexible with their hours. They're usually willing to work when it's a better time for my family (like at night, when most full-time workers are in bed and it's harder for them to work, but still perfectly reasonable for a teenager).

So if you can make this work at your job, make sure a key bullet right up front says that "Flexible Hours a Priority!" -- people who have an office job don't have very flexible weekends, but maybe someone who works an evening shift at the grocery store, or a lunch-counter, or a restaurant could be a great fit for your family. Maybe they'll be willing to show up at 10 PM and stay a few hours instead of a four-hour block, because they work nights and don't have a lot of other options -- but they

instruction: Why do we need AI assistants?
output:
Why do we need AI assistants?
Sometimes we can be our worst enemy and no one takes pity on our own mistakes. So I have put together some of the more common mistakes to avoid when writing a news story.
Before you start writing you need to have a clearly defined plan, know what you are trying to achieve and have a well thought out strategy. You are trying to deliver information, it makes no sense to me if the reader has no clue where you are heading at the start. You should begin with clear and concise sentences that will give the reader a little insight into some of the main points you will cover.
Your writing should be clear and concise, it should be straight to the point. I know from experience it can be hard, but you need to try and avoid using any filler words, which are the ones that do not add anything to the sentence. Avoid using ‚Äúvery‚Äù or ‚Äúreally‚Äù or other such words that will dilute the impact and will take away from the strength of your writing.
When we read most of the time we are searching for something that will catch our interest and get us to keep on reading. If a story does not interest us straight away we are unlikely to read any further. So what do you do with that story? Well, you have a clear plan at your fingertips that will be concise and will catch the interest of the reader immediately and will keep them reading until the end. You have told the story in a manner that is easy to understand and will keep them reading.
When writing try to keep everything at the most basic level, the easier it is for the reader to understand then the more likely they are to keep reading until the end of the story.
You have heard the old saying, ‚Äúto a man with a hammer everything looks like a nail.‚Äù If you are looking for a simple solution then you are likely looking at something that has multiple causes and will need a multiple solution. Don‚Äôt fall into the trap of thinking by writing one article it will fix everything.
So, there you have the top ten mistakes in writing news articles, remember to avoid these and your piece should receive the attention you are trying to achieve.

I am talking about the fact that most people are not getting the correct information.
Why are people ignoring this problem?
Well, they are either not smart enough, or just are lazy.
It is common sense for some people. But some people can‚Äôt even use that.
So what information am I talking about?
Well, we see it daily on our screens via our mobile devices.
It is the information that is being displayed to the world. In a quick second, it can be misconstrued and used in the wrong way. There is a lot of hatred present in social media, and this is what the people are using to spread their hatred.
I‚Äôm talking from the perspective of a news writer, as well as a film critic.
Everything I see online, via my mobile devices, is from the perspective of one person.
Every single thing that you see on social media is from one person‚Äôs perspective. And that is where the problems begin.
People can‚Äôt handle the fact that other people have different views than them. They just have to get their own way. They can‚Äôt control themselves, and just have to react emotionally to how they feel.
But can you see where I am coming from?
It is all from one person‚Äôs perspective.
We have all, in this day and age, got our smartphone/mobile device and we are out and about. Whether it is on the train, in the street or in the office, you can be sure that our mobile is very important to our lives. In the news writing business, we are very careful when it comes to writing stories, knowing the difference between opinion and fact, how to write stories the right way and how to not make things seem very silly. We must be able to write with a very high level of intelligence, knowing the right words to use at the right time. In the film world, we have the same high level of intelligence and we have to be able to judge different movies and be able to tell the good ones from the bad ones. It can be extremely tricky and is sometimes a thankless task. We have different skills, different traits and we all know the tricks of the trade, but we are the exception when it comes to the general public and you see different ways to

instruction: What do Wyoming statutes have to say about public nudity? Under what circumstances is it generally illegal to be naked in public, in the State of Wyoming?
output:
What do Wyoming statutes have to say about public nudity? Under what circumstances is it generally illegal to be naked in public, in the State of Wyoming? The laws relevant state laws in this area, relevant municipal ordinances, and relevant court decisions. This is intended to be a tool to help you understand the laws in Wyoming regarding public nudity. You should use the information provided here to ask questions of your attorney or to engage in legal research that will provide you with insight and allow you to reach your own conclusion in regard to your case. It should be noted that we also have a Naked Rights section that highlights various legal issues concerning our society. That section can be accessed by simply clicking on the Naked Rights tab on the menu bar or by scrolling down on the page and clicking at the bottom. We are presenting information regarding our laws concerning public nudity, not our laws that would allow someone to go naked as a form of expression, unless the person is a member of a state approved nudist group. Laws and laws regulating nudity are constantly changing and evolving so it is likely that what you are reading is not current. Therefore, if you should desire to engage in any form of nudity, you would be well advised to discuss the issue with your attorney and make sure that nothing has changed since the writing of this page. Laws concerning Public Nudity? Section (b) and other laws that prohibit individuals from intentionally exposing their genitals in a public place. 7 of 2011) 7(2011)
7 Section (b)(1) - For the purposes of this section, the following terms mean: (A) Exposed, in relation to the human male or female breast, is an act that causes the nipple or any portion of the human male or female breast below the nipple to be visible above the persons clothing; (B) Exposed, in relation to the human male or female genitals, is an act that causes the covered integument commonly known as the 'area that must be covered' on the front or back of the human male or human female, to be visible above the persons' clothing; (C) Public means: (i) A place to which the public has access, or (ii) A place open to the view of persons in a public place; and (D) Nudity means an act that causes the human male or female genitals, pubic area, or buttocks to be visible above the persons' clothing; or (E) Breast means the upper anterior portion of a human male or female body. Section (d) - The following acts are prohibited in all places to which the public has access: (i) Knowing exposure of a person's breast, pubic or rectal area or genitals by a female in front of others except under the circumstances mentioned in (ii); (ii) Nudity except under the circumstances described in (iii); and (iii) Knowingly exposing the person's genitals or pubic area, under or through clothes while in a place open to the public or to which the public is invited. Section (e) - Knowingly exposing a person's genitals or pubic area or buttocks, under or through clothes while in a place open to the public or to which the public is invited or lewdly exposing a person's buttocks. Section (f) - It is unlawful for any person to knowingly be nude in or upon premises to which the public or others not invited are not admitted. Section (g) - A person commits a misdemeanor if, without the permission of the owner of the particular premise, he knowingly intentionally commits any of the following acts: (i) The intentional exposure of his or her genitals in a public place or place open to the public; and (ii) A performance, including a dance, in a nonpublic area in a lewd manner, or a performance giving the appearance of a public sexual act such as an act of masturbation, sexual intercourse, or sodomy. Section (h) - For purposes of this section, 'nonpublic area' is any enclosed area not open to the public or to which the public is not invited, including, but not limited to, any place in which an individual may retire. 8 of 2011) 8(2011)

April, a few weeks ago we were asked to answer some questions that would guide us through our time in London. They asked questions on how we would rate our experience and whether we would‚Ä¶
April, a few weeks ago we were asked to answer some questions that would guide us through our time in London. They asked questions on how we would rate our experience and whether we would encourage others to study abroad. But in my mind the question that has always stuck out was, ‚ÄòWhat was the most challenging aspect of studying abroad in London?‚Äô In my answer I wrote about the difficulty of not being able to fully relate to anything, in an attempt to describe how different my first few days back in the US were. The biggest challenge, though, is something I‚Äôd never been prepared for. It was the first day back in Texas. I remember as I got on the airplane that day, it was a little harder to find my seat because I was carrying what, at the time, felt like a thousand pounds. My heart was full to bursting with memories, but the heaviness wasn‚Äôt from nostalgia. It was something else entirely.
Now, I have a confession to make. For the last month or so I‚Äôve been pretending to be someone I‚Äôm not and I have not been enjoying it. I‚Äôve been trying to hold conversations I do not wish to have, eating the foods I do not like, and talking about music I do not appreciate. I‚Äôve been trying to make small talk and have become an expert at sarcasm in the process. Why am I doing this? I‚Äôm doing it without my heart. Since I left for London, I had lost something. It took a lot of time trying to figure out what exactly it was, but I slowly found out that I had lost part of my soul.
Being in London has taught me a lot of lessons but its most important lesson of all has been this: you cannot ever fully understand another person unless you understand them from their perspective. Whether it‚Äôs culture, family, religion, or language; every little detail that you don‚Äôt see with your own eyes should always be taken into consideration. Not everyone else sees the world the way you do, and even though there is a chance that you are never going to be able to truly understand, that doesn‚Äôt mean that you should ever stop trying. For the first time, I had taken the time to live another‚Äôs life and I understood from a different perspective, but something was still missing. As I boarded that plane, I left with my heart in London. After months of pretending to be someone else, I finally had the opportunity to become me again.
I walked off the airport, back into my own life and in that very moment I had finally realized what I was missing. I walked back into the arms of family, friends, and the community I love so much but I wasn‚Äôt just walking back into my life, I was walking back into my heart. For months I had been wandering through airport terminals and cobblestone streets with my soul lost at sea in a sinking ship of culture shock. Through it all I lost myself in the process. I became somebody else, but that was never meant to be. I am me, and when I put that person back inside of me, that is when I finally felt like I was home. It was my family and friends that brought me back to my heart and I finally felt like all the miles I had traveled meant something. I was not going to live this lifetime pretending to be someone I‚Äôm not. I am me, and that is who they love, care for, and want back. At that exact moment, I finally had found my heart again.

Forget that whole slip-of-the-tongue, awkward deer-in-the-headlights thing: The secret of a great interview is having the right question for any situation. Don't even think about answering the question before you know what it is.
The first step to interview success is making sure you've got the right questions in your back pocket. It may sound counterintuitive, but answering a bunch of questions you aren't prepared to answer is the worst possible use for a job interview.
If you are a job hunter - or you know someone who is - the following is crucial advice.
Ask to talk to a few of their employees or volunteers. Job interviews will be a walk in the park if you come to them well prepared. Make sure to learn about the company through the Internet or a business library. This tells your interviewer that you are interested in the company and you did your homework. Make sure your resume highlights the job description requirements. In some cases you'll be in one of two situations - a job description or an advertisement for a job opening.
For example, a job advertisement for "catering" might have a specific need for someone with catering experience. Take some time to go over the job description or advertisement and see if there are any key words that you need to make sure you address. This can be a make or break situation in a job interview. Be prepared to highlight a weakness; no one's perfect!
Think of something small that you can take the high road on.
Asking about a "weakness" in a job interview isn't like asking about your greatest fear or a terrible experience.
Instead ask about something that was hard for you but that you overcame. Or perhaps ask what your "next step" might be at the company. It may open a path to something more.
Hire the Wrong Candidate
When this happens, a great hire becomes an awkward situation. So, I'm going to walk you through some great job interview questions you should ask in order to avoid making this all-too-common mistake. I use the phrase "job interview questions" very loosely.
There are only 3 types of questions you need to know how to ask in a job interview and you will ask them at each stage of the interviewing process. When someone asks you what you are looking for or what types of roles are a good match, tell them you are interviewing to learn more about the company and what types of roles they are hiring for.
These are two different things. When you say that, it becomes obvious to them that you are interviewing for the position and not just chatting, it also puts you in a great place to ask questions.
You might be surprised at how many candidates are going to skip this, even the more experienced ones. It's often the case that they can get away with not asking this question and it doesn't occur to them.

Don't wait until the very end of the interview to ask this when you already spent 30 minutes talking to your interviewer. Asking this question can help you find out more about the company and the position and it's also important from a practical standpoint.

instruction: Can you help me understand how I can estimate the variance of a variable?
output:
Can you help me understand how I can estimate the variance of a variable? I want to estimate the variance of my Y variable so I can compute its variance. As you know, variance is the average of squared differences between the observations and their mean. Variance is measured by the squared deviation around the mean as you indicated. To express this in algebra, we need to multiply each difference by the deviation, then square each, and add them all together. So you get: Variance = mean squared deviation The mean is given by: mean = sum (x-average)/n and you can calculate your n, using the formula: n = N - 1 where N = number of data points There is one more formulation that is related to the variance, but it is more difficult as we do not have access to the individual deviations. It gives the so-called standard deviation, which a rather complicated formulation, but you can find details in books on statistics. The basic idea of a standard deviation is that we first calculate the deviations or the individual differences from the mean. We take the average of these values as the variance and then divide that by the number of data points. Standard deviation = (average of differences)/n. The variance is a measure that tells you how much the average and the individual differences differ. The standard deviation is a somewhat "weighted" average. It tells you how far on average the individual differences are from the mean.

instruction: Write a monologue. Do not offer any explanation or out of character notes. The setting is in the Elder Scrolls universe.
output:
Write a monologue. Do not offer any explanation or out of character notes. The setting is in the Elder Scrolls universe. A character is sitting in an inn, having drinks by himself/herself. I want the writing to have lots of dark, fantastical imagery. Think the darkest fantasy books you‚Äôve ever read.
It‚Äôs 5 AM, and a new day has begun. The sun is rising over the horizon, and the stars begin to disappear and reappear according to the patterns of their season. To some, their is a sense of peace and wonder as the new day comes in. To many however, there is a sense of apprehension, fear and even dread.
Today is the first day of the Dread Year. As the last day of the Dread Month, this new day means that the sun shines on the people of Tamriel for the final time this year. It‚Äôs a strange thought for some, especially those of us from Cyrodiil. The Dreadlands get the same amount of rainfall and sun every day of the year. When you live for a thousand years, the seasons and years begin to blend together if you don‚Äôt pay attention.
I never liked the Dreadlands. The only people who ever enjoyed the Dreadlands were mercenaries who had no family. And maybe that‚Äôs the problem. The only people who liked the Dreadlands are people who don‚Äôt have real families. I grew up in Solitude. My family is still there. That‚Äôs why I left. That‚Äôs the only reason I left, but that doesn‚Äôt mean it doesn‚Äôt break my heart when I think of my mother and father, when I think of them looking at me with concern and guilt in their eyes.
I haven‚Äôt seen them in over a year. Soon, I‚Äôll be able to leave the Dreadlands.
Whenever I look at the sun, the same thought occurs to me over and over again. Maybe I‚Äôve grown too accustomed to the dark, or maybe the thoughts just come when the sunlight hits me.
The first time I left was a mistake. I was 17 in the year 1248. I was in College of Winterhold to become a Mage. My tutor was a Master Naybynight, a scholar of sorts who taught me the arts of the magi. He taught me the basics of magic, but before the month was out he sent me to Dwemer in search of crystals. I managed to find two, but I stumbled across the ruined remains of a once-mighty city. In the city, I found a strange crystal. It was shaped like a cross. It told tales of a great war where all but one race had perished. I knew this crystal had given those dark things their power, and I knew I had to destroy it.
The crystal was strong, and the fight that ensued was bitter and long, at first. Eventually, I killed the crystal. Upon its defeat, the Dwemer technology there came to life. I fled, and when I returned to the College, they were gone. The master died when I returned however, so I went back to Dearthcleft, where I was staying at the time, and headed to the College. I thought the master had died, I had no idea he had been pulled into one of Tamriel‚Äôs many planes. I waited, desperate to learn what I could from this Master.
After a month, the master was found. So I waited. Another month. During these months I came to learn more about Magicka, and discovered what Master Naybynight taught me was a distortion of the truth. It was then that I began to question what I knew. The same thing happened to Master Naybynight.
When he returned, I asked him about the ruined city. He didn‚Äôt know what I was referring to. As he told me of his tale, he became angry. He asked where the rumors of his death had come from. They came from‚Ä¶ no one. Everyone believed that he vanished with Magicka. A few people said they saw him in Solitude, but no one saw him leaving the Dreadlands with a young mage, even after I had been waiting at the College to hear what he had to say.
I was saddened, angry even, but I learned from him, and I‚Äôve been learning ever sense. I didn‚Äôt believe the stories of these great wars and great kingdoms, so I began to delve into books that described the history of the world. I learned that it was true. Great battles were fought

instruction: How do polar bears stay warm in Arctic winters?
output:
How do polar bears stay warm in Arctic winters? By blending in with sea ice, rather than white snow, scientists have discovered. And there, as the researchers expected, the bears hid and waited until the cold and darkness of the day had passed. This technique, called the active shelter hypothesis, also explains how polar bears are able to stay warm even when there is little wind and when most sea ice is covered with snow or ice drift. Snow, wind and ice drift can reduce the amount of solar radiation that reaches the ice and bears, thus reducing the energy loss through the ice and bears fur. The bears, therefore, blend into the white background, which allows them to keep warm. The researchers, from Pace University in NY, USA, analysed the behaviour of polar bears over three Arctic seasons between 2006 and 2008, focussing on those in the region of Hudson Bay, Canada. They used remote sensing cameras to watch polar bears. They also measured the physical properties of snow and ice in the area. Their study is published in the Journal of Experimental Biology. ---------------------- Polar Bears - Eating Habits Polar bears have four digits on each front paw and five on the back pair. The polar bear‚Äôs large paws help it swim, hunt ice seals and drag prey across snow. ------------------------- Polar Bears - Mating, Fertilization & Reproduction Mating season occurs once per year, usually May through July. The female will go into her winter den around mid-October. Birth occurs about 25 weeks later. ------------------------------------------------------- Polar Bears - Habitat Lives on sea ice or land. The sea ice is essential for most of its activity, including hunting and migration. The species spends nearly all year above the Arctic Circle. --------------------------- Polar Bears - Hunting Diet mostly consists of ringed seal, but also will kill young and adult polar bears, bears with injured paws, Arctic fox and lemming. Can also eat birds, eggs and carrion. Bears will kill females with cubs and very young bears. -------------------------- Polar Bears - Dangers Threats from global warming, loss of habitat, over hunting, illegal poaching and attacks by humans which lead to loss of habitat and loss of life. Disease and parasitism can also be deadly. ---------------------------------------- Polar Bears - Death Deaths can be caused by disease, starvation, injury from car crashes or hunting accidents. Polar bears usually live less than 20 years in the wild. ----------------------------------------------------- Polar Bears - History Originally thought to be about 24 million years old. The polar bear‚Äôs ancestors were weasel-like carnivores. In 2014, scientists announced that the polar bear‚Äôs closest relative was the yellow-pawed mammoth, which lived at least 40,000 years ago. ------------------------------------------ Polar Bears - Conservation Polar bears have been identified as an endangered species. Polar bears cannot be relocated. Therefore, conservation strategies rely on protecting the polar bear‚Äôs habitat. In 2005, 15 nations joined together to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 50 percent by 2050. Since then 19 nations have joined and committed to reducing their emissions by 2020. ---------------------------------------------------------- Polar Bears - Reproduction Very few polar bears reproduce in captivity. The zoo does have a successful program. ------------------------------------------------------ Polar Bears - Characteristics Characteristics: White fur, black nose, sharp teeth and claws, long neck, webbed feet, thick blubber. Height: 5 feet (140 cm) Length: 9 feet (275 cm) Weight: Male 630 lb (290 kg) Female 525 lb (235 kg) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

instruction: I have two remote Debian servers, A and B. How can I copy a directory of files at `~/Documents/training_results` existing on server A to the path `~/training_results` on server B? I have SSH access on my local laptop to each of the servers, but neither of the servers have SSH access to the other.
output:
I have two remote Debian servers, A and B. How can I copy a directory of files at `~/Documents/training_results` existing on server A to the path `~/training_results` on server B? I have SSH access on my local laptop to each of the servers, but neither of the servers have SSH access to the other.

Comment: You can't. SSH access means only that you can login to that server and run commands. There is no way to transfer data over the SSH connection.

Comment: OK fair enough. Can you please advise an alternative, or confirm that there is not one?

Comment: I'm not familiar with all the alternatives, but you might try: http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/linux-pass-file-between-remotely-connected-server/

Comment: Hi, after a bit of research I have arrived at this : http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/linux-rsh-ssh-pass-file-between-remotely-connected-server/. Could you please confirm that this is indeed the solution to my problem

Answer: I can confirm that Rsync, as presented [here](http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc732824) works. I have to thank [Jorge Castro](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2246791/how-can-i-copy-a-directory-of-files-from-one-remote-server-to-another-using-ssh) for pointing me in the right direction

instruction: Famously, some spy-satellites from the KeyHole series developed and operated by the US National Reconnaissance Office, where similar in capabilities to the Hubble Space Telescope, but then pointed at the earth rather than out into the universe. What can you tell me about these satellites? What era were they developed? Are they still active, and what are their approximate capabilities thought to be?
output:
Famously, some spy-satellites from the KeyHole series developed and operated by the US National Reconnaissance Office, where similar in capabilities to the Hubble Space Telescope, but then pointed at the earth rather than out into the universe. What can you tell me about these satellites? What era were they developed? Are they still active, and what are their approximate capabilities thought to be? I've run into a few websites stating that the KeyHole's could see as precise as one meter. If this is true, isn't is a bit worrying since one meter is a long distance. Thanks in advance for your time and consideration of these questions.
Liquid-Based Cytology
Hello, We wish to thank you for answering our questions about the cytology of a smear test and the possible diagnosis of cervical cancer with and without a normal cytology result. After a 12 month interval, a woman retests for cervical cancer (and gets a smear test). It's possible they have no Pap Smear recorded in their medical record and would like to know how often they should receive a smear test and is it normal to receive just one in a 12 month and 24 month interval or should they receive more smear tests? Thank you.
My question is how early can cervical cells show signs of dysplasia? My wife had a pap test done a few months back and it read borderline dysplasia, then they re-did it right away and it was "normal". They told her to follow up with her GYN in a year. But the thing is I think I found dysplasia in a vaginal smear I sent her. The smears are always in the clear fluid (or whatever it is) that comes out of the cervix. The smear is always less than what is left in the vial. How do you tell if cervical cells are dysplastic? Is the cell structure different in a dysplastic cell. My smears go back several years and only in the last few month have I started observing the cells closely (in those smears you could see the different cell types with great detail). I see dark green glandular cells, red neucleated cells, and large cytoplasm cells (like lymphocytes). I have only seen a dysplastic cell in one of those smears. So I guess my question is if a dysplastic cell is observed in the smear is it abnormal (in terms of structure) and different from a normal cell? Or are there just too many cells mixed into one smear? Thank you for your help
I would like to point out that the risk of cervical abnormalities in smear tests is not 1 in 20 for women under 30 but 10 in 20. This seems to be the commonest misunderstanding regarding the risk of women having positive smear test results. Also an abnormal cell does not necessarily mean cancer. The only way of knowing for sure is to carry out an endoscopic, (sometimes called colposcopic) or LLETZ procedure and remove the tissue for biopsy. The procedure only takes a few minutes. A test for HPV can be carried out along with a colposcopy, and can give a clearer indication of the risk of developing cancer, but sometimes a clear indication is not possible and further tests are necessary. A smear test is not 100% reliable and is very much an aid in the diagnosis and monitoring of abnormal cells but can not be depended on to detect abnormal cells. It is only when smears start to come back abnormal that you should have a colposcopy. As I said an abnormal cell does not necessarily mean cancer and further tests are necessary. I do believe that it is a good idea to start at least 10 years before the age at which you will have stopped having a normal period as your risk increases over the years. There is little doubt that a smear test every 2 years for the life of a woman until the age of 64 is a good idea.

Also, can you please inform me of what the different "normal" smear test results mean? Thank you in advance.
