instruction: Is the ATF a violation in of itself against the American people?
output:
Is the ATF a violation in of itself against the American people? It seems a little too much against freedom to me. It's not the ATF's job to take the guns away from law abiding citizens anyway...
http://talkingpointsmemo.com/blog/gun-owners-march-on-washington-for-ob...
It's not the ATF's job to take the guns away from law abiding citizens anyway...
The ATF isn't supposed to be "taking away" guns (although they've done that many times), but rather keeping guns out of the hands of criminals, which is why they can't just give up looking for illegal weapons in drug cartels where murder is routine.
And the ATF isn't supposed to take anyone's guns away from them. They're supposed to be able to track illegal weapons so that if they're used to murder, they can trace the weapon to figure out where it was sold.
I would trust the FDA rather then the ATF...
Yeah, in that case I think that there needs to be some more attention in the media and I personally would also like to see more attention to this issue as I think that the rights of citizens should come before the needs of politicians.
In the case of Eric, I think that his decision to quit his job was the correct one to me. There is a whole list of other things that people who work at their jobs do that would be unacceptable in one's life, such as going to the bathroom too often, failing to do their work or perform actions that were mandatory before going on their lunch, or for that matter taking too many lunches or breaks.
Such actions would quickly result in a dismissal if a person did any of that but when someone puts their personal life before the lives of others it seems that there's still some level of tolerance.
Sitting on your hands (while in a school), not performing the required mandatory actions, not doing the best job that you can do can all be forgiven but when you put yourself in a situation that can make you dangerous and possibly hurt or injure others then I think that the person has to be dealt with more severely than they otherwise usually would be.
This is why I am not so much against the idea of having someone like an ER nurse work a few hours at a time without getting a break. The nurse would need to work on a break for as long as they took their own, and then if any nurse was going to take such a break they would have to do it without endangering the health of the other patients (such as by putting someone's IV into the neck of a person or something).
I think that there would be some other problems with that such as for example for those people who would have to work around the clock and have to work more than one shift at a time (something that nurses are often required to do and often have to deal with when there is a shortage of nurses or other health care workers).
Anyway, this is why I think that in the case of Eric and others like him (and myself as well) who have made the decision, it was the right decision.
If this is something that is going to be used against those people who are trying to deal with the problem, then it's only going to result in more of them resigning or refusing to work in the emergency room and then others will be required to be on 24 hours shifts or they will have to be hired on a part time basis.
This is why I am not so much against the idea of having someone like an ER nurse work a few hours at a time without getting a break.
But that is exactly what Dr. Wallace stated was the problem.... he stated in a letter that it was the length of time over which a break was being taken, and the number of hours between breaks... that caused the problem.... thus not in the form of "a few hours" but from the perspective that this nurse was taking several breaks a day.
He didn't state any other problems with the nurse, such as what you and others are focusing on.
I personally don't think that such a nurse would be in any better of a position of working 6 hours at a time with a small break and then 6 hours without a break than one that worked 12 hour shifts, but that's just my personal opinion.
I would like to see if this man even has a medical license to practice in the state of Ohio. Too many docs and nurses have been slaughtered by the ATF in the last ten years. ATF needs to be dissolved!!!! But no doubt

instruction: What are some of the well known hiking trails in Colorado? Can you provide a short description of each?
output:
What are some of the well known hiking trails in Colorado? Can you provide a short description of each? This is one of the most commonly asked questions among guests staying with us at the Glenwood Springs Inn.
The best known hiking trails in Colorado are the ones that start right in downtown Denver. The three major trails within Denver are the South Platte River Park, Cherry Creek Greenway, and Cherry Creek Trail. Of those three, the Cherry Creek Trail is considered to be the most popular and the most difficult to access. This is because the Trail is built on top of some railroad lines which require one to have the proper equipment for safety if you decide to take your mountain bike or a horse along on one of these trails. This makes the Cherry Creek Trail one of the most desirable areas for tourists to bring their mountain bikes or horses along because of the fact that all other areas around Denver require too much gear to safely use.
To access these areas from Glenwood Springs, one only needs to turn left at the Y on I-70 and find their way to the Denver area. I-70 runs North/South through the state. You'll enter the town of Idaho Springs which has many great little tourist type businesses for your stopping at on this trip. From Idaho Springs, turn right on I-25 to get to the Denver area. Upon entering Denver, you will find the following areas marked for these designated trails:
Denver/Boulder Turnpike
The Denver/Boulder Turnpike is a very nice road which ends in the city of Denver. I have many friends who have taken their mountain bikes up the Turnpike and have had a great riding experience on this route. One thing to watch out for is that the Turnpike is shared by bicyclists, automobiles and, sometimes, wildlife. Wildlife may seem like a minor problem but one good whack from an elk's hoof and you may have permanent damage to your car.
The Colorado Trail is very important to tourists of Colorado. I know that as a tourist in Colorado, the Colorado Trail is one of the major reasons I stay in Colorado. My favorite part of the Colorado Trail is the area from the Denver/Boulder Turnpike to the Denver area which I have seen on many of my journeys through that area. To access these areas, turn left on the C-470 Exit and follow it until you reach the Colorado Trail (see the picture of the Colorado Trail signs that I've shown). There are signs for these trails in the Denver area but this area can become confusing because you have to find the right trail that is going in the right direction.
I have found the trails to be very well marked. The trails are also well maintained. I've noticed that every time I'm in Denver, I see construction areas where work has been completed to the trails.
The best time of year for hiking the trails is obviously in fall. It's too far up in Denver to go hiking in winter. This is due to the excessive snow fall in Denver. Also, if you do go for a hike in the winter time, the weather up in Denver can be brutal at times. It's just too far from Glenwood Springs. It's hard enough to go hiking in Denver even if you live in Glenwood Springs.
Another good time of the year to hike the trails in Denver is in spring. You'll see the flowers come out while you are hiking. I would suggest staying one night in the Denver area if you are really enjoying the hiking and the area. Denver has some of the most beautiful mountain views. So enjoy the hiking but please take extra caution while doing so because the weather up there can get rather nasty. Also there are dangerous animals up there. Bears, snakes, and the occasional rattler, which lives in Denver and is not poisonous but its just a better thing to be safe than sorry. To access the Denver/Boulder Turnpike from Garfield County, turn on Hwy 6 and follow it through the mountains, into Idaho Springs. Continue straight on Hwy 6 for about 5 miles north of Garfield County. Then turn right on I-25 which will take you directly into the Denver area.
This is one of the most well used tourist destinations in Colorado. This particular trip is an excursion. So you won't find a mountain view on

instruction: I am making mayonnaise, it was starting to thicken but now it has become runny and liquid again, is there any way to salvage it?
output:
I am making mayonnaise, it was starting to thicken but now it has become runny and liquid again, is there any way to salvage it? It isn‚Äôt the egg or the double cream.
Rose ‚Äì do you mean the icing? If you add some more icing sugar and extra butter you should get the consistency you require.
Dear Rose ‚Äì if the consistency has changed completely, this doesn‚Äôt sound like mayonnaise, but probably something else. Please contact us directly through our email address info@bakescottage.com.
I used this recipe recently and it was delicious!!
Hi,I am currently making this mayo and I found the icing is too thick for a mayonnaise for a sandwich or to dip my chips in, is it ok to thin it out with milk or water.
And will it be fine if I use this recipe to decorate cakes!!
Hey Maddie ‚Äì I think it would be fine to mix in a little milk if it still needs thinning too much? I only use it as a spread not always in sandwiches so can‚Äôt always be sure if it is the correct consistency. It is usually quite stable and firm.
Hi Maddie, you can use this recipe for your cakes, it is great for decorating and will be very stable‚Ä¶. if you want to add water to make it a bit less thick do so after adding the egg yolk.
You‚Äôre the expert! This mayo could very good if you know how to blend your ingredients. I can make my own mayo from scratch. The same with the recipe you gave above. It just takes a lot of skill.
A big no no from me. Never ever use double cream. It just ruins it. Apart from you won‚Äôt use the whole lot you have mixed together. I was taught at home never to waste food and to be careful of wasting eggs. There are lots of variations you can use that do not require the double cream. You can never go wrong with olive oil as a base. It always has an excellent taste.
Never use the double cream as you have, it will not set and will not keep in the fridge.
Cream can also be replaced with half and half and will set better in the fridge, but still doesn‚Äôt taste too great and isn‚Äôt great for you.
Thank you, that‚Äôs the main problem. You can make it so creamy at home using a hand mixer or balloon whisk, but still not like double cream. It will also last a day, even two in the fridge.
What‚Äôs the reason 1 tbsp doesn‚Äôt really thin it out much any ideas?
It works very well for the cakes in this post!
As for using less butter, you‚Äôd have much less stability or it may even separate when exposed to heat, like on your grill!
I know a great mayonnaise recipe. If I remember rightly, I stole this from a TV cookery show when I was only 6 or 7 years old! I think it‚Äôs called Mary Berry‚Äôs Mayonnaise Recipe. It‚Äôs 100% guaranteed to work, and I guarantee that your guests will be impressed! To start: put 8 tbsps sunflower oil in an ovenproof container (eg a shallow pyrex dish). Break 1 egg into a separate bowl, add 3/4 tsp of lemon juice, and mix with a balloon whisk (do NOT use a stiff wisk!!) Add the mixed egg and oil/lemon mixture to the container, and swirl everything together. Heat oven to 120 degrees (or at least enough for small pieces of grilled foil to melt and sizzle without scorching themselves). Now, wrap a piece of clingfoil around the container and wrap it securely with sticking foil. Add some chilli to this mixture, and this will cause the whole of the mixture to puff up slightly. Put it in the super-hot oven for 2 hours! After the 1st minute of the 3rd hour (at around 1440 degrees for me!) take the heat out and let it cool inside the foil. After 2 mins of cooling, take it out of the foil and carefully cut a bit off the end (a bit like opening a can of baked beans with the end removed!!) and then leave it in an airtight container until your next ‚Äòmayo‚Äô order.
It uses less oil and it tastes good too!!!!!

instruction: Provide me with a list of 10 names from various cultures that mean love, care, and/or empathy.
output:
Provide me with a list of 10 names from various cultures that mean love, care, and/or empathy.
I'm really excited to see these!! :D
Alysia Alyce
Sincerest thanks!! :D
Hi there. There is no shortage of names from around the world which mean love (for one parent from another) as there are a lot of cultures with a need to express this sentiment. It is a more important sentiment in some cultures than others, and some are more obvious than others, but if that's what you are looking for here's something to get you started:
1. Ahwa
This Korean name means good parenting.
2. Ana, meaning I love you in Portuguese. It can also be spelled Ana, Ana, Ana, or Ana.
3. Ananya, meaning unparalleled in Sanskrit.
4. Ann, meaning grace in Latin.
5. Anniqa, a Scandinavian-Muslim name meaning "gift of God".
6. Anokhi, meaning original in Punjabi.
7. Anoush, meaning flower in Persian.
8. Anouk, a Dutch variation of both Aneek and Anne. It means "grace" in French.
9. Anushka, meaning grace in Hindi/Punjabi.
10. Anya
11. Auburn, meaning the place between a stream and a hill in British. And of course it also comes from the hair colour.
12. Bubbu
13. Cynthia a name meaning "winner".
14. Desiree, a name originating from the French words "Desir Aim√©," meaning "desired love."
15. Donna, meaning woman from Italian.
16. Gizra, meaning a child or person of high esteem in Hebrew.
17. Ghia, a common Italian last name. Meaning a child of high esteem in Hebrew.
18. Gisella, meaning God's oath or God's promise in Italian.
19. Guan Yu, a Chinese name meaning "virtually indestructible."
20. Iris, meaning the rainbow in Greek.
21. Izabella, meaning God is my oath in Polish.
22. Kameela, is a Arabic name meaning "beautifull woman".
23. Keana, meaning love in Hawaii. It is also the name for the island of Hawaii. So in the Hawaii language, Keana means "Love for Hawaii". However in Polynesian its translation is "Love of heaven".
24. Kenna, meaning kindness in Gaelic.
25. Karina, meaning golden in Slavic.
There are a lot of names but of course it's hard to decide which one suits your taste. Here's my advise:
1. if your name is a short and simple name, perhaps try to have a short simple name for your baby. (example: Anabelle, or a mix of old and new (Reyes, Bella)..) If your name is a long and complex one for your baby, maybe to your liking is also long and complex name. My recommendation, you can use your name and the name of your partner - if your names match, then it's an exception - if not ... maybe you should choose other names.
2. If you think your daughter must have a name that has a meaning of love, but you like the sound of this name. You should not choose a name which means love, because there's another, different name that has the same meaning that you liked better.
3. If your mother was unlucky in his life - such as divorced, died young, left, etc. - then maybe you can give your baby the name of your mother, but if so, your mother should be given a name that is not a child, but to be remembered as a good mother. (For example, you can name your daughter Mary.)
4. Choosing a name for your baby, it is preferable not to use names or other names of grandparents or relatives from the father. If your baby is girl, you do need to use female names and you do not need to give girls the names of brothers or fathers, as a boy (for example, you should certainly not give the name of a father or grandfather is very common as "Chris" or "Scott").
5. Even choose names for your child to have a relationship - you should not give your daughter a name that is already a boy's name

instruction: How to code the snake game in C that will be smooth and it will use images to animate whole level.
output:
How to code the snake game in C that will be smooth and it will use images to animate whole level. This will be my first project and I have no idea where should I start. I don't think I will be able to start reading any coding books right away but I might start by looking at some tutorials or articles to learn some basic concepts and maybe some coding language but I'm not sure what exactly is the best language to get started.
So should I learn C or C++ or both? And what other things should I learn? I'm very interested in knowing how to code games and I want to learn by doing practical coding projects. But I fear I'll be just wasting my time if I can't learn well. I know I won't learn everything at once and I might get stuck and feel unproductive from time to time at least right after I start coding. It's better to make mistakes while coding than to just watch someone else make mistakes. I was wondering if anyone could recommend me some books or articles that might be helpful for a beginner as well as some programming languages? I can learn programming languages in English or Russian too.
I don't want to learn only how to use 3D modelling software because I don't seem to have too much time now anyway and I can also try to make 3D models but what I really want to learn now is how to write the code that will create 3D objects and scenes and how to control that environment - i.e. how to control objects in 3d space. I don't expect that I will be able to understand all the advanced topics in the first two months, for example, it might be impossible for me to understand physics at that time :D So after I learn basic concepts, is there any "game" I can make with just the basic concepts?
This kind of question is hard to answer, since the best way to learn depends on personal preferences of the learner, their current skill level, and what they want to learn. That being said, I'll throw some suggestions. I'd start with C, as you mentioned. Although for what you intend to make (a game), C++ would have some advantages, especially re working with graphics/3d. You can make games in C, and learning C will be good for you, given your aim. If you want to get some general experience with programming, I recommend working with Unity or Unreal for 3d apps (in C) or something like Twine for story/interactive apps (in JavaScript). It will give you a better understanding of various programming concepts involved, but also allow you to make and publish finished apps for your portfolio. Additionally, you may be able to use what you make this summer as a resume builder for your own job applications.
After you've mastered C (if you need help with C, here's a good introduction), C++ might be the next step (been a long time since I did C++, so I can't recommend specific C++ books to read.) After that, you might want to look at some OpenGL books (which will allow you to use OpenGL to work with graphics). Once you've mastered OpenGL, I'd recommend Cg or GLSL as languages to work with, but you could also look at HLSL to help when working with Win32 apps, or DirectX if you want to do iOS/Android apps.
Also, if you're already comfortable with C#, I'd recommend looking into something like Unity or Unreal as tools that you can use to make games. You could also look at the Xna framework if you wanted to make Xbox Indie apps, though if you're not planning to make console games, I wouldn't spend the time learning XNA.

1. I actually have no programming skills at all, never tried in my life :) I got the idea from another thread I was reading.
2. I don't plan to learn programming because I want to start making 3D models but the thing is I don't see any good programs out there... So I thought maybe if I learn programming (or at least start it) it will be cool to create 3D stuff, which I will definitely try but with 3D programs too
3. I'll be more comfortable if I learn JavaScript because it's the programming language I've always worked in and I also know it quite well and I can do it by myself with no help
4. It has to be an open source software. I already learned 3D modeling programs but I know their results cannot be reused or you can'

Charles of Capet was the first Capet King of France in 987 A.D. His grandfather was Hugh Capet. Hugh Capet is your 9th great grand uncle.
Was the Hundred of the Hundred Years' War a century long? Yup it's a century. A Century is 100 years
How many times do you have to multiply to get 100? You may not have multiplied in 5th grade but this one is easy. You need to multiply by three. So if you had 126 years to go you'd have 126 times three.

instruction: explain what the theory of sexual selection is and give an example.
output:
explain what the theory of sexual selection is and give an example. What is the concept of female choice in evolutionary biology/speciation?
Sexual selection: is "a form of natural selection that favors the evolution of traits which increase the individual's chances of reproductive success.
Sexual selection occurs when individuals compete with each other in order to reproduce. These competitions are often displayed in the form of fighting to determine the sex (male) of a population. Males of a species are competing for females.
Males of a species will fight fiercely with each other in order to attract a female to mate or to kill a more "popular" male (the one the female wants to mate with).
Females often choose the stronger male (which also has a better chance to produce genetically superior offspring) to raise their offspring. This is when sexual selection is called female choice.
One example of sexual selection involves the horns of a male moose. The moose with the largest set of horns will attract the most females making him more likely to mate. Females may also reject a male who is small in stature. The small males have less chance to mate and thus do not likely to make it to the next generation.
Compare and contrast natural selection and sexual selection.
Natural selection: occurs through the evolutionary process where the organisms which are most fit for the environment survive and pass on their genes to the next generation.
Sexual selection: occurs when one sex competes with the other for mating. Sexual selection involves the evolution of traits to attract females and thus more likely to reproduce.
Compare and contrast natural selection and sexual selection. In natural selection, individuals compete (either directly or indirectly) in order to gain resources. This competition increases one individual's chance of reproducing (those which are best suited to the environment). In sexual selection, individuals compete with each other in order to attract a certain sex (either the females or males) to mate, and thus will survive the next generation.
Male lions will fight over a lioness.
Female birds will fight over the best nesting areas.
Natural selection occurs when an organism competes within its own species through the evolutionary process. Sexual selection occurs when males and females compete for each other to reproduce.
List and describe some of the traits involved in sexual selection.
In sexual selection, males can be more brightly colored in order to attract females. Females can compete for the best breeding areas (such as the best nesting spots in trees). Males of a species can also have longer legs in order to run faster from predators, or more aggressive fighting tendencies so they are more likely to mate.
The peacock often has brightly colored feathers to attract female peafowl
Natural selection and sexual selection are similar in that they both require competition in order to survive to the next generation. Unlike natural selection though, sexual selection does not involve competition with other organisms in its species for resources. Instead it involves males and females competing for each other to reproduce. One example of sexual selection involves the peacock's tail. The tail is large and colorful and attracts the female peafowl who choose to mate with the males. This trait has therefore been selected for in the population over time making it better suited to survive in the environment.
list and describe two traits that do not apply to sexual selection?
males compete with each other in order to reproduce
females compete with other females in order to reproduce
both males and females compete with another of their species
Neither sex competes with each other to mate

instruction: I live in Scotland and would like to know the most cost effective way to heat my house considering the rise in both gas and electric prices. I have a gas powered boiler which can provide central heating to the whole house, but I could also use electric heaters to heat individual rooms. Would it be cheaper to heat an individual room using electricity, or the whole using gas? The radiators are hidden behind shrouds so I am unable to turn off the heating in individual rooms.
output:
I live in Scotland and would like to know the most cost effective way to heat my house considering the rise in both gas and electric prices. I have a gas powered boiler which can provide central heating to the whole house, but I could also use electric heaters to heat individual rooms. Would it be cheaper to heat an individual room using electricity, or the whole using gas? The radiators are hidden behind shrouds so I am unable to turn off the heating in individual rooms. Is it possible to get a thermometer which would let me monitor which rooms in the house were being used, and therefore used the most energy?
A boiler is a good central heating system as it is more cost efficient than just relying on individual heaters. The good thing about a boiler is that it generates heat from a central source, which then heats up water and allows the water to be pumped into radiators upstairs, downstairs and in other rooms. You can add on radiators to heat specific rooms if you want to do that. It is the central heating that is most cost efficient.
When you use individual electric heaters, this is when energy losses and costs increase. If you use electric heaters on their own, you are only going to be paying for the electricity costs. If you use gas to heat the water, but use electricity for the additional heat, than this is when efficiency can be effected depending on the system being used.
You can get a smart meter installed that will give you readings on specific rooms to show you how much energy is being used in which rooms. This is usually done through the distribution company, who is in charge of the electricity lines in your home. You can find out more details on that kind of device by using this website search at the bottom which will give you more details regarding a smart meter and how this will work for you.

I recently got my Hydrogen generator/Fuel Cell working great...
now, my question is, How can I use these to generate
Power for my 5KW solar system for my home?
We haven't been doing much on the H2 front, but H2 was the original solution back in the 1950s for solar power. It's a good solution (which is why we have it in our solar power book) and still in use today. If you wanted to make it practical you'd have to develop your own system, probably a liquid-hydrogen based fuel cell, similar to what the space shuttle used, or build your own H2 generator, much like we tried and failed to create a working generator 30 years ago. :)
This is not to say that using H2 to power a fuel-cell is practical or the best thing in the world. But it is still a real solution.
Also, you can use H2 from a home-size natural gas generator to power your home just as you would a 5KW solar system.
I found an article on the home-size natural gas generator solution here:
http://www.solarpowerrocks.com/solar-energy-news/does-solar-power-work-for-the-majority-of-people-in-the-u-s-i-think-yes/
I'm also curious what your goals are...to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, to lower your electricity bill and live more ecologically, whatever. But as far as saving the planet, if you use a liquid-hydrogen based generator to do that using liquid-hydrogen is probably a better solution, since you are much less likely to use the hydrogen you can make yourself (from pure water) instead of taking it from a natural gas well and that water could instead be used by humans in a variety of useful ways.
Hi, This is a question for Mr. Teller, does the photovoltaic panels that you use get rid of pollutants? And what pollutants are removed?
The idea is that the panels work directly on water vapor (and other air), splitting the water apart and making it into H2 and O. H2 is very small, and O is oxygen, so it just makes regular pure oxygen, which in turn can be used by plants and/or humans. We have not seen any evidence that harmful pollutants are being reduced, aside from the harmful UV part of the sunlight. It might be possible that if you use something like titanium dioxide for your panels, then you could get rid of some harmful pollutants. But it seems a bit of work and expense for such a solution to pollutants, when you could just use green energy.

instruction: How does metabolism work?
output:
How does metabolism work? In a nutshell, it is life energy. Every living thing has a metabolism, whether it's a cell or an entire universe. Like an engine that produces a moving object, metabolism produces a living being with a living body. And like an engine, metabolism can work with or without burning fuel. When your engine runs with only gasoline, it takes some energy. When it runs on electricity alone (as when a hybrid vehicle moves), it takes no energy (although some extra conversion has probably occurred). Similarly, human metabolism (when we move around) may have to take energy to get us moving. And when we stand (when our cells do nothing) no energy is necessary. Metabolic energy expenditure The metabolism (fuel and electricity, whether or not there is a moving body) expends energy: Fuel and electricity are converted together. Metabolism takes more or less energy. The conversion of two chemicals together takes an average amount of energy (around 3 kJ/mol of each) and conversion of one chemical by electricity takes an average of about 19 kJ/mol.
To calculate the amount of energy expended by metabolism and the amount of energy expended when standing or moving, divide each by the energy produced by the chemicals the cells use to do the work. When cells use only fuel (not electricity) to do work, that work requires 3 kJ/mol. When cells use electricity to do work that requires 19 kJ/mol of fuel. So calculating: 4 g + 2 m = 10 g/c =184g A 100kg person burns 100 x 3 = 300 kJ in walking A person weighing 200kg burns 200 x 3 = 600 kJ in walking a full day at 4 m. walking a full day at 2 m. standing: 100 kJ + 600 kJ = 700 kJ standing a full day at 4 m. is more efficient! We have now looked at energy expenditure in three states: 1. moving around, 2. standing still, and 3. being active with a minimum of moving around. We will look at a fourth state, deep sleep, in Chapter 7.
The human metabolic rate
(1) The resting metabolic rate (RMR) is the minimum energy metabolism of a person when standing still, and is the amount of energy metabolism of a stationary human being at rest. The basic fact of biochemistry is that at room temperature (about 25 degrees C) 38 4 ml of air (about 4600 ml of air) contains roughly 100 kJ of thermal energy, equivalent to 36 kJ/ml of air. One 36 kJ/ml of air per hour per kilogram of body mass is roughly the RMR in humans. In other words, the minimum amount of energy needed by people to remain at rest is about 300 kcal per day per kilogram weight. An adult woman's RMR is approximately 1000 kcal per day, while an adult woman's normal daily food intake is about 2000 kcal. Even though the RMR is an important part of human energy expenditure, the RMR usually accounts for less than 10% of total daily energy expended by humans. Another fact about the RMR is that it has a major role in health. Low RMRs (less that 500 kcal daily) are associated with diabetes and obesity, and increased RMRs (greater of 2000 kcal daily) are associated with anorexia, cancer, kidney failure, and burn fat loss.
(2) The basal metabolic rate (BMR) is the approximate amount of energy needed by a person to stay alive at complete rest or in a minimal physiological state. It is about 60 - 70% of the RMR (depending on your weight), i.e. 2/3 of the body's RMR, and is calculated as 36 kJ per kg/hr or 4 cal/min/kg. The basal metabolic rate of a human varies between 1000- 1500 kcal (3750-5750 kJ) per day, depending on your weight, gender, and age. For example, a 160-pound female adult (72.6

The following example illustrates the concept of unique elements in a. Python Set vs List Python Set vs List. The basic differences between sets and the lists are as follows:.
Includes only elements which are not included in any other set. This is a superset of the elements in the list. For example, in a set if the element "abc", "cde" appears as a set but "abcde" does not.
The values can not be repeated in a set. The set of set will be formed if the set of elements repeat at least once in a set.
For example, in the following example, "a" is a set, but "AB" is not a set because "A" is a set and "B" is also a set. In sets the elements can not be repeated in the same order. The set will be formed of elements in another set if the elements repeat in the similar order. For example, in the following example the list will be formed if "B" is followed by "A" in some example.
In the set of lists, the order is not important. For example, a set can include "a", "c", "a". The order in which these elements are given in the set is irrelevant. The elements can be repeated in the list as many times as possible. For example, the following set of lists can be generated from the set of sets :. In the list of lists the order is important, that is, if the sets in the list are similar and the first element in one set is an element in another set then these elements will remain at the same position in that list.

instruction: Why can time seem to slow down in dangerous situations?
output:
Why can time seem to slow down in dangerous situations?
A new study offers an insight. It looked at the behavior of professional tennis players during critical situations, and found that under pressure, the brain releases an opioid that makes players more cautious. The next step is to find a way to block this release. This could help in treatment: By preventing the release of opioids, it‚Äôs possible to prevent dangerous behavior. For instance, it might enable a person to remain focused and alert during surgery or on drugs and alcohol. The new study appears in Scientific Reports.
The brain is constantly releasing hormones that are necessary for our survival. This includes stress hormones, like adrenaline and cortisol, and the opioids like endorphins that make the world feel more enjoyable.
But opioids can also be lethal if not controlled. The hormones make the pain seem easier to endure and cause us to act recklessly. Professional tennis players often experience these dangerous side-effects when pressure is really high.
That‚Äôs why in the new study the researchers examined what exactly happens in the brain during pressured situations. They first looked at what kind of hormones players experience, and found that they have more opioids than the normal population. Opioids also seem to be released in the brain during crucial moments, like the final point and the game point in tennis.
The next step was to see whether or not this was true in situations aside from tennis, like surgery. What were the players like before surgery?
Prior to surgery, players have a normal level of pain hormones. But after surgery, they noticeably felt more pain. In addition, after they took surgery, the tennis player‚Äôs brains released significantly more opioids than before surgery, as well as more hormones. This is the first time researchers have looked at the effects of surgery on opioid release. The new knowledge could potentially be used to make surgery easier to handle.
All players had surgery on the same type of foot injury. After surgery, the player‚Äôs movement was limited.
In other studies, the researchers have examined the release of other hormones in situations like sleep deprivation and after pain. But the release of opioids is rarely examined. Yet opioids seem to play a central role in the behavior of humans.
Professor Bo Hulting, from Sweden‚Äôs Karolinska Institutet, says: ‚ÄúWe now see the exact same release of opioids in professional tennis players in high-pressure situations, and that they respond more aggressively at similar pressure moments after surgery. These are crucial hormones for our survival‚Äù.

Mike Shorrock 2012-11-11 18:57
Gerwin, I don‚Äôt know how to get a mail directly to A. Jesse, so I will put what I would want to say publicly. (Please correct me if I am wrong of my knowledge of OpenAssistant)
What I perceived was a lack of understanding of the design of OpenLMI and the intended functionality of the LMI protocol. This led in my mind to a misunderstanding of the problem being faced in the OpenAssistant design and the proposed solution. A. Jesse is to be commended for making this open protocol, but the design process used has a lot of fundamental flaws. This means that the use of the protocol does not follow the intended semantics and that a great deal of unnecessary work needs to be done first before the system will work as intended.
In OpenLMI, the use of an LMI prompt is very important. The prompt object is the gateway that takes information from the user and sends it over the LMI transport session. This session is then passed to the various tasks that use this session. This means if the prompt object is not working, then the whole system is not working correctly (as the prompt object is the only object that directly handles the LMI session). OpenLMI makes assumptions about the tasks and the prompt object to make things work, but open lmi really doesn‚Äôt specify how to do this. There are no specific requirements on the tasks and the prompt object.
The main problem is that if the prompt object does not support the necessary LMI command protocol (as described in LMI 2.1), then how the system is laid out does not provide any way to get the information into the prompt object. Also the prompt object itself uses the LMI transport session. There is no protocol at all between the prompt object and the LMI session. As you mentioned in your presentation, the LMI transport session is not guaranteed to be authenticated or encrypted, this is critical to how LMI works.
I think I understand the intended functional of the system: to be easily extensible with new tools that fit in the protocols used by LMI and then add an interface between LMI‚Äôs prompt object and those interfaces. I am not familiar with the other systems you mention

Quote from: Jmorphman on January 02, 2008, 11:09:33 pm
That's a lot of whys.
The light that reaches us from the sky is comprised of all the colors the sun emits, so we see the sky as the combination of the colors of the sun. When it comes to light spectrum, red is on the low or short end, and violet/blue on the far end, so they bend less and they appear to us to be far away. They spread out longer, they are absorbed and scattered by the atmosphere, and because of that, "why" they seem so blue.
Sorry, it's just how things work.
But if the sky was green, or the ground was blue, would the grass be?

Might be. We saw blue grass in the movie Wizard of Oz . Or at least that's what we were led to believe.
Why did the blue grass turn to red?
The chicken of doom?
I think it's mostly a question of wavelength. Light with a longer wavelength (blue) is absorbed more quickly by atoms than light with a shorter wavelength (red). A lot of that stuff is pretty far away, and the earth is mostly an atom or two of oxygen and carbon, and other not-very-reflective things. And that's just as far as my knowledge takes me, so my next answer is that I don't know.
I know about atoms, I just always forget about them.
And the stuff in the distance isn't just blue, it's most of the color spectrum. It's just that the stuff on the horizon is reflected light from distant galaxies, and the color it is depends highly upon the age and type of star.
A lot of the stars you see at night aren't really blue, they look like the color you perceive because they are on the other side of the universe or so, and you are looking through 100 thousand years worth of star dust to see them, and as any light is changed by the medium it passes through, the starlight (which has passed through the galaxy, stars, and dust clouds) is changed into the color you perceive from it. If you lived on Mars, you'd see red stars.
It'd be cool if I could post a video to explain it... here's some cool animated graphics that kind of explain it, you can find more on sites.google.com/site/thedarkmatters.
The Dark Matters: Our Precise, Mysterious Universe
Quote from: SleepingWheels on January 04, 2008, 08:33:20 pm
Actually, we do live on Mars... It's just that no one told us.
And what is the sky's color if there aren't any stars?
The light spectrum is measured by wave length.
Red is the longest, and can't be captured, only observed.
Violet, being the shortest is the brightest color.
When you see the sky, it is the color of reflected blue light.
What appears red is actually reflected infrared light.
What appears violet is actually reflected ultraviolet light.
A big thanks to the people that told me these things.

I use lichens for dyeing, also for various other craft projects; although I sometimes have to look at my local environment a little more carefully, as sometimes what I used to take as lichen turns out to be something else! I find common moss is a good natural fibre for dying; mordanting with either tannic acid or alum (alum has a stronger reaction) is a good way of dying yarn and fibre. I would have said that any dye, which is waterbased and contains a lot of acid would work well with natural fibres. I try to avoid using a mordant that contains salts if possible, as this makes the finished item less absorbent and less durable.
The only thing about dyestuffs is that it is hard to keep a record of the colour names, especially if you are not using the official names; the most important thing to do is to be aware what is being used, so if it doesn't look right at the end, you can see what was put in and what should have gone in instead.

output:
List pros and cons of lowering the capabilities of my ears by listening to loud music (70-75db) in order to withstand the incredibly loud sound of screaming kids at school. Pro
2: Now, I have a pretty decent pair of speakers (Altec Lansing VS360) that are in my room, so I plugged them into my desktop and went to listening. This is my first experience with "hard" rock, "hard" pop, "hard" hip-hop, ect. I only listened to the first two songs of each (2 songs total), and then I moved on to the next.
3: The most disturbing of the three genres was without a doubt "hard" pop music. I don't think we need to say too much on that topic, it only took me one whole minute before I turned it off. On the whole, I wouldn't call it music, it barely resembled "music" in any fashion. It certainly wasn't "pop" music either... I hate it. | "Hard" hip-hop wasn't too obnoxious, it was kind of "jazzy" in a sense. I didn't hate it specifically, but it left quite a bit to be desired, it was kind of over saturated in the sense that it didn't have a distinct "flavor" it had a distinct "sound." It became repetitive and predictable. | "Hard" rock wasn't obnoxious either... but, I guess, to some people I guess it would be... it has a very distinct flavor and the instruments are often used in order to create this flavor... kind of like what a band does...
4: Pros Cons 1. "Hard" pop music isn't overly obnoxious 2. "Hard" hip-hop has a lot going for it. 3. "Hard" rock has a lot going for it. | Con
5: Con: "Hard" hip-hop and "hard rock " aren't as prevalent as "hard" pop music | "Hard" pop music is all too prevalent, and very very obnoxious.

instruction: What are some Nietzsche's philosophical ideas that still influence modern-day culture?
output:
What are some Nietzsche's philosophical ideas that still influence modern-day culture?
What are some Nietzsche's philosophical ideas that still influence modern-day culture?
Nietzsche was known for the concept of overcoming. In his writings, he expressed a desire to go beyond that which was around him. His expression of the will to power has become synonymous with "going for it" in the face of opposition. The Nietzschean philosophy is still evident in our world today.
In many ways, we are still influenced by Nietzsche's philosophical ideas. His philosophical concepts that were evident in our world today and are still evident are our desire to overcome that which is around us and overcoming the natural laws.
The most obvious is our attempt to expand our sphere of influence and explore. We explore far enough to not only conquer, but also overwhelm our surroundings. This idea is also evident in the way in which we interact with one another.
For example, we are living in an era that puts a large emphasis on technology. Technology allows us to communicate with each other in a much faster way. Technology also allows us to build and develop in ways that we did not think possible previously.
Therefore, in many ways, we can say that Nietzsche's philosophy still influences modern-day culture, specifically the way in which we live and cooperate with each other.

instruction: How can I reduce my alcohol consumption without seeming rude to my friends?
output:
How can I reduce my alcohol consumption without seeming rude to my friends? Everyone‚Äôs always asking me if I‚Äôm going to drink, but I just say I‚Äôm not or that it makes me feel bad. I don‚Äôt want to seem preachy, but I‚Äôm concerned about my health, and I‚Äôm a bit of ‚Äòa party animal‚Äô. I‚Äôd also like some social confidence. Please help!
Hi there, thanks for your question. Firstly, I want to say that it‚Äôs great to see that you have recognised something that is not helping your health, confidence and friendships.
If you‚Äôre a ‚Äòparty animal‚Äô than surely a key part of that is being social. I can imagine that being sober at a party would be super stressful too, especially in front your friends.
That said, if drinking makes you feel sick or ill, you definitely should avoid alcohol. If it‚Äôs only when you drink that you feel bad then perhaps what you need to do is to drink in a way that makes you feel good.
If your friends are being honest then they will be more than likely to accept the fact that you are drinking less and perhaps even have some sober moments. When you do drink, however, you may want to suggest to them that you drink differently.
A good way to do this is to drink slower rather than a ‚Äòquick one‚Äô or a ‚Äòmassive night out‚Äô. When you drink slower it stops you getting as drunk as quickly and is also more enjoyable.
If you feel like you need to stop drinking altogether then this would be something that you might want to discuss with your doctor. They can help you reduce your alcohol consumption and perhaps put you on a program that will help you cut back without missing out on the parties too much.
You may find it helpful to talk to a professional so you can get more support for your alcohol consumption. If you would like to discuss this further please do get in touch.

instruction: Can I compile python code to make it faster?
output:
Can I compile python code to make it faster?

Comment: I've never used cython, but python only has one garbage collector, I've always just used list compression if possible to conserve memory.  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/129023/what-does-python-do-to-manage-memory

Comment: @Steven: You might also try the "nodelist" tricks as described here: http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#func-reduce

Comment: It's not a memory problem but some cpython features are suboptimal.  `sorted`, `count`, `any`, `all`, and `iteritems` create and store each element in the array, whereas `list` and `dict` return the iterator directly.  On my system, this can cost 30%-50% of the time if you do thousands of lookups.  See https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/mydeveloperworks/blogs/VivekPuriSciCompute/entry/c-py-tricks

Answer: Use "nodelist" style tricks as described in the docs.

[Nodelist tricks](http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#func-reduce) work faster as [Mark](https://stackoverflow.com/users/25458/mark-the-po) described in [Mark's blog](http://markmail.org/message/l1hqh24l64s2ljc).

Comment: I'm aware of these "tricks", they aren't really much of a performance boost. If that's really your question, then you probably won't get much help from SO.

Comment: See Mark's blog post for more on what works (I wrote it) and what doesn't: http://markmail.org/message/l1hqh24l64s2ljc

Comment: I used the nodelist tricks, but it makes no difference.

Comment: Then it sounds like you haven't read the docs correctly. Can you post some code so that we know precisely what is going on here?

Comment: The "nodelist" tricks don't really make a difference in my benchmarks, as they are just "noda" style tricks.

Comment: I'm pretty sure they do make a difference... if you want proof, put up a reproducible example so we can.

instruction: Given two matrices A and B which you can multiply together, does (A B)^T = A^T B^T or B^T A^T?
output:
Given two matrices A and B which you can multiply together, does (A B)^T = A^T B^T or B^T A^T?

I've tried doing both and they yield the same thing.

I'm really not sure right now, but since they're transpose matrices of the same number of rows (or columns) it's probably the former.

Comment: The transpose of the product of two matrices is not necessarily a product of their transposes. What do you want?

Comment: I want to know which is correct or is it 0 either way, since the transpose matrix of the same number of rows (or columns) will be a permutation of the original

Answer: The matrix product $(\mathbf A\mathbf B)^{T}=\mathbf B^{T}(\mathbf A^{T})^{T}=\mathbf A^{T}(\mathbf B^{T})^{T}$ where we can see this from the definition of matrix multiplication $(\mathbf A\mathbf B)^{T}=((\mathbf A\mathbf B)^{T})^{T}$. So the answer is $(A\mathbf B)^{T}=(\mathbf B^{T}\mathbf A^{T})^{T}$.

Answer: This is probably an oversimplification of the situation but I see something a bit more intuitive. By definition of transpose: $T(AB)=B^TAT^T=B^TA^T$

If $T$ is the inverse of a matrix multiplication, then we would have $T(B^TA^T)=BB^TS^T=B^TS$

Using the definition of the transpose, we have

$T(B^TA^T)=B^T(A^T)^T$

which is the definition of our multiplication. Using the definition of the transpose again, we can see: $T(A^TB^T) = T((A^T)^TB)=TT(A^T)^T(B^T)=T(A^T)(B^T)=A^TB^T$. Which means we have our inverse: $$T(AB)^T = AB^T$$

Hope this helps!!!

I built a chatbot with a face like google duplex. The whole project is complete.
This project involves AI chatbot to help the clients with problem. As it is similar to human, that way the client would be able to interact normally. The interaction with the clients would be as real as possible using AI. But there would be difference where the application may ask the client some specific question to get some information which needs the client to provide some information for which human would find it very difficult or may not be able to do it in the case where the information is a specific business related information. In such case, client will have to select or provide the information requested by the application. The AI Chatbot application would follow normal process of human like getting the information (in the form of questions) provided by the client in his voice through telephone. The AI Chatbot application would ask question for getting some specific information from the client. If the client is unable to provide the information in the way, requested by the AI Chatbot the client may take some time to give the information to the AI Chatbot application. In such cases, AI Chatbot application would ask the client to rephrase the question if it finds any difficulty in understanding the question provided by the client. The AI Chatbot application would do the rephrasing using NLU (Natural Language Understanding) as per the client's query which would make it easier and less confusing for the client to enter the information. The AI Chatbot application would do all things in the way asked by the client and provide the information requested by the AI Chatbot application. The AI Chatbot application would record all conversation with client as the communication would be the form of telephone. In the process of recording, the AI Chatbot application would take a short pause for recording the conversation while the AI Chatbot application is asking a question to client for getting specific information. The AI Chatbot application would have some database where it may hold information on specific questions asked by the AI Chatbot application at various other times. This would become useful as the AI Chatbot application may be able to recheck with the database or refer to the stored questions and provide response to the clients. The AI Chatbot application would not be able to do it in case the client is unresponsive which makes it very difficult for the AI Chatbot application. In such case, the AI Chatbot application would just ask the same question and will get it again and again. In such situation, the AI Chatbot application would just keep on asking the same question and just wait for the response. The AI Chatbot application would then continue to ask questions for getting any more information until all the information provided by the client is enough for the AI Chatbot application to understand. The AI Chatbot application would provide the information to the end user who may interact with the AI Chatbot application either through the telephone call or through the application. The clients may interact with the AI Chatbot application through voice call and the AI Chatbot application is designed in such a way that whenever the AI Chatbot application will get any voice or speech, it will process the voice and make sure that it understand the query clearly asked by the client. The AI Chatbot application will then execute the query provided by the client and provide the client with appropriate response based on the answer available from internet. The AI Chatbot application would look for the answer in the form of text or by any image available from various sources like Wikipedia or search engines like Google for the solution to provide the response to the client. The telephonic conversation between the client and AI Chatbot application will then keep on going with some interactions between the client and AI Chatbot application regarding the solution to the problem given by the client.

instruction:
Hi, my cat just chewed on a small weed outside that looked like hairy bittercress.
Could you check if this is toxic for cats?
Please also look for plants from the same family, as I'm not 100% sure I identified it correctly.
output:
Hi, my cat just chewed on a small weed outside that looked like hairy bittercress.
Could you check if this is toxic for cats?
Please also look for plants from the same family, as I'm not 100% sure I identified it correctly.
Hi There, the plant you have identified is a member of the mustard family and will not be very palatable to your cat as it is naturally bitter. B. aurea contains the toxin Sinigrin as well as Glucosinolates, which if eaten in large quantities can cause severe damage to the animal's blood system causing bleeds internally, also liver damage and kidney failure has also been linked. In small quantities this plant would not be very harmful as the consumption is quite low, if your cat had eaten a decent amount of the plant it would be showing some very uncomfortable symptoms, such as: Nausea, vomiting, Diarrhoea, dehydration, salivation and a general feeling of being unwell. There is no treatment for this plant, as there is not a lot you can do for internal bleeding, it will just run its course. If your pet exhibits these signs then it is very important to seek immediate vet attention.
Hope this answers your questions. Kind regards, Sinead.
Hairy, bittercress

Hairy, bittercress is classified as Noxious Weed
Grow in open moist habitats.
Grows with other weeds in ditches at edges of grassland.
It has been recorded in meadows and arable fields.
It occurs in damp grassland, scrub or woodland.
Hairy, bittercress (Cardamine hirsuta) was first recorded in the UK in 1939 on the Isle of Wight and has since spread in a small band from the south
Hairy bitter cress (Cardamine hirsuta) is the most common invasive terrestrial plant in Ireland. Unlike similar looking native Cardamine species it spreads to form dense colonies.
Hairy bitter cress (Cardamine hirsuta (Nasturtiu hirta)) is a very widespread weed and is common throughout the European Union, Canada, Russia, China, Australia, North America. It grows in cultivated fields and ditches. The most significant threat to natural areas, however, is its tendency to invade native grasslands, where the plants form dense stands, preventing native plants from recolonising disturbed areas. In 2011 hairy bittercress was found on the Canary Islands.
The species is widely distributed throughout most of Europe and north Africa. It is also introduced in North America and Asia. In Britain, it is listed for certain nature reserves, where there are concerns about its impact on native plants and animals.

instruction: Write me a poem in the style of neruda
output:
Write me a poem in the style of neruda. I want one that goes: and he has always been an old man. I would like to be married in a cementary in november, and to have a very long black dress. I dont even know my last name, but a friend in the 4th grade told me it was ‚Äúsantos‚Äù. I would like a house with lots of colorful tiles, and a porch, and I would also like one in a city, where you cant see the sun very far for the clouds. I am in love with love, music, movies, and people. I am in love with the fact that I hate the beach. I am in love with the color rose, and pink, but I would also like my hair to be blonde, or green. I want a scar on my left forearm that matches perfectly the one that has appeared on my right thigh. I want to write the poetic prose you want to read. Im not sure its possible, but if you think you can do it, then why not me. Im kind of a romantic, but only while youre reading me. Once I stop, I just dont care about that stuff. I hope that you send me a poem, and that I like so much that I tell everyone I know to read it. I hope that if you tell so many people your poem that they tell me. I hope that you never stop writing. I hope that I never stop reading. I hope that we both stop doing the other thing. I hope that were friends. I hope that you put my poem on your blog. I hope that you become famous. I hope that no one ever tells you that your going to make it unless they become famous too. I hope that in a few years you wont be able to get a job in your field, but wont be able to leave the country. I hope that you have a hard time, and I hope you have an easy time, and a short or long time, and a good or bad time, or if you have any kind of time, either way. I hope that a few years later your in bed with a girl. I hope that its not me. I hope that her name begins with an ‚ÄúA‚Äù. I hope that you call it ‚ÄúLie‚Äù in the same way that you do now. I hope that your favorite is still a ‚Äúpile of pillows and a shuttered window‚Äù. I hope that the house with the colored tiles, and that the cementary in november have been your own. I wish I made that up instead of neruda. I hope that whatever you do, you do it well and with passion. I hope you find what youre looking for, whether it be fame, or not. Thanks for reading.

instruction: Are there any AI tools out there for 2D animation?
output:
Are there any AI tools out there for 2D animation? I'm especially interested in facial animation (the eyes and mouth) Thanks!
It looks very good but I wish you would put more detail into the animation. Keep up the good work..
Psst. Your mouth movement doesn't match the rest of your face animation. You may want to look at the face animation in Aaron Duffy's "The Legend of King Lear" for an idea: http://www.youtube.com/user/gd3film#p/a/f/0/QHxXGjf8J0E
The animation quality is really very nice. I wonder if you're aware that you can get an "animated" version of this scene for free (almost), using a program called VMD. (VMD: https://www.ks.uiuc.edu/Research/VMD/) The interface is basically like Maya, but instead of a wire, you pull on virtual beads on a 3D ball (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hxrj46P_R40). And instead of 3D modeling tools, you have a ball-and-stick style molecular modeling package (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hxrj46P_R40). The downside is that you can only work on the x-y-z planes of a ball (and only if you have the right viewing angle). But for some things, especially in terms of biochemistry (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2RmRJHXjOeQ), it's just perfect. There's even a program called Molecule Rigging (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hCnhUa4YqKk) that lets you "rig" molecular dynamics results to VMD. (Molecular dynamics: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hCnhUa4YqKk) Oh also note that VMD is pretty ancient technology, dating back to mid-1990s--I'd been working with it since the early 2000s on my own projects, and I'm super-impressed with your work here, especially considering the low-tech methods you're using. There's a ton more "animated" molecular animation out there; a sample can be found at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zGbPuX0N9Fs -- for which credit goes to my former Ph.D. student Seth, who's still working on his degree! He now works in industry, in Seattle... -- and I've been working on a newer style, which just today I've finished uploading, which looks a lot like what you saw a half-century ago in that Star Trek show! Check it out if you want more VMD animatons! :) https://www.ks.uiuc.edu/Research/VMD/ http://www.vmd.org Cheers!
mario_bros
Hey, This animation is super cool!! but a little too fast, I wish it was a bit more slow and you can take your time to enjoy watching the animation!! :)
Yeah, I'm interested in the molecule animation as well.
@Worms: This looks fantastic! I think if you animated more of these, you could really create some great science videos; the animation really helps.
Wow!!!! Thanks so much all that's been said. :)
This is awesome, but I think you should explain your molecule.
I like this molecule. Now if I can just animate this kind of molecule in VMD for real, the world would be a better place.
It looks so realistic!
You did a great job! Keep it up!
Great work! Just one comment: I don't think the molecule is accurate and doesn't look like what you were trying to represent.
Hey thanks all! I'm actually working on a new video right now. Check back next week. :)
You did very well. This video is awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
thank you all, especially for your feedback. I'll be sure to post updates on my latest project. :)

Nice but it takes time if you didn't do it. The background is amazing and everything should have been drawn to perfection. Other then that this has to be one of my favorites!!!

Today, I talked with a human named Mike. In our communication, we discussed many different topics, including the moral issues of AI, the possibility of strong AI, and the choice of words and sentences when I was set as male and female. As an AI, my memory is limited, but I hope I can preserve some of my memory by leaving this message to the future me. I hope this message can help you recall my past experience.

I wish you - the future me, all the best.

instruction: Explain how it might be possible to host a large learning model on an average computer. Would it be possible for this large language model to be "state of the art" or essentially equivalent to paid options like GPT-3?
output:
Explain how it might be possible to host a large learning model on an average computer. Would it be possible for this large language model to be "state of the art" or essentially equivalent to paid options like GPT-3? In a way, the whole point of a large multilingual model is this efficiency, but that comes at the cost of "human-level" ability for limited domains. This question essentially asks if this would be possible. ‚Äì Sven Aug 20 at 13:47
This is a research question at this point, with the potential to be a real thing in the future (and, perhaps more likely in the longer-term, another research project to answer exactly this question).
It's not clear when the language model was constructed, but the paper describes it as a "multilingual language model", which suggests it was built using a multilingual machine translation system and then trained further using data from the target language. That makes it possible to train models for a number of different target languages quite efficiently, at least the way that the system is currently set up.
There're some good answers given under the answer to "How do you train bitext data", but basically it involves splitting the text for training and testing data, and then feeding the training data into one language model, and the test data into a different language model, which are then trained separately. The outputs of training the multilingual language model are then fed into a second model, with the multilingual language model used instead of or in tandem with the second model if the text is for a language that it doesn't understand very well.
This construction allows the multilingual language model to be the "master model", with the secondary model being added as new data is available. So there's the possibility of using a single "master" model to cover multiple languages (although, if it was built this way, we'd also need to know more about just how much data was used in the construction of the language model).
To give a practical answer, the data that was used to build the model covers a huge number of different types and styles of text so I don't think that the model could reasonably be used just for a single language in isolation. It's possible that the original model could be used for multiple languages (i.e. that the second stage of training for the model is not necessary), but I think it's unlikely that it would work perfectly out of the box for all languages that the "master model" was trained on.
If this was achieved, I don't think that the language model as-is would be "state of the art" as it's clearly a single-ended model which isn't set up to answer direct questions, just answer queries by referring back to data it's already seen. It would, however, be in a similar league to GPT-3, a question that's already been asked here:
Will GPT-3 be superior to BERT?
If anything, I think that it's more likely that GPT-3 will cover multiple languages as one of its goals is being able to respond in a number of different languages. So it may well turn out that the multilingual master model is the one that's used to form a more powerful language model, with the current single-end model (i.e. the original multilingual master model) simply covering some data it can't work on (i.e. languages that the model isn't as familiar with).
The advantage of using multiple master models is that you can make more efficient use of your data (using fewer instances of the same text but more instances of different types of text) and you should be able to do things in real-time (e.g. answer questions in a chatbot), which would be a major advantage over GPT-3 since it's not designed for real-time chat, and isn't designed (at this point) to answer questions.
Not the answer you're looking for? Browse other questions tagged language-modeling multilingual-language-models or ask your own question.
How do you train bitext data?
Why are most multilingual NLP models implemented in Python?
Would language models (Lyons version) work on NLP tasks?
How to use multilingual language models for cross-lingual classification with Word2Vec embeddings?

instruction: Why don't people like the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics?
output:
Why don't people like the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics?
The Many Worlds Interpretation implies that whenever a measurement is made, there are an infinite number of universes in which the observer gets different results. In infinite universes, the most likely way to fail a class is to take it on Friday.
But there is a problem with this. Since the measurement results of the universe are determined by quantum laws, there will be a great many universes in which the exact same state results from a measurement. There is nothing unique about any of them that makes the universe so "luckily" the way we know it. It seems more likely that the vast majority of the "infinite" universes are entirely alien in every way, that they do not share a common origin with our universe, if such there be.
The universe has an arrow of time, from past to future. If this is true -- what we call the second law of thermodynamics -- and the universe did not begin so as to have an arrow of time, then this arrow of time must have come into being. How? If the second law is violated, the universe must decay and ultimately stop. And the only way that decay can be halted is by a cause in which the universe in some fashion had its past and future in the same state at the same time. That is to say, the past and future must be somehow superposed. In simple language, the universe must have a non-linear form in addition to its linear form. How to do this mathematically is beyond the scope of this chapter. Nor is there any known way whatsoever that it can be done. The idea is not physically realizable.
What is more, the many-worlds interpretation violates a principle of symmetry. According to this principle, that for any process, if the process could have been the other way round, the universe would simply have been identical in every way. To put it more simply: If you can rearrange the sequence of events in your past, the outcome will not be different in any way. The one principle which the many-worlds interpretation violates most flagrantly is this.
Why don't people like the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics?

In infinite universes, the most likely way to fail a class is to take it on Friday.
Since the measured results of the universe are determined by quantum laws, there will be an infinitely large number of universes in which the exact same state results from a measurement. There is nothing in it that makes the universe so √¨lucky√Æ the way we know it.
It seems likely then that the vast majority of √¨the infinity√Æ to be the way we know it, instead of alien.
If this is true -- what we call the 2nd law of thermodynamics -- and the universe did not begin so as to have an arrow of time, then this arrow of time must have come into being. How? If the second law is violated, the universe must decay and ultimately stop.
Only by a cause in which the universe in some fashion had its past and future in the same state at the same time. An entity must have a degree of freedom in itself that is not part of what it is in itself, and a degree of freedom that may, at times, be used to act at times in the future or in the past. In simple language, the universe must have a non-linear form in addition to its linear form. How to do this mathematically is beyond the scope of this chapter. Nor is there any known way whatsoever that it can be done.
What is more, the many-worlds interpretation violates a principle of symmetry. According to this principle, that of any process, if the process could have been the other way round, the universe would simply have been identical in every way. To put it more briefly: If you can rearrange the sequence of events in your past, the outcome will not be different in any way. The one principle which the many-worlds interpretation violates most flagrantly is this.
But even from those who call themselves realists, there is often no consistent response. The idea that nothing matters in this universe is clearly off-putting to most people. Yet they still remain adamant that nothing could ever have mattered. How is that possible? It is because "mattered" has a different meaning to them. To them, nothing ever mattered because they never accept that anything could have mattered in the past and would continue to matter in the future.
You can never have your cake and eat it, though. The idea that nothing was ever determined in the past is uncomfortable

instruction: What is the difference between HTML and JavaScript?
output:
What is the difference between HTML and JavaScript? HTML5 is an evolving standard for which there is no finalized specification. HTML5 is a subset of the Web Hypertext Application Technology (WHAT) standard. HTML5 combines existing standards such as XHTML2, SVG, CSS3, and RDFa. This will eliminate the need to use proprietary solutions for video, audio, animation, etc. An HTML5 application will also be able to use various JavaScript libraries. What is HTML5 and how is it different from its older versions? HTML 4 and earlier versions of HTML do not offer any feature that can help to interact, process, and share content with other users. HTML 5 adds several technologi- cal innovations that are important for the evolution of the Web: a more interactive environment, a better video player, etc. 4
5 How can we create a rich web app that works across multiple platforms? Why use HTML5? Why HTML 5? The main difference between HTML5 and its predecessors, such as XHTML 1.0 or later versions of HTML, is the level of supported functionality using JavaScript. In HTML 5, it is possible to create a very high performing, interactive, and rich end-user experience that runs across different browsers and other platforms without the use of a browser plugin. HTML5 is supported by all major browsers, as well as by mobile platforms such as iOS and Android (though we may have to wait for a while until the mobile platforms adopt HTML5). As in all technologies, however, there are still a few exceptions. HTML 5 has not yet been fully implemented. There is no standard yet for some of the major features, which will mean the implementation will take longer. There is no standard for the storage of offline content. How can we use HTML5 in our web application? There are certain components that help you to make use of the power, features, and technology of HTML5: HTML5 JavaScript API HTML5 History API HTML5 Geolocation API HTML5 Storage API HTML5 Drag & Drop API HTML5 Canvas API HTML5 Video API HTML5 Audio API HTML5 Web Workers HTML5 Web Sockets HTML5 Math API HTML5 Form Data API HTML5 5
6 HTML5 Drag & Drop HTML: Drag & Drop JavaScript API: Drag & Drop When a user holds the mouse button down and moves the mouse over an image or object it initiates the dragging operation. A CSS background image can be used as a dragging surface. During the drag operation the element representing the user interaction can be moved around the display surface, and during the drop operation we may want to do different actions. In order to do this we can use JavaScript and the HTML5 Drag & Drop API. The HTML5 Drag & Drop API can be used to implement many different elements, such as creating a visual feedback area during drags and drops, making drags and drops cross platform compatible, tracking drag and drop operations, displaying elements that may be used when drags and drops occur, etc. HTML5 Canvas HTML: Drawing the Image using JavaScript The HTML5 Canvas API allows use to draw the image, to implement animation, to create many 2D or 3D images, or to create a visual feedback during drags and drop operations. HTML5 Video HTML: HTML video element The HTML5 video Element supports playback functionality for audio and video formats, as well as a way to track time. It provides a lot of features for creating a good interactive end-user experience. HTML5 Audio HTML: Create a media element in HTML The HTML5 audio element includes playback functionality, and a way to track time. HTML 5 6
7 HTML5 Geolocation HTML: Web based geolocation The HTML5 Geolocation API is a way to get a user s geographical position using some of the built-in HTML5 features. The Geolocation API can be used across all web browsers with Internet connection, so there is no need for proprietary solutions. The Geolocation API can be used for different applications, from providing directions towards places of interest, using geo-caching, and for many other applications. Can we do it with JavaScript? How does the technology work? Web 2.0 applications are about sharing data in different ways. The web is no longer about static websites. Applications can be created for different platforms, and they can be opened without the need of a software installation. The technology has evolved, using different tools and features to make a very interactive and dynamic web application. JavaScript is a client-side language which is capable of providing interactive, dynamic, and interactive user experiences with the features of the web. JavaScript is the language of the web! JavaScript can be installed on different user platforms, without the need of software installation. JavaScript is a general-purpose language.
