instruction:
Could you provide a brief summary of the book "Fooled by Randomness", by Nassim Nicholas Taleb? Please provide a few paragraphs with the summary and the main points discussed in the book. 
How well the book was accepted and was there any negative or positive critic of the work presented there?
output:
Could you provide a brief summary of the book "Fooled by Randomness", by Nassim Nicholas Taleb? Please provide a few paragraphs with the summary and the main points discussed in the book. 
How well the book was accepted and was there any negative or positive critic of the work presented there?

Answer: I would give you some notes about this book.

This book tells about the difference between "randomness" and "correlation". So "randomness" means "informative and unpredictable events". By the other side "correlation" means "statistical dependence and therefore predictive". This is the first step for the author. So the author thinks that "randomness" can not predict the future.

"You cannot predict the future because of the randomness. The future is the result of random events plus non-random or predictable events. This fact creates a double standard in society. When one applies the same standards, then it can be applied to all. But since that is impossible, then those who want to apply such standards will not be able to do that. Since everyone wants to apply the same standard (predictability) to some and not others, this sets off the war of selection. A person can make the difference between good or bad and therefore can win on competition. The most important quality of a person is being able to predict the future by analyzing random numbers."
"What is predictable and therefore un-random is the nature of man and nature, even though there will always be a random factor involved."

In this passage I see the concept of randomness as a chance that can not be predicted. On the other side he thinks that randomness has some predictive point by being unpredictable. So in my opinion randomness and correlation are different.

Randomness that we normally think of is very complicated. So according to author, there have 4 levels in randomness.
\begin{itemize}
\item Randomness (no patterns).
\item Pseudo-random generators.
\item Random number generators.
\item Sequential probability ratio test.
\end{itemize}

Each level of randomness gives the chance of one thing to another thing. For example in level 2 we make random numbers and we can use those randoms numbers as a chance of probability
\begin{itemize}
\item Random number generators will decide between 2 choices.
\item Pseudo-random generators will decide not only 2 choices but a lot of numbers
\item In level 3 we have a series of events.
\item Sequential probability ratio test is a sequence of events as a series.
\end{itemize}

So I think that "Randomness" and "Correlation" can be explained with different reasons.

In the end, the book is very useful and informative. I'm waiting for comments.

instruction: How far away is Saggitarius A*, the black hole in the center of the milky way galaxy, from Earth and can you please provide that distance in light years and parsecs? Can you please also compare that distance to the distance of the center of the Andromeda galaxy from Earth?
output:
How far away is Saggitarius A*, the black hole in the center of the milky way galaxy, from Earth and can you please provide that distance in light years and parsecs? Can you please also compare that distance to the distance of the center of the Andromeda galaxy from Earth? Thank you.
I don't know how far away Sag A* is, but I have the distance to M31 and to the solar system in Earth radii (http://www.astro.psu.edu/planet/projects/earth_scale.html). Earth radii are roughly 6 times the distance from the center of the earth to the surface of the Earth. If that doesn't work, here is another conversion: The Earth radius is 6.371 times the radius of a sphere with the same mass as the Earth. So the radius of our solar system is about: (1.49)^0.5 = 1.064 times that value. 6.371^0.5 = 1.064.
I looked at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagittarius_A_star , but I see only the distance to the center of the galaxy within 1 light year. The closest star system to there is about 33,000 light years away.
The closest star to Sag A* is the star called S2. It orbits about 16 light years from Sag A* (http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2010/10/101015091557.htm). But that star isn't a solar system; it is a single star. The distance to the nearest other star to Sag A* is about 25,000 light years (http://www.cnn.com/2010/11/03/world/europe/milky.way/ ).
This shows the distance of stars to Sagittarius A*: http://sci.esa.int/jump.cfm?oid=40264. This shows some of the galaxies we've found around Sagittarius A*. It shows our own galaxy more than others. You'll notice that the light emitted by other galaxies doesn't reach us right away; it takes billions of years to do so.
What is the distance between earth and its sun? Why is the distance between the sun and the earth 3 x 10 ^10 meters?
The distance between the Earth and the sun is about 93 million miles. And the mean radius of the sun is about 390,000 miles. So the radius between the sun and Earth multiplied by 2 is 390,000 x 2. And then multiplied by 3 because of the spherical shape of the sun is 390,000 x 3 = 1.1 million miles.
So if the earth had the mass of the sun, the radius would be the mean radius of the sun divided by the mass of the sun. And then multiplied by the mass of the earth. That's 390,000/4.6 is 86,000, which means 86,000 times 6.37 (which is the radius of the earth) is 555,800 miles, about 3x10^10 meters.
You'll notice that 93 million miles isn't an integer number. So the earth and the sun both move in a small circle around each other. When they are an integer number apart, they come to a stop relative to each other and then start to orbit again. (I think that's the right explanation for why it isn't an integer number).

The earth also has some angular momentum. Even though it spins, if you took a stick and held it horizontally, it would point directly north. This is because the earth has a solid core. The axis of rotation in this case

instruction:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
output:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
A programming language is like a tool, it doesn't have an inherent meaning, it is only an instrument to express what the programmer "thinks". The programmer says "use Python" when really he says "build a program with this tool". In a sense, a language "is" its execution, so there is no difference between interpreted and compiled.
It is worthwhile to make some distinctions though:
a) The language you choose may not affect how fast your program runs, it may "only" affect how easy or hard it is to implement and how flexible your application is. Choosing the right language is a matter of convenience.
b) The language choice may determine how your program looks. If your code is all strings, it will look like a bunch of strings, if it is all numbers, it will look like a bunch of numbers. If it is all a very structured syntax, it will look like a very structured object oriented program..
c) The language choice may determine whether you need to use a compiler to compile your code into an executable or not.
d) The language choice may determine whether your code can be optimized automatically by a compiler optimizer (which will be done if you do c) above)
e) The language choice may determine whether your code can be shared easily by many people (which increases the overall knowledge of programmers, and increases overall productivity)
f) The language choice may determine whether your code can be executed in the cloud.
g) The language choice may determine whether your code has an easy to use debugger
h) The language choice may determine whether your code has a good set of libraries/API for easy use.
It is important not to think that your language or API has inherent meaning, or that it is superior by virtue of the fact that you use it. Choosing a programming language is a practical, pragmatic decision. It is a tradeoff between many factors, most of which are not known when the decision is made. Each one of us has to "make up our minds" (with some influence of others) on which factors are the most important to one's particular choice (the choice changes as we gain further experience). We can only say "the language I think is the "right" one has X features" . All programming language features are worthless if one doesn't understand how to program!
There's a reason why "program" is spelled "program" and isn't "proggram". Every action is meaningless and empty, as is every thought in a mind made of neurons. In a mind that is the product of its culture, it means something, even if only to be a means and not an end.
Language is an abstraction which lets us express a concept in a way we understand it. If one is trying to convey a concept or action in their mind, which is in a "mind made of neurons", they will probably find themselves using words they've learned, which will be a kind of artificial language which will not be their "mother's tongue". Which is to say, it will not be the thing they are trying to convey or the thing they are thinking. We create other languages which are abstractions from the reality. A child speaks as he learns from a language that is "mother tongue", but when he understands the nuance of what his mother said, he will create the same nuance in his own speech. A speaker of one language can't understand another unless he himself has been taught that language. Which is to say, as long as he doesn't understand the abstractions, he won't understand the nuance.
The purpose of a programming language is to create abstractions that provide a way that computers can understand our own language. Programmers express their code in a way which is as close to the reality or abstraction of our mind as they can. Programmers "speak the language of machines", or that is, the code in a programming language which the compiler can understand. Of course, it also must be readable by humans, or it wouldn't be of much use. We "speak the same language" to a certain respect with programs we write to accomplish certain tasks. The same is true for all languages, but a programming language is much closer than most.
Compilers are tools that translate one language into the language of the computer we use. A programmer may use several languages, but may use only one, depending on the task. C++ for an application with a single purpose. Javascript for a website with a single purpose. Python for an application with a single purpose. Java for an application with a

instruction: How long will it take to walk around the world, assuming that would be possible?
output:
How long will it take to walk around the world, assuming that would be possible? The question sounds funny at first -- sure, the world is big, but it should take just a few minutes to circle around. Unfortunately, it doesn't work that way -- a straight line would be impossible to walk around the world over any significant distance, and that would be the fastest way. The distance around the world isn't a nice round number -- it's about 21,161 miles. And that's just the distance around the equator! If you wanted to walk all the way around the world, you'd end up doing more like 29,238 miles, because of the curvature of the earth at your home. So, if you wanted to do it as quickly as possible, you'd end up walking an average of 5 km/h, or about 3 mph. If you want to take a more leisurely stroll around the world, you'll end up walking at an average 3 km/h, or a little over 1.5 miles per hour.

instruction: Pretend to be a business professional. Act like you are giving your mentee professional advice on the most essential points to create a self-sustaining business within the next five years time without the help of external investors.
output:
Pretend to be a business professional. Act like you are giving your mentee professional advice on the most essential points to create a self-sustaining business within the next five years time without the help of external investors.
It‚Äôs about teaching young entrepreneurs the basic steps of their business.
You will be able to help your mentee identify and grow the critical parts of their business, but will let them make the decisions themselves. The first part of step is, of course, getting a mentee, whom you will try to work with in advance to help them grow a great new business idea.
You should be prepared to spend a couple of hours per week mentoring your mentee but the time required will vary.
The only true way to see if your idea is viable or even if there is a market for your idea is to test it. Testing is not as easy ‚Äî and definitely isn‚Äôt as cheap ‚Äî as throwing dollars at prototyping, however, the results are much more valuable.
No successful business comes off the shelf. The only way to create a successful business is to fail at some ideas, to try new ideas, to test the market, to pivot and to refine. All of this ‚Äî failure, pivoting, testing, and finally success ‚Äî must happen in a safe environment but one which makes failing cheap and learning not too costly. The most important lesson a business mentor can teach a mentee is that failure is just a learning curve.
The mentor should be mentoring at the correct level for the mentee. The mentee should have the correct level of experience and should probably be at the same or later stage of their business than the mentee. If you are giving advice to entrepreneurs who are just getting started ‚Äî if you are the ‚ÄúBig Brothers‚Äù or ‚ÄúBig Sisters‚Äù ‚Äî then a mentor-mentee relationship is probably not what you want to be doing. The reason for this is that entrepreneurs who are just getting started need a lot of help and may not have the experience or business know-how to make the most of the information that they could receive from a mentor.
That doesn‚Äôt mean that you shouldn‚Äôt use an entrepreneurial mentor at this stage of your business. You should! But it does mean that you need to look at mentoring more as training and not as a mentoring relationship ‚Äî you should be looking at the mentoring relationship more as guided tutoring. There are a number of ways for you to do this, but the best place to start is with an entrepreneurial training program from your local SBA (Small Business Administration) office.
There are a number of local SBA offices that run entrepreneurial training programs. Many of the training programs are geared for entrepreneurs who are just starting their own business and who aren‚Äôt as experienced as you may be.
That doesn‚Äôt mean that you can‚Äôt find good mentoring from local SBA training programs. Most local SBA offices use the SCORE program as a training mechanism for entrepreneurs. SCORE ‚Äî Service Corp of Retired Executives ‚Äî has been mentoring young entrepreneurs for many years. It is a very good program that has some top notch mentors who can work with you through the stages of your business.
In addition, many local SBA training programs also work very closely with other business development organizations and training organizations to ensure that entrepreneurs are getting the training they need to get their businesses off the ground.
All you have to do to find out about the training resources in your local SBA office is to contact your local SBA office and ask them about the local training programs they run. You will want to ask them if they take on mentors and if so, what types of mentors they are looking for to work with the entrepreneurs they are training.
Many local SBA offices have developed strong working relationships with local training and business resource organizations that are helpful in creating and developing a mentor network for local businesses.
Once you find out who these organizations are, you can start to look for mentoring opportunities as these organizations are the best place to find the most experienced entrepreneurial mentors who are looking for some entrepreneurs to work with. If you are a young entrepreneur who has already started your own business, you still need some help to make your business successful. That‚Äôs where SCORE and local SBA offices can help you. Both types of offices have lots of potential mentors for you to work with ‚Äî mentors with years of experience who have worked with both new and experienced entrepreneurs.
So where do you look for these mentors?
Local SBA offices
Business resource organizations
Entrepreneurial associations
Startup

instruction: If I found a dollar bill, would it be illegal to keep it ?
output:
If I found a dollar bill, would it be illegal to keep it ? And how would I not know I had not paid tax on that dollar before ? What law states I must return to money (not say pay taxes ) to someone for some reason ?
Yes, I said it before, but it is even more true now. We are in a Constitutional crisis. And when I say that, I mean this. The Constitution says that we are a federal republic, and that means that the states are the ultimate source of authority. But we have been living far from this ideal for some time now, if ever. The Constitution does not say that the states are equal and have ‚Äúfair‚Äù representation in the government of the whole union. It is written that the population, the number of houses, and the land area of each state would decide its ‚Äúrepresentation‚Äù in Congress. But that does not mean fair representation. It means that if you are one house (a single person or family), then you have equal representation within your state, but the actual number of people in that state makes it up in a lot of ways. As such, if your state is not populous, then your voice doesn‚Äôt count. You can literally be outvoted by one vote per person in another more populous state in some instances. So the actual situation is NOT even close to ‚Äúequal fair and balanced‚Äù. That means the states, in fact, are not equal, and the Constitution only made it seem like they are. So we are a federal republic, with each state having unequal representation under the Constitution. And one way you can tell is that the House of Reps has been out of commission for over 90 years now. We use a legislating system, but the House of Reps isn‚Äôt supposed to have this much power. Yet, we use it in the same amount and effect that the Senate has, which the Constitution says will be the upper house. So when we hear people say Congress, they mean the Senate, and as a result (because they can‚Äôt use the HOR) they have ignored the Constitution and have made themselves a lot more powerful than the HOR should have. And this powergrab is not the only time they have done this to. Another example is the way the Fed Reserve board was created (the board itself was not the Fed. Reserve. Board., but it had authority over its creation and it is the board that regulates the Fed Reserve itself). The Constitution says that the legislative branch can make rules governing the executive branch when that branch was created by Congress (not the legislative branches). But they have overstepped their authority, and that is how we got the Fed Reserve instead of the government having regulation and having the banks be a part of it. And when you look back on the history of it, you see that the Fed Reserve was created specifically to avoid having banks be regulated by Congress and having it be in the government and have accountability to the people. And look at it now, the banks have no accountability to the people, but they are still one of the most powerful entities of our society with no oversight. They literally stole from the peoples money, and this is a form of treason as far as I am concerned. So, if I understand correctly, the House of Reps is out of commission for a very good reason. They have overstepped their authority numerous times since the Constitution was written and this has a lot to do with the problems we have today, and we have gotten into things much worse in the name of ‚Äúprogress‚Äù.
Which, according to Article I, Section VII, Clause II, this is specifically NOT how you appoint justices to the court. It goes like this. Congress can only confirm the appointment of justices if the people vote for the president (who may or may not be the same person who appoints the justices). But the people voting for the president is the only way to ‚Äúconfirm‚Äù the appointment of justices, which does not require an act of Congress.
‚ÄúIn the case of vacancies in the office of the President, the Vice President shall be President, and shall nominate, and by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, shall appoint, vice presidents.‚Äù
Now, this has only happened, once (although it was proposed twice). But the justices are NOT the president. They do have the power to veto an act of Congress (and override a veto) which is why they have the power to decide if laws are unconstitutional or not. But they do not have the power to appoint themselves or each other. Nor are they ‚Äúequal‚Äù to the president, they are his employees.
Well, this has been a long and short discussion‚Ä¶ Let‚Äôs see.

instruction: Suppose I have 12 eggs. I drop 2 and eat 5. How many eggs do I have left?
output:
Suppose I have 12 eggs. I drop 2 and eat 5. How many eggs do I have left?
I drop 3 and eat 2.
I drop 7 and eat 2. But now, I have too many eggs.
And so we see that ‚ÄúThe Dropout‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Kitchen‚Äù have nothing in common. Well, except for the cooks. ‚ÄúThe Cook‚Äù is the author of the short text, the author of ‚ÄúThe Dropout‚Äù is the person the short text is about.
Both are quite short, however. ‚ÄúThe Dropout‚Äù is a mere 7 paragraphs. And my friend doesn‚Äôt have very strong views about the literary merit of either. I‚Äôm not going to argue myself silly about grammar or style (I‚Äôll leave that to professional grammarians and suchlike), but a few observations.
1. This is a short story. That is, it has a storyline, characters, conflict, and a conclusion which is the end of the story. It has no plot, as far as I can tell, but then there isn‚Äôt much plot to a biography, either, although it has some.
2. The story is very short, 7 paragraphs, 3-4 sentences a paragraph, so it can be more of a sketch of a story than a full narrative. I like to say that it could be a flash fiction piece as well.
3. The writer‚Äôs style is very different to her daughter‚Äôs style. Her sentences are long and flowery ‚Äì full of words and phrases not easily understood by students (or possibly teachers). So the mother was very intelligent‚Ä¶ or she was very long winded, take your pick, with her daughter.
4. I don‚Äôt agree with one review I read. They suggested that the story was unfinished, with the mother still ‚Äúlurking‚Äù in the narrator‚Äôs head. I don‚Äôt believe that her mother is in the story at all. Maybe the daughter has been inspired by the way her mother thought and behaved, but she has been inspired by her life, not by what is in her ‚Äúmind‚Äù.
Of course, that‚Äôs my opinion. But then, I‚Äôm the author of this post.
Author abPosted on October 23, 2018 October 25, 2018 Categories books, english conversation, literature, writing17 Comments on Reading a short story
As I mentioned before, in the last three years of my teaching life, I did a ‚Äúworkshop‚Äù with people who had English as a foreign language. It was a wonderful time, and I‚Äôll post about this soon. For the time being, I thought, I‚Äôd talk about one of the authors I used to introduce them to poetry.
Melissa Balmain is a poet who started publishing in the 1980‚Äôs. She came from a family which was quite affluent, however, one of her parents was an alcoholic and so she never had the sort of luxuries her peers enjoyed, or the sort of upbringing they had. After school, before she went to college, she got a job at a petrol station ‚Äì and that‚Äôs how she first met the man who later became her first husband.
Melissa Balmain
She married at 18, and her husband‚Äôs family lived in England. So they moved there, and Balmain got involved with the University of London. When she found herself pregnant, she had to move back to New Zealand, where she wrote a book about her first year of marriage, The Hut. This was published in 1996 and went on to become a movie starring Kate Winslet. This was followed up by another book, Honeymoon in London, also about her life in England. Again, this made it to the big screen when Kate Winslet reprised the role of Balmain‚Äôs daughter. Another memoir was published in 1999, and her last book is a novel which was published in 2003.
Balmain describes her book as being a memoir of a first year ‚Äúmarried, and mostly pregnant, in the first years of marriage to husband, the Englishman, who is to become her soul mate.‚Äù
Her writing is quite good. She has a vivid imagination, and her writing is very descriptive. Although the subject matter is sometimes quite sad, she never really reveals the extent of the emotional pain she was experiencing. I did find reading it difficult at times, though. A lot of her recollections are based on her husband being an absent character. In her third book, a novel, he has re-entered her world as a major part

instruction: What are F-centers in crystallography ? How are they created and what consequences do they have on the overall appearance of crystal ?
output:
What are F-centers in crystallography ? How are they created and what consequences do they have on the overall appearance of crystal ?
1.What are F-centers in crystallography ? How are they created and what consequences do they have on the overall appearance of crystal ? The F-center is created by a vacancy that results from either radiation or thermal decomposition of the crystal. As the vacancy is formed, the electrons move outwards from the center to fill in the vacancy. When the crystal cools, the outward moving electrons re-enter the vacancy, thereby creating a new defect, usually a non-stoichiometric complex defect, and at the same time forming positively charged ions around the vacancy. Thus, all F-centers are created by the formation of vacancies. The most common reason for the formation of vacancies in crystals is radiation which is usually in the form of alpha-, beta-, or gamma-particles. These radiation particles act on the large scale in the crystal and thus on a molecular scale. The resulting electron clouds are displaced and, with the help of thermal energy, the vacancy is formed as a result of two or three electrons moving to the next outer shell at the molecular level and one electron from the original shell moving into the vacancy, leaving the space occupied in the next outer shell. The resulting charge is that of two positive ions surrounding the vacancy and a space where one electron is found. The nature of the charged ions is usually ionic which is the case for most of the known materials, but could involve some polyatomic cations if they are present in the crystal. The space between these charged ions is called the interstitial space as the charged ions are placed in the molecular space surrounding the vacancy. These interstitial ions are in a similar state to the ionic lattice but a more accurate description is 'a defective lattice' or 'defective solvent'. As a result, the free electron cloud is disordered and is termed the ' F-cloud '. This F-cloud could be the cause of fluorescence, phosphorescence or radioactivity, depending on the chemical composition of the crystal. The F-cloud does not only cause the formation of the charged centre, but also causes the production of many defects and other impurities such as vacancies, dislocations and planar dislocations. Defects are formed only when the vacancy is formed and any defect will result in a higher dislocation potential and lesser charge on the surface of the material. However, these defects have low concentrations and usually are non-stoichiometric defects. 2.What is the optical and spectroscopic signatures of these centers ? Since vacancies inhibit or stop the motion around the vacancy, therefore, the vacancies cause the material to lose some vibration energy. This decreases the optical activity of the material in some cases, or increases it in other cases. The degree to which optical activity is diminished or enhanced depends on the number and the position of the vacancy in relation to the optical active centers which is explained further below. Moreover, the optical activity and the spectroscopic are related to the presence of the free electron cloud. This free cloud inhibits the mobility of the electrons. Since this 'F-cloud' is in constant motion, its motion causes the atoms of the crystal to vibrate and as a consequence, the vibrational energy of the system increases. However, since the atoms are constrained from their full motion by the F-cloud, their motion decreases and the vibrational energy decreases. Therefore, F-centers cause both a decrease in optical activity and a decrease in vibrational frequency. The optical activity of a crystal is related to the number of electronic states associated with the electronic configuration of the orbiting atoms and the vibrational frequency is directly related to the number of states in the vibrational motions of the atoms. Thus the amount of optical activity depends on the number of electronic states and the number of vibrational states and thus the degree of vibrational entropy. As the vibrational entropy increases, the optical activity of the crystal decreases as the vibrational states of the atoms are filled. The decrease in optical activity and the decrease in vibrational entropy as a result of the presence of vacancies is related to the decrease in the radius of the ionic cloud and thus, causes the F-center to absorb more light than its neighbour.
Since the negative centres are charge-free and are in constant motion, the negative charges constantly move around these centres due to the charge difference and the resultant radiation of electric field waves around these charges.

output:
Explain why landlords can be considered superior to their tenants. In order to explain the reasons why landlords can be considered superior to their tenants, one must first begin by identifying four essential factors which must be present for this to be considered. Once this has been done, it can be explained that these factors do indeed exist when looking at the landlord tenant relationship. In order to establish the superiority of landlords over their tenants, the necessary aspects must be identified. As long as the conditions are present, the status of landlord over his or her tenant will be upheld. The four factors include that the landlord must own the property that the tenant is leasing, the landlord must have the right to exclude the tenant at any given time, the landlord must be able to...
...Landlords and tenants: Do they deserve each other? In the early eighteenth century, the word landlord was considered to be more favorable than the word rentier or usurer . However it was no longer of good repute during the industrial revolution because the factory system meant that capital was put to work, enabling economic prosperity and increasing urbanization. As a result, landlords were seen as greedy and selfish. (Albino Garcia and Vesla Weaver) The landlord, in a certain sense, is an entrepreneur; an intermediary that brings together people in need of housing and the resource that fulfills that need. He/she does so on the basis of a risk analysis ‚Äì which property will be leased to whom and for which payment. In contrast, the tenant is the person who receives housing services from the landlord and pays in the form of rent. The basic transaction is that a landlord provides housing to a tenant in exchange for money. The landlord thus, is the one who bears the risk and does the dirty work of sorting out and mediating problems encountered in the leasing of their residential housing units. While he/she may be seen as a hero in the end, he/she has to deal with a lot of problems that ultimately land him/her at the bottom of a ‚Äúwho-to-blame‚Äù list. The tenant is just happy to have somewhere to call his/her own in a society where not everyone has the chance to own a...
...LANDLORDS AND TENANTS Do Landlord and Tenants Deserve Each Other? It is common knowledge that the landlord and tenant relationship is an essential part of everyday living. Many individuals are in this type of situation, even if it is not apparent to them. Landlords and tenants are in this type of relationship for very different reasons. Some people are landlords in order to make extra money; others are landlords in order to accommodate others who could not afford to buy a house. Tenants on the other hand, are in the relationship by circumstance. Some are renting due to the fact they cannot afford to purchase the house they are living. The circumstances that people are in can lead to either a positive or negative interaction between landlord and tenant. According to Bouskila-Hurwitz and Eyal (2005), it is ‚Äúthe study of interactions between agents under asymmetric information when one agent has superior knowledge‚Äù (p.1002). The parties may not have superior knowledge, however, the situation may force the tenant to learn from the landlord. Some of the interactions between the landlord and tenant may include problems arising from the agreement (Bouskila-Hurwitz and Eyal, 2005). It is not uncommon to have some form of disagreement between landlords and tenants. One of these disagreement may be due to the fact...

instruction: The wireless Internet signal in my house is weak in some rooms.  How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?
output:
The wireless Internet signal in my house is weak in some rooms.  How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?  I have used an iPhone with 3G and I have recently switched to a 4S with 4G to see if there will be any improvements in quality.  The download speed hasn't changed but the upload speed has become worse.  There have been other improvements too such as better coverage.  This is fantastic.
> The iPhone has a built in modem.  Have you heard of anything which improves this builtin modem?  I'm not really sure whether they provide any service.  I would have thought it would have been included so that Apple could upgrade the modem at some point.
> I have also seen a new 4G LTE USB modem called LTE Mobile LITE ( http://www.verizonwireless.com/b2c/mobileinternet/celluar/products/lte-mobile-lite/) which has 2 antennas so that it can provide 4G LTE service.  This will also allow for faster cellular broadband.  I believe that there is also a 3G version for areas where 4G isn't operable.  This might be good for some people if they want to enjoy a faster mobile broadband but unfortunately 4G coverage isn't as good as you might expect it to be.  There is no 4G option yet for the 4S.  I believe that the next iPhone may have a 4G option which will also make use of the latest LTE network standard which is not compatible with the USB 4G LTE modems such as the LTE Mobile LITE.  In order to use the modem, the phone would have to be jailbroken and then use a tool called "Open LTE" which was recently released by OpenRevs which makes use of the iPhone 4S's modem which can then provide 4G LTE service.  One of the disadvantages of this method is that the modem is not compatible with 4G LTE because of compatibility requirements.  The same can be applied to the new USB modems such as the Verizon MiFi 4510 L TE which has 2 antennae to provide 4G LTE service but is not compatible with the iPod touch which could make use of the USB modem to provide high speed mobile broadband.  It would be very interesting though if OpenRev's new tool which enables a jailbroken iPhone 4S to provide 4G LTE service could then use the USB USB modem.  Imagine what would be possible.  Unfortunately, 4G LTE service is a little slow.  It may be faster in some cases, but it isn't as fast for some users.  The biggest disadvantages are the coverage and speed.  In certain areas, the coverage might not exist for certain providers such as Verizon and will require an AT&T 3G network.  In other areas, it is slow due to high usage in the particular area meaning that it may be difficult to provide 4G LTE service due to high usage such as in offices and warehouses.  A big plus is that you should get high speeds while indoors.  This will be really good for when you want to download a large file or play online video games.  If you use a Verizon USB 4G LTE modem like the Verizon MiFi 4510 LTE, you will find that it will operate using Verizon's 3G 4G LTE network, which means that you can get full service in areas where they have 4G coverage even though the service is only 10Mbps. The other positive aspect is that the device is fully compatible with Verizon's high speed 3G network, so you can use the USB modem just like a mobile broadband card without any problems what so ever.  The biggest advantage is that it is a lot more cost effective.  This is great.  If you have been considering buying a mobile broadband card for your laptop, but don't have a lot of money then you should consider using the USB modem as long as you have a good connection to download large files.  If you are a gamer, you might find that you play a lot better because of fast speeds for online games.  I think you'll find that it will be very useful.  For people who use an Internet connected device, it is definitely the cheapest option.

instruction: Why can't you see the stars in the city, but you can in the countryside?
output:
Why can't you see the stars in the city, but you can in the countryside? The city streets are covered in light from electric lighting and light pollution. Light pollution can cover the night sky and prevent you from seeing stars, planets and constellations. Light pollution can also interfere with wildlife behaviors, causing disruption and ultimately, even possible extinction.
The good news is, we live in the 21st Century, we have technology that helps us understand things like light pollution in a more practical way. To help educate the public on light pollution, our organization (the International Dark-Sky Association) produces maps of light pollution using technology called the Sky Quality Meter.

instruction: Help me get a job in the government in which I‚Äôll have major bargaining power
output:
Help me get a job in the government in which I‚Äôll have major bargaining power and will be able to pay back all that debt that I owe (including interest ‚Äì not in a year, not in five ‚Äì but right now), even if that job pays far less than what my undergrad gave me.
In other words, Obama‚Äôs 12.5% tax on incomes above $250,000, which he‚Äôs been fighting tooth and nail, should be seen (and used) not as a means of helping the middle class, but as an important form of loan forgiveness ‚Äì something that the current crop of lawmakers haven‚Äôt been remotely willing to do.
Because, unlike the federal government, which does have money (well, not yet).
There‚Äôs only so much the government can do, because our system of credit is based on private enterprise, not government-owned institutions. I don‚Äôt want to put more of a hurt on the US tax-payer to pay off my student loans because it‚Äôs simply too much debt for them to take on ‚Ä¶ which takes me back to my original argument!
Fortunately, my own student debt (which has accrued at a rate of 9.5%) is not nearly as large as yours, and I don‚Äôt own my house!
So I can‚Äôt really sympathize with this argument that Obama is trying to make!
But I totally (and I emphasize this!) understand why law schools are doing this. They‚Äôre the business school with the most prestige and they need to get their money somehow. The market is not there and they have to be proactive in doing what they can to get their money. It‚Äôs the same mentality that led to the credit crunch, but who am I to say such a thing.
As I have tried to argue (and you may have heard in an earlier blog entry), law schools exist primarily to serve the needs of private industry, not the needs of society (I‚Äôm looking at you, Fordham). We should have stopped them when they tried this trick. Now I fear that the trick will prove much more lasting in its effects.
In any event, I agree with you that we should be taking a much more critical look at what law schools teach, how they teach it, and what effect that has on the legal profession.
The answer‚Äôs obvious. The money the public spends on public colleges has a much lower rate of return than the amount public colleges cost. There is no such thing a free lunch.
But let‚Äôs do the math, assuming an average classroom of 25 first years and they stay for 4 years, that‚Äôs $75,000 per classroom, per year (ignoring a possible 5th year, which adds the cost of a clinical program). Now, law professors are expensive, but they don‚Äôt teach all those courses. Add the cost of administration (law schools have been on an administrative arms race with one another), and the costs just escalate.
With 6,000 or so law schools that‚Äôs about a billion dollars in public funds (I‚Äôm assuming the entire cost of 25 classrooms was paid out of public funds; I know of some schools that have some private and some public costs). Now, let‚Äôs say, conservatively, that the average publicly funded law school has 40 faculty members on average (which, believe me, is a pretty low number). That‚Äôs another $8 million per school just on their payrolls. Add in their benefits and office space and you‚Äôve hit another 7 figures.
And let‚Äôs say conservatively that each law professor earns, on average $125,000 per year. That‚Äôs an additional $800,000 per school.
Now, in the private market that sort of costs is easily passed on to law students. After all, we all know that businesses are efficient machines that, in their quest for profit, find better ways of getting stuff done. If the same law schools were just out to make a profit, we‚Äôd be looking at annual tuition on the order of $250,000 per student per year (if not more). With such a low rate of return, no one would be willing to attend law school but, I‚Äôm sorry, that‚Äôs the market.
But because the government subsidizes their inefficient business approach, it becomes very difficult for them to simply cut salaries and benefits in order to maintain revenue streams sufficient to pay the faculty and rent. (To be blunt, the government has never been in the habit of making law schools more

instruction: Give me a list of 5 words where the letters of the words are in alphabetical order. One example: "doors". "d" comes before "o", "o" comes before "r", and "r" comes before "s".
output:
Give me a list of 5 words where the letters of the words are in alphabetical order. One example: "doors". "d" comes before "o", "o" comes before "r", and "r" comes before "s".
This is an easy problem to solve with a quick check for words (and the dictionary doesn't have to do this).
I don't get the "Give me 5 words" part - can't you do this yourself - and the requirement for words in alphabetical (or whatever order) - can't you just give your answer in alphabetical order?
"Give me" means you can't use these words anywhere to solve the problem. You have to find them yourself; you can't see them. It's more of a challenge than a normal solution (where you are given the answer).
Here's an idea, in code form. I'm using ruby, not javascript.
for key in words.keys do
for letter in key
if alphabet.include? letter
for n in 1...26
letter = letter.chr(n + 65)
until array_of_letters.include? letter
if alphabet.include? letter # array_of_letters hasn't been built yet
words[letter].reverse # puts the words in reverse alphabetical order
Put the code in a method, and make it private; then call an instance method from another object (or function). That way, you don't have to worry about "Give me 8 words".
The code is correct. All you have to do is pass the word to your function, and it will give you the word back in the same order, but backward.
But you have to be careful to call the function before calling the dictionary.
My code is too complex, just to check for a word in a list of 5 words.
If I had the 8 words, then sure, I could do it.
You might be thinking about this too complexly.
Just give me the list and I'll reverse it (alphabetically) and I'll be done?
I have a simple solution that is "better".
"Give me 8 words". That's the hard part.
I would think the best way to do this would be to make the key a random word and the value of that key would be a dictionary of words, not the dictionary name itself. That would allow you to search this dictionary of words, which should be built on the first search. (ie: You can search for any random words, as long as the word was originally in the dictionary, then it will be searched for each of the words) Each word is then put back into the dictionary in reverse alphabetical order. That should be it.
Can a program be better if it does the hard work for you (even if you have to write a few dozen lines of code in the process)?

I really enjoyed reading this, and found that I agree with nearly everything you‚Äôve done, at least at the university level.
There are always going to be people who are good and people who aren‚Äôt so good (at programming, not writing). To the question of whether I think it‚Äôs important to have a well written document, I say ‚Äúno‚Äù. Yes, it‚Äôs nice to have a well-written document to read, but I really don‚Äôt think that it‚Äôs important to have a well-written document to read if it‚Äôs a good one to hack on. That is, I think that it might better if a good program has a little more than one line of documentation, and that a little documentation might be better than lots of documentation (or at least an argument could be made for it).
The same idea could be applied to more than just programming (and I‚Äôm not trying to hijack your post). There are, for example, those who hold the opinion that you should always use well-named variables, that it‚Äôs better to write a less-than-optimal piece of code than to write more than one line of it. Now, to me, there‚Äôs something to be said for not writing your variable (but what if you do?), but I wouldn‚Äôt say that it‚Äôs good style for everyone to use.
Of-course, I really have nothing to say on the issue of whether or not to use spaces after a declaration. :)

Do you know how to speak German? Then we want you! At Uh, we do everything in our power to enhance our students professional careers as well as their own personal development. And we take our responsibility seriously: in the labor markets of the future it is not enough to simply know a particular language but rather to be able to use it to communicate in different contexts. We therefore offer a wide range of German courses as well as courses in other languages. Language study is an integral part of our degree programmes and an integral part of our students research.
Study & Examination
Uh is not only proud of its excellent academic results (17 German federal states and 1 Austrian federal state currently rank in the top ten for the achievement of Uh graduates in the German labour market) but also of its academic, sporting, musical and cultural activities. In 2001, the University of Hildesheim also received an award for its commitment to equal opportunities for men and women based on a gender mainstreaming analysis, an audit of the institution's Gender Mainstreaming policy, and the implementation of a programme designed to implement the policy recommendations. The University of Hildesheim has been a state foundation since its inception in 1973. The University of Hildesheim is characterised by its diversity, which is due to its history, and the large scale of its activities. The University currently enrols around 7,500 students at the main site in Hildesheim and in various specialist centres in G√∂ttingen, Hannover, Seesen, Wolfsburg, Cuxhaven, Potsdam and Berlin. Most of the Uh students are German. But we also offer an attractive range of courses to international students and have been welcoming many thousands of international students from Europe, Asia, America and Africa for many years. We also teach in English.

instruction: What is the Balfour Declaration?
output:
What is the Balfour Declaration? When did Isr a become a state? Who were Arafat, Abbas, Peres, Netanyahu? Who were Rabbis Ovadia Yosef and Yitzckok Kadur, and what did they do? And what about the Pogroms in Poland in the early years of the 20th c?
Besides this, he will try to help the two parties hammer out a workable and peaceful plan for coexistence. He knows how to handle people, and he will be able to work with the leaders from both Israel and Palestine.
It is no accident that Obama chose the above man to lead his peacemaking team.
I believe he is a Zionist. I think he will succeed in convincing the Palestinians of the need for peace, since he has made peace with the Arabs and Muslims around the world. He understands the fear of the Palestinians and the desperation to have their own state. But more importantly, he has come to believe in this cause. It is part of the Judeo-Christian tradition, and he now believes it.
With his help, a compromise will be found that will satisfy both parties, and the current stalemate will be ended. In the future, we will look back on the Balfour Declaration and the years 1897 to 1948 as the years of transition between one time and another. Our hope is that Obama will help us to establish a final agreement, a lasting and just solution that will allow Israel to coexist with a Palestinian state.
So, for now, we can only wait and hope. Our fate, the fate of the Jewish people, is in the hands of Mr. Obama.
Will our history repeat itself? Will 1948 become 1918 in the new world order? The Jews have waited for 60 years of peace and prosperity in Israel under the auspices of the UN. Have we been duped? Or will Obama's words become action? Only time will tell.
The following is a photo that I took of an abandoned home in my neighborhood. It is in the process of being re-built. All I could think about was that it had been 17 years, 10 months and 24 days since I was last here. And that it was still an occupied territoy. I thought of all the friends and family that I knew and loved and who are still missing, and thought of all the people that I had lived alongside for so long who are living in refugee cites around the Palestinian territories, and how I know they are dreaming about what they left behind. I thought about the history behind this place and why a peace settlement could not be reached between the two sides, and why a people who had given so much in their service to America's wars over the three and a half decades since they "fled" were somehow still not accepted. I knew the reason that they would not be accepted: the fear of the right of return of the people of Lebanon, of the same fear of the right of return of the Palestinians, that the fear of the right of return of the indigenous Native Americans, Blacks and Hispanics in America, and the fear of the right of return, and fear of integration, of the people of Africa. That fear in not of the people that were wronged, and it will never lead us toward peace.
I also knew that this fear was born out of ignorance, lack of education, and lack of communication between cultures. I wanted to take pictures to show the world, the good people of this country, the ignorant people of this country, the blind followers of this country, the people who are afraid of losing something that they never really had, that people of the world are people of the world, the same color, religion, language, the same dreams, the same lives lived under oppression, the same hopes for the future. There will never be peace and unity until there is communication. But when we as peole of the world speak with our wallets, not with our fear, but with our understanding that the way of the world is always change, that we can not prevent it, that we can not go back to the way of things that are not anymore, we create the change that we say we want.
This is a photo that I took right after I arrived in Jerusalem this afternoon. It is the "old town" of the city, the Christian Quarter, just past Jaffa Gate.
You might already know that today is the anniversary of the Balfour Declaration, which was issued by the British Government on this date in 191

I also spend quite a bit of time on Reddit in several subs, though never for longer than 30 minutes. As for Twitter, I try and limit posts to once or twice a day. Apart from that, I have set the phone to silent after 9 pm so that I do not receive work emails after hours. This is a bit of a struggle: the phone needs to be visible to family as they often rely on it for information. My wife also needs the phone to read me the news in Spanish for the 6.00 am radio show.
Telling a friend about it
Wow: that sounds like a really tough schedule, but you seem to have a lot of energy. Is this how all of your days look like?
Yes it is. While I am at home, I am focused on my family and my projects. During work hours, I am focused on work. This schedule gives me an opportunity to participate in the community, do fun things, and spend time with family. It is really important for me to manage my time and energy intelligently so that I do not miss out on the most important things.
For this to work well, my employer needs to know that I work a lot on open source projects after hours. Without support from a manager and coworkers, I would not be able to do this.
I think that what you have achieved with your open source contributions in your limited free time is quite incredible. Do you see a trade-off between being a family man and being an open source contributor?
I think I could do a bit ‚Äúmuch‚Äù by using my personal time more productively, but I am happy to do this for now. I think it is important to have a life outside of open source. Many open source contributors focus too much on open source and spend too little time outside open source.
I have some things that I have been working on for more than 10 years that might never see completion. However, working on these things has shaped me, and I have learned a lot.
For me, it is more important to see something completed than to work on something forever.
Do you have any advice on how to balance between being a family man and being an open source contributor?
Try to work closely with the people you work with. They will appreciate your help and be understanding when you need to prioritise your family. Be honest and direct in your communications. Do not just make excuses, take the blame and tell people you do what you do because of your family commitments. Also, I believe that you will be happier if you pursue your passions rather than spending your life working hard for a pay

2) Coach Malibu

output:
Which of the following elbows are the most wet?
A. A kilogram of feathers
2) Coach Malibu
D - The cross-section of air, and the cross-section of feather are both the same ‚Äì 1 mm¬≤. If there were 20,000,000,000 birdies, and if each feather weighed about 0.06 grams, then the feathers would weigh 1,200 tons. But the feathers are very lightweight (about half an ounce each) so this weighs less than 1% of air. The webbing of the wing is made of about 25% elastic fibers.
3) C - The skin is a thin layer of feathers ‚Äì about half an inch, that prevents bacteria, dirt, flies, or germs from getting into the body. There are other important layers of feathers which help to keep birds warm and dry, but we'll get into those later.
4) B - Each time a bird flaps its wings, there are some that hit the skin and don‚Äôt get through. Birds have special structures to help deal with this, one of which is the ruffle of contour feathers found on both the upper and lower wing coverts. The contour feathers give the skin something to grab and slide up or down depending on the wing position. This helps to reduce the number of feathers that stick to the skin, and helps to keep them from sticking so firmly to the skin that the bird won‚Äôt be able to get the wing up in the air again.
5) C - Birds have a large number of feathers surrounding the breast area, which serves the purpose of keeping a bird from losing heat. In very cold climates, some birds use what are called counter-current heat exchange systems to keep a bird warm. These systems are actually blood vessels that are located inside certain feathers. As the bird moves, these feathers move and rub against other feathers, allowing some hot blood to circulate from the warmest parts of the body. In the same manner, cooler blood travels to the cooler regions of the bird.
6) A - In wet climates, the downy feathers can quickly lose heat when wet, and therefore make a bird colder than the temperature of the surrounding air. This results in a bird growing a second set of feathers: one for the outdoors and one for the indoors. This is not necessary in dry habitat, because the feathers in these cold climates stay dry and are not a problem.
7) D - The feathers of some species look very rough, and the scales look like rough sandpaper or velcro. This type of feather helps the bird in water by reducing drag when swimming, and in aiding to propulsion when flying.
8) E - The feathers can range in color from light to dark gray, to black, brown, or white. The majority of feathers are a muted shade of brown, but this has more to do with the pigment in the feathers, not with the color of the feather. The down feathers, however, are generally white, but can also range from nearly white to nearly black.
9) C - Feathers are not like those of mammals because they don't have layers underneath the scale-less portion of the feather (or flight feather). The feather is comprised of a quill that has small hook-like barbs that are formed at the tip of each quill, called vanes. The barbs all point in the same direction, or towards the quill core. Since flight feathers also have muscles attached near the quill core, when the muscles contract, the feather is blown forward. The air flowing over the feather then becomes turbulent and causes air to flow over or under the feather in a vortical manner. This vortical movement then causes a net upward force and gives the bird its ‚Äúlift.‚Äù
10) A - We talked about flight feathers earlier, and since they are comprised of many, many barbs pointing towards the quill core of the feather, the vanes don‚Äôt overlap. We also talked about contour feathers which are similar to flight feathers, because it‚Äôs the barbs on the contour feathers that the skin grabs hold of. Since other vanes can cover them, the contour feathers don‚Äôt need to be as long (i.e., in flight).
11) A - Many feathers are not used for flight. Most of the tail, head, back, breast, and rump feathers are not in the

MLA:

Desk jobs require writing a lot of emails, so it isn't surprising we get tired of repeating ourselves. Come up with several synonyms for the given word.

Sincerely
output:
Desk jobs require writing a lot of emails, so it isn't surprising we get tired of repeating ourselves. Come up with several synonyms for the given word.

Sincerely,

Yours truly,

Yours faithfully,

Cordially yours,

## Examples

This letter starts a thank-you note to your new supervisor.

Dear Supervisor:

Thanks very much for your help in my performance appraisal. Your review of my work over the previous year was extremely helpful, especially because of all you shared regarding your own methods. I am confident that I can apply the lessons learned to my position today and every day moving forward.

Your review reminded me how vital it is to stay focused on my priorities and objectives, so I am doing just that. I have established some short- and long-term goals, which are in progress. The supervisor is on course, and the sub-manager is reporting directly to me, and she is also doing a splendid job. I could not ask for more.

Regardless, if any further assistance that I might to help you or the department, please feel free to ask. Also, do not hesitate to contact me with any problems or questions. I hope you have a wonderful day.

Yours truly,

Sincerely,

Yours faithfully,

Cordially yours,

## See also

* List of English phrases
* Yours sincerely, similar to Yours faithfully but without the "faithfully" closing (or sometimes "very")
* Yours truly, similar to yours faithfully but without the "faithfully" closing (or usually "very")
* Yours,
* Yours sincerely,
* Yours truly,
* Yours

## External links

* Dear Sir / Madam: examples letter with salutations (e-Learning for Educators).
* Yours Sincerely: examples letter with sincerely salutations (e-Learning for Educators).

output:
The tone of the email should be changed and rewritten in a more professional manner.

Subject: Asking for Vacation Time
Hi [Employer], 
I hope all is well. I am writing to request a day off on [date]. I have already taken care of my work responsibilities for that day and will be available to answer any questions or concerns you may have. 
Thank you for your time, 
[Your name]

Answer: You can write and send an email, asking if one of your colleagues can cover for you. It would look something like this:

\begin{blockquote}
Dear [colleague name], I am writing to ask if you can cover my shift tomorrow, the 2nd of August. [If you were the first to respond and to agree, simply remove this sentence ‚Äì ed] I hope you are well and have had a nice weekend. See you in the office. Kind regards, Jane Doe.
\end{blockquote}

Another option is: Dear [colleague name], I write to you as you are the closest available work colleague. I am taking a day off on [date] so the next person on the rota list is [colleague name] tomorrow. If it is not possible for them to cover my shift, could you please let me know as soon as possible. Thank you. Your response will be much appreciated. Kind regards, Jane Doe.

Answer: As a manager, let me clarify what I think could be your intent and tell you how I would deal with the situation on an individual basis.

You mean that you asked several colleagues if they can cover your shift for you by answering one work e-mail, yes? And you are hoping that someone will respond at all and then cover so you can enjoy your vacation day? I would appreciate that as well, and would respond positively.

Unless you are the only nurse in the office (not likely), you should have the right to a personal day off. Nobody would ask you to cover other person's shift at the same time. If it really matters to you to take a day off and someone is willing to cover for you on the same day, then you both have a win. I would not hold it against anyone who does not want to take my shift to cover me. I would take it as a sign of mutual respect: You are working in the office as well. So if I am the only one on shift, what will you do? Nothing. If I am working with several colleagues, each of us is covering his or her shift on the same day. I will have the time off, and you are also off that day as well.

So how do I deal with employees who claim they need to take a vacation day on the same day I want one (as a manager)? Well, depending on your company culture, I may respect their feelings, or I might feel that the only fair thing to do is to assign that day to someone else. The decision will vary from company to company, so each manager will have a unique view of the situation. I may feel that I am entitled to have a one-on-one conversation with that person and convince him or her to change the vacation day. Or I may not care and feel that I am giving that person an undeserved personal vacation day.

If your employers would prefer to do only one way and that cannot work for you, consider whether some sort of an alternative work arrangement will better suit your needs.

Answer: The polite thing to do would be to wait until the end of the day when you had coverage for the day off and see if any one of the people you had asked would actually take your shift.

However, if you were planning your vacation (and you didn't have to get someone to cover for you) it would have been smarter to take the full vacation day instead.

The simple thing to do would be to ask the person who is covering for you to cover someone else's shift for a day.

However, it might be that the people who covered for you were more reliable and trusted than your other colleagues.  And then you run into the problem with asking your superiors if you can take another person's shift for two reasons:
\begin{itemize}
\item They may be suspicious that you are just trying to get someone to cover for you so that you can enjoy your personal day.
\item You have less cover to go to if there is a problem when you are out.
\end{itemize}

instruction: A helpful writing exercise is writing a story without using adjectives or adverbs. This will help you learn to use other words and phrases to describe what you are trying to say. Here are some examples:
output:
A helpful writing exercise is writing a story without using adjectives or adverbs. This will help you learn to use other words and phrases to describe what you are trying to say. Here are some examples: This is the worst poem I have ever read! It was horrible! The most terrible poem I have ever read! There are several different ways of writing a poem. You can write about something very specific and try to make it as descriptive as possible or you can write
20 about something very abstract, like love, and use it as a means of communicating yourself emotionally. A poem often makes connections between things or states of being that our everyday speech doesn t. Therefore, you usually need to look at the words and the ideas behind the words to make the connections. You can also use metaphors to help your audience connect to your ideas. I want to tell you a secret. My life isn t like everyone s around me I have a dream. I don t want to be average. That s why my dad said that we should just take a year off. He wanted us to save up money for college before he got a job when we returned. He knew that I needed a break. This was a huge sacrifice for my parents, not just monetarily, but also by not being where they wanted to be. They couldn t have done this if they hadn t given their lives to God. Because of this, I think I am an open and honest person. When I say I m doing okay, there is no hidden pain. I believe by trusting and putting my faith in God, He will take care of me. This doesn t mean that I don t get discouraged or sad. I am totally normal in that sense. I really liked this quote from John Wooden s book Wooden on Leadership: A lot more goes into being a good leader than being able to run a company. People are much more complex than that. It s about being able to recognize that complexity and to handle it, and to handle it in a way that makes people better people. In order to be a good leader, I believe you have to be trustworthy. You have to be someone that people will turn to when things are bad and they want someone to comfort them. You cannot be someone that people like all of the time. When someone has a problem, you cannot always have the perfect answer. Sometimes that takes away from a people s ability to learn for themselves. That means sometimes you can be selfish like you can be unreasonably demanding upon others. You have to be able to accept situations that are uncomfortable for you. You have to be willing to put in a great deal of hard work if you are going to run a company. Most importantly, you have to be someone people trust. Otherwise, they will not want to give it to you. I believe this quote really relates to my leadership style when it comes to my peers. I like to help people whenever they need it. The moment they need something they know that they can come to me and that I will make it better. The reason why I do this is because it makes me feel good. If I help someone, I feel a sense of accomplishment. I feel like it is going to make them better people. That is probably why I want to be a teacher. I believe it goes back to the time I realized my parents could do anything they set their minds to. I wanted to be exactly like them when I grew up, with a passion for education. If my students say they are struggling and really cannot find a way to fix the assignment on their own, they come to me. If they can t figure out a complex problem, they can ask me. If they have a hard time understanding a concept in class, they can come to me for help. I always try to be there for them, so I can learn with them every chance I get. I always do my best to make them feel comfortable and
21 to make them know they are capable of doing whatever they set their minds to. You will notice that there have been very few references to sports in my leadership qualities. This was extremely intentional. I believe a large majority of schools, when you look around you notice that schools revolve around their athletic and football teams. They only talk about those things because those things make the most money for them and these are the things that will give you the most attention from the outside world. While I do believe academics should be a main focus, I do not believe they should be the center core of a school. I believe there should be many different ways a student can find what they enjoy and where they excel. I think there should be many different ways where they could get involved. I think if someone wants to do something there should be an opportunity, and I am not saying that if they want to do something with sports, there won t

Answer: Here is a macro solution:

\begin{code}
Sub budgeterMacro1()
    Dim budgeter1 As Worksheet
    Dim budgeter2 As Worksheet
    Dim budgeter3 As Worksheet

    Dim budgeter1Wks As Worksheet
    Dim budgeter2Wks As Worksheet
    Dim budgeter3Wks As Worksheet

    Set budgeter1 = Sheets("budgeter1")
    Set budgeter2 = Sheets("budgeter2")
    Set budgeter3 = Sheets("budgeter3")

    Set budgeter1Wks = budgeter1.Parent.Worksheets("budgeter1")
    Set budgeter2Wks = budgeter2.Parent.Worksheets("budgeter2")
    Set budgeter3Wks = budgeter3.Parent.Worksheets("budgeter3")

    Dim budgeter1WS As Worksheet

    Set budgeter1WS = Worksheets(budgeter1Wks.Name).Cells(1, budgeter1WS.Columns.Count).End(xlToLeft), _
           budgeter2WS = Worksheets(budgeter2Wks.Name).Cells(1, budgeter2WS.Columns.Count).End(xlToLeft), _
           budgeter3WS = Worksheets(budgeter3Wks.Name).Cells(1, budgeter3WS.Columns.Count).End(xlToLeft)

    Dim budgeter1WSCount As Integer
    budgeter1WSCount = budgeter1WS.Columns.Count
    budgeter2WSCount = budgeter2WS.Columns.Count
    budgeter3WSCount = budgeter3WS.Columns.Count

    For wCnt = 2 To budgeter1WSCount + budgeter2WSCount + budgeter3WSCount
        Dim budgeter1WSCell As Range
        budgeter1WSCell = budgeter1WS.Cells(wCnt, budgeter1WS.Columns(budgeter1WSWS.Row()))
        budgeter1WSCell.FormulaR1C1 = budgeter1WS.Cells(wCnt - budgeter1WSWS.Row(), budgeter1WS.Columns(budgeter1WSWS.Row()))

        Dim budgeter2WSCell As Range
        budgeter2WSCell = budgeter2WS.Cells(wCnt, budgeter2WS.Columns(budgeter2WSWS.Row()))
        budgeter2WSCell.FormulaR1C1 = budgeter2WS.Cells(wCnt - budgeter2WSWS.Row(), budgeter2WS.Columns(budgeter2WSWS.Row()))

        Dim budgeter3WSCell As Range
        budgeter3WSCell = budgeter3WS.Cells(wCnt, budgeter3WS.Columns(budgeter3WSWS.Row()))
        budgeter3WSCell.FormulaR1C1 = budgeter3WS.Cells(wCnt - budgeter3WSWS.Row(), budgeter3WS.Columns(budgeter3WSWS.Row()))

    Next
End Sub
\end{code}

That will do the same as the original macro, and be much improved on a few more points:
\begin{itemize}
\item Your original macro would have a performance problem because you were reading \strong{all the} columns \strong{from} the budgeter1 sheets to work with later. This macro will read only those columns where you have numbers to apply the formula to (just columns 2 to 11). The time required would be a fraction of the original macro. This also solves the problem of having no row

Answer: \begin{code}
Option Explicit

Sub Get_RandomRange()
    Dim i    as long, _j As Long, _k As Long
    Dim RandomRange, Rng    As Range
    RandomRange = Cells(Rows.Count, "A").End(xlUp).Offset(1, 0).Address
    Rng = Cells(RandomRange, "A").End(xlUp)
    i = 5000
    ReDim _i(i) As A

    For j = 3 To i
        For _k = 4 To i
            If Rng.Address = _i(j).Address Then
                _i(j).Item(5) = E(Rng)
            End If
        Next
    Next
End Sub
\end{code}

\strong{Note:}

\begin{blockquote}

\begin{itemize}
  \item I used some random number generation, which was the first one I found on a blog. You can generate it as you wish.
  \item You can make your code as long as you want.

\end{itemize}
\end{blockquote}

There is one thing that most people find really, really hard about design reviews: how do you make sure that more than one person gets involved. You can‚Äôt simply ask someone if they like your design, you need to actually get agreement in real-time, on the spot. The problem, however, is that design reviews are about opinions, which vary greatly between individuals. You can have one person say that they hate something, while another person thinks it‚Äôs awesome. How do you get people to agree when the only solution before this was simply trying it again with two or more people?
You‚Äôll likely hear the same three opinions in any single design review, which makes it really hard to decide what to do with your designs. The people in your design reviews are likely experienced designers, who tend to have strong opinions. So how do you create that consensus, or better yet, actually get a majority of your design reviewers to agree? Get feedback to become more productive (and less stressed) in your work flow. Get feedback from trusted friends and colleagues.
This is the tried-and-true strategy for solving your toughest creative or presentation problems. When you‚Äôre at your wits end, it‚Äôs always worth asking a trusted colleague for their opinion. They can also help you figure out what to focus on in the first place. Make sure you share your designs with them. If they need a little extra push, here‚Äôs why you should ask for feedback. Find outside feedback from a designer. Even if you don‚Äôt know many designers, a freelancer or designer-friend of a friend could be your secret weapon for design ideas and advice. This is where things get a little tricky. Many designers like to work in secret. For you, it means getting a free consultation. In exchange, you‚Äôll likely need to share your designs with a little friend for your newest project.
Here are 4 places you can find design consultants to help with your projects. 1. Freelancer and Guru. Here‚Äôs where you can find and hire freelancers that fit your needs, like a web designer, graphic designer etc. Be sure to ask for feedback or ideas in your project post or in the comment section of the freelancer‚Äôs profile. Don‚Äôt forget to give your freelancers feedback. 2. Upwork and Freelancer. Like Guru, these sites are marketplaces for freelancers, which means you can find and communicate more easily with designers from anywhere around the globe. 3. Twitter. You can search for hashtags like #designtips, #webdesign etc and ask designers about your feedback.
#freelanchers, #screencaps, #feedback, #consultants, #tips Get infront of people with their attention focused on you. 2. It was _so dark_, it was so dark.  I have often remarked that the moon is never quite dark.

II. Combine the fragments of sentences into clear sentences.

1. They asked if he was home and the mother told _us_ he wasn't there, for she had called him up to see if he was sick.  I said no, he couldn't be sick, his voice wasn't sick.

3. The other ladies wanted to have a private talk with her; they sent the children out of the room and the man and I sat.

1. The man went out as usual; then I noticed _he was_ absent and wondered.  There were two or three persons absent who would have been there if they had been on the street; they were all old friends whom you would have thought would have called to say they were on the street.  One or two were known to have been sick and others would always have come and asked if they were sick.  I was at work, and at first I didn't think anything of his absence; but it was so unexpected that it became _unusual_; for it was so unusual that a man didn't come home at ten o'clock.  Then to keep at work seemed very strange to me; it didn't _seem right_.

2. So I began _to think_.  I know now that I have been mistaken; I wasn't quite so _wise_ as I thought I was--that is, I had _been_ wise; then I am _not_ wise.  They say one can never be wise, that is, one who is wise all of his life.  I think they think that's so; but they think that I and all of us who are wise, have been wise all of our lives--that we have been _wise_ from birth, but that no one _becomes_ wise.  I don't think that, I am _not_ wise.  I have never known until now, what it is to know.  I have always had a notion in my head; I thought _that_ was _knowledge_.  I _know_ now what it is to know.

3. I _don't_ know, but I _do_ know that if I had known, that when the man went out ten o'clock, I would have known then something was wrong, for he never took his book away; but I didn't.  I think I _could_ know now, but I don't; for no one could know now, until there is something more to know, and then you know; and that man who used to be so wise--so very wise once, might be very wise now if he were in my place; but he isn't; for he is not in my place.
